Title: Oasis Bay Party Tours
Description: A lot has changed since my last trip but the way of good management prioritize for a fun experience. We took a 3-hour trip from Hanoi to the harbor and were transfered by a speedboat that was super fun! The cruise was set up with a cozy jacuzzi and a big trampoline that fits for around 20 partiers with upbeat music and cool drinks available almost all the time! The kayaking and swimming activities were super fun and our guide Viktor, did an amazing drone photograph profession which is an unique experience that we don't see much while travelling. Title: Hieutour Co., Ltd
Description:
The best experience ever in Can Tho thanks to Thao (our tour guide) and to Ngan (our tour operator. Both fluent english speakers are very professional, friendly and kind. We really enjoyed our tour in the floating market and the rice noodle and chocolate factories and the cannals were very beautiful. Besides, going on a small tour was key to live a more local and better experience in the floating market. Apart from being very professional in their jobs they are also very nice people who unintentionally helped us as much as they could with other issues such as booking a sleeping bus, etc. They were there for us at anytime with a smile on their faces and we really appreciated.

It is an experience you cannot miss and do not leave Vietnam without meeting them. If you have the opportunity, reach then, book their tour (Hieu's tours) and have a meal at their restaurant (Hieu's cottage). You won't regret it for sure!! It is a win win. Thanks a lot guys for making our stay in Can Tho an unforgettable experience!

With love,
Tomeu and Caterina

Title: Hoi An Motorbike Adventures
Description:
I went on the full day Hoi An and Beyond tour. As there were no group tours on my chosen date I paid an extra $30USD for a private tour. I also paid a $30USD surcharge for a Honda CRF300L as I'm fairly tall and not the lightest. (I ride a Husky 511) To my pleasant surprise the bike was brought to the hotel and right from the start my guide Tony (Minh) dove right into endless back lanes, across narrow rice paddy tracks and through small townships as we threaded our way through the outer suburbs of Da Nang. I'm an experienced long time road and dirt rider and I think Tony was testing me to see where we could go! I don't think we stuck completely to the script and I'm grateful for that.

After a quick coffee we headed up Hai Van Pass. Beautiful scenery over Da Nang Bay. The twisties were great and after a drink and photo op at the top we headed down the other side to have lunch at the beach overlooking Lang Co Bay.

The return trip was no less enjoyable - zooming down the twisties, then taking the beach road. We stepped the bikes up onto a very narrow pedestrian/rail bridge and again veered off, diving into a maze of back roads and laneways. as we headed south through Da Nang. We took a breather at the picturesque Han River Dragon Bridge before heading back through busy downtown Da Nang. Our final stop was a beautiful buddhist temple behind the Marble Mountains. You wouldn't know it was there unless a guide took you. We arrived back to the hotel just after 4pm.

Overall impressions? I loved it. Tony was an excellent guide and seemed to know what I wanted. He appeared to know Da Nang like the back of his hand. We covered around 180km. It's probably not the cheapest gig in town, but nor do you want that. It was 100% professional, the bike was late model & in excellent condition. It was worth paying the extra $60USD for a bigger bike and private tour. Pre-trip comms with HAMA from Australia was excellent (thanks Simone!)

Final note: HAMA requires a D/L plus international permit, although I was never asked to produce it. Also a 300cc is unlikely to be covered under any standard travel insurance. It is what it is and I felt I was in very safe hands - thanks again Tony! I'd like to go back and do a longer tour but in the meantime I cannot recommend HAMA highly enough.

It was an amazing experience and a wonderful day in family. We enjoyed cycling and kayaking in rural and local areas, where we have been able to take a taste of the authentic rural Vietnamese culture.

Thanks a lot to Bao, our guide, which has been the best guide ever. He told us a lot about Vietnamese history, culture and traditions.

The best decision!

Title: Ha Giang Adventure
Description:
I will start by saying I am very lucky to have chosen Ha giang adventures.

The small group, the chill vibes, the amazing caring and respectful tour guides. They all spoke very well English looked out for me well, you donâ€™t even need a break because the program was so relaxed and yet to see everything from the loop. I felt like I was meditating when riding behind Chinh and looking at the mesmerising nature. The guest houses we stayed in felt like home the moment we were welcomed by the hosts, so much delicious food and drinks were provided you felt so satisfied form every aspect at the end of everyday.

Needles to say what a good drivers the guys were. I am a bit anxious when it comes to motorbike but thanks to Chinh I let go of both hands and just enjoyed the freedom and the beautiful changing scenery.

If you want to join a trip with honest people that become your family , take care of you respect you and your needs show you all the hidden gems of the loop then Ha giang adventures is a MUST.

Thank you Uncle Chinh (note I am older than him but because of his gentle and caring nature)

Thank you Don Lai (for the laughs stories and sharing your experiences with us)

Thank you Monk Phong ( he is not an official monk yet ) but it doesnâ€™t make him less holy.

Thank you for the boss, the man who made sure that everything starts and ENDS perfectly.

We didnâ€™t say goodbye, we said until we meet one day âœ¨â¤ï¸ğŸŒ¿

Bless you

Title: Vietnam Travel Expert
Description:
We did a half day city tour of Hanoi earlier this month ..it was a great experience..our guide was a young energetic lady name Kathy..she explained everything so clearly and took us to the Ba Dinh square ..we saw the Ho Chi Minh mausoleum..we could not go in as it was closed for the annual maintenance and also it was in the afternoon â€¦but we enjoyed the walk ..saw the imperial palace ,the wooden house which Ho Chi Minh stayed ,one pillar pagoda â€¦the whole place for so magical â€¦we visited the temple of literature ..we wanted to buy some paintings and Kathy took us to a lovely shop â€¦all of us bought beautiful paintings â€¦we spent so much of time there and then went for the cyclo ride ..it was fabulous going around the lanes of the old quarters â€¦thoroughly enjoyed ourselves ..
Kathy took us to a coffee shop as we wanted to try Vietnamese coffee ..it was a fantastic day ..
We really enjoyed having Kathy as our guide ..Thank you

Title: Eco Nature Travel
Description:
I found Eco Nature Tours via google search and seek help from Bich Nhien (Wendy) to help me plan my 5 days 4 nights trip.
The only request I have was vegetarian food. The rest I leave it to her.
Trust me, booking tour via Eco Nature Travels are best decision ever.
Very yummy vegetarian food, super punctual tour guide and driver, the hotels were very clean and close by to nearby attractions and local food, the suggested activities was perfect and not tiring at all.
Please contact Bich Nhien (Wendy) from Eco Nature and do request for the best tour guide Mr Hau. He was very kind, humble and he made sure I am safe throughout my stay in Hoi An. Very nice guy!
I will definitely come back again to visit more places in Vietnam.

Title: VietLong Travel

This was a bucket list item for me and it did not disappoint. Our guides KC and Chan, the scenery, the meals the accommodation and the experiences were all 10/10. We even celebrated a milestone birthday along the way.

A must do with a group of friends!!!!!

Title: Blue Dragon Tours - Day Tours
Description: Ms Ly An at Vietnam Tours/Blue Dragon Tours is a treasure. She curated an exceptional tour given the limited time we had after our hike to Everest Base Camp in Nepal. She was able to make changes on short notice and kept in touch on WhatsApp so was able to inform us of flight changes or just check in as needed. The guides were friendly and knowledgeable. The drivers and transport via car was great, I can't imagine driving myself in Vietnam. The hotels were all very comfortable with friendly staff and a generous breakfast buffet each morning. We started in Saigon, went to Can Tho where we enjoyed the floating market and time on the river. I loved Danang and BaNa Hills. My one regret is not having an extra day to just enjoy the beach and ocean in Danang. Hoi An was amazing and the lit boats at night are magical. Halong Bay was beautiful. The staff on the Amanda was friendly and helpful and I had the best iced coffee yet on board. The food on board was unfortunately not as good as I experienced just about everywhere else in the country and there was water leaking from somewhere that ended up in our cabin. The cabin was otherwise clean and comfy. In Hanoi we enjoyed a fun water puppet show and I loved touring the Japanese, Chinese and Vietnamese temples. One of the highlights of this tour was seeing the beautiful temples and statues throughout the country. The food was great especially the abundance of tropical fruit. I also loved the mosaics in both Can Tho and Hanoi. I highly recommend Vietnam Tours/Blue Dragon Tours if you are planning a visit to Vietnam.

Title: Sapa Hmong Family Trekking Adventures
Description: Everything was amazing because of the amazing hosts, location and wonderful landscape! When I arrived in Sapa town it was cold, misty and wet (a contrast to the city of Hanoi) and I was collected by Sung (Father/husband of the family). We had a 25-30min wet and windy motorbike ride from the town, down to the village where the weather had cleared. At arrival to the house I simply cried at the shear beauty of the landscape and could not believe how lucky I was to be in such a beautiful part of the world. I did a couple of treks, one with Sung, one with his wife Chan. The stay is like staying with family or friends, not a posh hotel and so much better for it. It has what you need and no more, because you are there for the experience of the villagers and I was so privileged to eat and stay with the family and share a glimpse into their lives. I enjoyed it so much, that we all went on a mini break together to Phu Quoc the following week. We have become a new family. Both Chan and Sung are so hospitable and their three beautiful children made the whole experience/stay that much better for me "Uncle Lawrence". The location is fantastic, the real local food is amazing and I hope to return again at Xmas to celebrate with them and their wider family, who I got to know during my stay. The Hoang Family epitomise the Vietnamese hospitality. I was a solo traveller in a country I'd never visited before, but I was never alone because of the welcoming arms of the beautiful nation. Thank you!!!! See you soon! Comfort, I only put a smiley face, only because I prefer a slightly softer bed. Not complaining, just to inform the reader. But from my stay in Vietnam over that 4 weeks, I'd say 90% of hotel beds were also on the firm side (same as in Thailand). But you won't care once you experience the place. Hope this helps. Cheers

Title: Vietnam Nomad Trails - Tour trong nga?y
Description:
We did a 1 day trip to Ta Phin village, followed next day by a trip to Bac Ha market. We really enjoyed our two day trip with our guide May Van as she showed us the county side and 3 villages, including hers. The trekk to Ta Phin is less crowded than the other ones, so barely any tourists and the views are amazing.
Homestay was good as we enjoyed herbal bath and dinner with the family.
Recommend to do the market of Bac Ha (come early to fully enjoy it).
So it was a well organized trek by Nomad Trails and May Van was no nice and experienced. Dha answered all our questions patiently. She also made sure we made it to our bus and stayed with us to wait for it.

Title: Innoviet Travel
Description: Innoviet are a great company, hugely helpful and reliable. We are a UK family of 4 - with teenagers whose interest in history is variable at best - but our guide Hai did a fantastic job in holding everyone's interest throughout the trip! Knowledge, enthusiastic and friendly, Hai brought everything to life in an easy to understand way. And special shout out too to Trung in the office, who was so kind and helpful!! Ben Duoc is fascinating. We virtually had the place to ourselves. Some of us went into the tunnels, one or two didn't fancy it, all very easy either way. We got a real sense of the 'The American War', all in all a great trip! Highly recommended.

Title: Vietnam Cycle Tours
Description: We decided somewhat last-minute to take this cycling trip in Vietnam. We booked too late to join a group for a pre-scheduled time period but Tung was able to accommodate our schedule for a private/custom guided tour, with Tung as driver, Sarane as bicycle guide, my husband and me. Everything about our experience was top-notch. Tung's English is excellent so communication was never a problem. He booked us into excellent hotels in perfect locations. Sarane was a great guide, always ready with thorough explanations about customs, culture, history food, geography; and was great at accommodating our cycling pace. They were always punctual and very well organized; he was really on top of all the details. The bikes were high-quality Specialized mountain bikes in excellent condition, very well-maintained. There were no schedule problems or hiccups. Everything went smoothly. The entire trip was very relaxed, social and enjoyable. We also learned that our trip with Vietnam Bicycle Travel cost less than half of what larger, US-based companies are charging for large groups. Tung's company is a bargain and well worth every penny!

Title: Da Nang Easy Riders
Description: What can I say. There are two benefits to arriving in Da Nang by train. The first is the spectacular scenery that awaits you on the final leg of the journey. The second is Mr T meeting you at the station. He and his son Mini T have given me one of the best welcomes and one of the best experiences I've had in Vietnam. If you're spending the day (or longer) on the back of someone's bike you need to make sure they are people you want to hang out with - and you want to hang out with these guys. Title: Phat Tire Ventures
Description: After a bit of a false-start we had a great trip with the excellent driver Mr. Phu and guide Mr. Giang. My traveling partner and I were not comfortable with our first guide but the company were very responsive and made the trip work for us. Mr Giang was affable, patient, and very knowledgeable. We are not athletes but were game for the trip and Mr Giang found the best routes, added some sight seeing, took us through beautiful farms, jungles, mountains, and rural areas on our 6 day bike ride to Hoi An. My travel companion has food allergies which were accommodated without censure. There were lots of snacks, bottled water, cool cloths when we stopped provided by the ever cheerful Mr. Phu. Highly recommend this outfit for any of their activities - I know they'll work with you to make the trip what you want.

Wat een heerlijke dag! We zijn in de ochtend heel vroeg weg gegaan om samen met Tu de My Son Sanctuary te bezoeken! We zijn om 05:00 uur in de ochtend vertrokken per motor! Daarvoor hebben we in Hoi An nog even de lokale market bezocht en daar mooie uitleg bij gekregen!

Daarna was het tijd om via prachtige kleine weggetjes richting My Son te rijden. Met Tu kwam je echt overal en hij wist elk weggetje achteraf en dat maakt het zo leuk! Ook bij My Son kan hij je alles vertellen! Het was een super geslaagde dag en dit is zoveel persoonlijker dan een bus als Tour, 100x leuker!

Tu super bedankt voor deze indrukwekkende Tour!

Title: Real Sapa
Description: We did a 3 day, 2 night trek and it was the highlight of our 2 week trip to Vietnam. The homestay portion was so authentic and gave us a real glimpse into what life in the village is like. The 2nd night we stayed at the Sapa Farmstay and it was LOVELY. Gorgeous scenery, incredible food and such a warm and welcoming family. If you're looking for gorgeous scenery, a cultural experience and a fun few days, book this trip! You won't regret it.

Title: Tommy's Travel Service in Ninh Binh
Description: Tommyâ€™s was amazing! We set up drivers for my friend and I to take us to several spots around Ninh Binh like Trang An, dragon lookout, and several temples. The guides were on time and were so sweet! Easy to communicate with through Google translate. Additionally, we were in a pinch trying to get to the Hanoi airport the next morning and Tommy saved the day! We thought we would be able to take a Grab but none were available and we were going to miss your flight. I went out on a limb and texted Tommy and just like that, he replied in 2 minutes and had a private driver sent to our hostel within 30 mins at a very reasonable price. Really responsive and easy to set anything up. Loved the service and highly recommend!

Title: Sapa Tribal Trekking
Description:
My family (mum and grandma) and I did the 2D1N trek and consider it the highlight of our Vietnam trip. The scenery was beautiful and the guidance on cultural significance/history by our guide Giang really elevated the whole experience.

We picked the â€œmoderateâ€ level hike and found it the perfect level of difficulty to feel a good workout, however some parts were quite difficult due to rain making the ground slippery - however my (very fit) 79 year old grandma managed both days really well so itâ€™s certainly accessible to anyone with good mobility and balance.

I would like to add a big big thank you to Giang for sharing with us many personal stories and brining a positive vibe throughout.

Title: KingKong Adventures
Description:
I did the three day tour from Dalat to Mui Ne with two of my friends, and it was definitely the highlight of our trip to Viet Nam. Not only were the views breathtaking, but the food, and experiences were like nothing else. We tried so many different Vietnamese cuisines that we would not of tried otherwise, on this trip. As for the experiences, we got an insight into how local people, as well as minority groups/tribes, live their daily lives. All of the people we met were incredibly welcoming and friendly.
There were no other tourists along the route, it truly is a hidden gem.

As for the service, our easy riders and tour guides made it unforgettable. They were extremely knowledgeable about the varies places weâ€™d visit, as well the different cultures, traditions and history of Vietnamese people. They were also extremely friendly and welcoming, making the tour unforgettable.

I would highly recommend this trip for anyone who visits Viet Nam. It is the best way to properly see this part of the country.

Staff were wonderful and just had to ask. Cocktails were great and plenary of happy hours. Rooms very spacious. Food was good but vet Vietnamese so maybe ask for soecual requests if you have children or a picky eater. Overall great experience.

Title: Cat Ba Climbing
Description:
We went to Cat Ba Island to try some of the beautiful climbs. Because we were travelling by scooter, we decided not to bring our own equipment and rent some from the local Climbing business CAT BA CLIMBING. This way, we thought it would also be a good way to invest money with the locals and help the economy.
Julie who works there was very lovely, but the owner Mr Zoom (Nguyen Manh Dung) had a very bad attitude towards us and seemed to take an instant dislike to us and we had no idea why. He told us we had to do â€œa testâ€ before renting his equipment which is understandable. However, his short practice wall in his business is not suitable for the test as it is very cramped when you get to the top with a low ceiling and you canâ€™t even lean back to do your set up, as Mr Zoom told us himself it is not solid enough to take weight, so you have to do everything one handed â€“ impossible! He then started shouting at us in front of all his staff who looked embarrassed and refused to hire us his equipment instead of having a rational discussion about different ways of operating and why my partner did what he did when attempting to set up/lower off. Mr Zoom has a very big ego, with a poor and unprofessional attitude. It seems that he canâ€™t cope with people having the same or more experience than him or doing things differently.
This guy really had a bee in his bonnet. I would not recommend climbing with him or his company if you have some experience. Just do it by yourself!
Rank_of_province: S? 14 trÃªn 84 Chuy?n tham quan & ho?t ??ng ? Ca?t Ba?

She was able to answer our questions precisely. We highly recommend ?

Title: Eco Foot
Description: Our family was picked up at the hotel without knowing more than that we would hike in the jungle and get to visit the wild life rescue center. However, we were pleasantly surprised that the experience provided so much more in terms of Vietnam's history, its amazing culture and an insight into the fine work being done to save and return wildlife to its natural environment. We chose a private tour and received great service all day. The views were breathtaking and the lunch the chefs prepared in the middle of the jungle was fantastic. The children saw fantastic animals and were deeply impressed that the guides sometimes had to use machetes to cut through the jungle. We warmly recommend this country and this experience to anyone who wants to be part of an adventure that will stay in the mind for a lifetime. Our children, we are from Sweden, thought this was the best trip we have ever done - we will be back!

Title: The Terrible Tour Guide Travel
Description:
I met Joey on one of the travel groups in facebook. He is very kind and professional organising everything, always ready to answer any question on whatsapp.
He assisted us with the recommendation letter to get VOA and we also got transfers that he arranged for us. The most amazing experience was the food walking tour in Hanoi with Benjamin. He took us to every single spot to eat the most delicious food and also share his knowledge not only about food but history. It was like going out with a friend. We really enjoyed the experience.
We ended up the evening having a drink at the train street and it was fantastic.
Joey runs his travel agency very professionally, he is trustable and We cannot wait to go back to Vietnam and do some hikes with him.
Next time I promise to take the present and not forgetting it at home dear Joey! All the best and keep going! Sorry I took forever to write my review!

I loved that he told us realities of the impact of tourism but still encouraged to keep trying to smile every time we said no to locals to not discourage them. We loved it so much, we went back to the ancient house to try some of the delicious white roses of the owners of the beautiful house and they were exquisite. Definitely recommend!

Title: Zonitrip - Day Tours
Description: Very great and very recommendable trekking trip in the North of Vietnam. We enjoyed the beautiful landscapes, mountains, rice fields and to see how ethnic groups live in Vietnam. Nghia was a very nice guide and speaks English very well. She gave us a lot of detailed information about the local life and was also very interested on our lifes in Austria. The trekking routes were away from mass tourism in calm and peaceful locations. The homestays were very interesting (stilt houses, bamboo houses, houses made of mud). This trip is perfect for people, who would like to deeply enjoy the view of mountains, also rice fields and experience the cultural life of ethnic groups. We had our own nice car driver with a very comfortable car. Everything was well organized. We got a lot of Vietnamese food! Thank you Nghia for this great trip, we won't never forget.

Title: Pine Track Adventures
Description:
I was in Da Lat in November 2022 and wanted to go either trekking or canyoning. As they didnâ€™t have a trekking group that day, I joined the canyoning.

I chose Pine Track since they were recommended as a well-established, reliable option by my (older) travel guide book and appear to have survived the pandemic, which I thought was a good sign.

We were a rather small group (3 guests + 2 guides). The equipment was modern and everything was carried out with a high safety standard. One of the guides took photos of us with our phones and did a great job at that, so that I got some nice shots.

Unfortunately, I bruised my rips while (freely) jumping into the water. I was skeptical before and didnâ€™t wanna do it, but one of the guides still convinced me. The injury was mostly due to my fault, but it still deteriorated the experience for me. Fortunately, the pain ceased quickly.

Title: Hoi An Guided Tours
Description:

A very easy cycle in Which Tai organised Chilld seats for our q and 4 yr old .Children.The aactivities were really fun and our kids loved their interactions with the buffalo and the basket boat ride.The cooking was fun and the full lunch provided was plentiful.

Title: Amazing Travel Corp
Description: Our guide (Felix) was excellent, so friendly, and knowledgeable. We started the day with a group doing the two-day one-night tour and they branched off about half way through our day, but their guide (Tom) was also excellent based on our interactions. The luxury bus for transport had comfortable seats, leg room, and functioning AC. They always had water available for us. The activities (hiking, biking, temple) were enjoyable as well as educational. The trip to a local family's home was especially unique and memorable- the family was so kind, so welcoming and excited to see us, and we enjoyed seeing the local Vietnamese side of life. And the lunch was outstanding. There was so much food we couldn't finish it all, which is impressive for my husband and I. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip and will certainly recommend to others traveling here!

When I spoke to a few other people from our hostel who had done a bus tour they said they didnâ€™t learn half as much as we did doing the tour with Lao. From the way the Vietnamese soldiers dressed, to the way the tunnels operated in the war time, Lao knew it all! Would strongly recommend this tour to anyone interested in the history of the Cu Chi tunnels. Thank you Lao!

Title: Danang Hoian Private Tour
Description:
A tour like no other! This was our 3 rd time in Hoi An and we saw more and learned more on this tour than anything else we had done. Driving around in a local motobike and seeing the countryside of Hoi An is truly a once in a life time experience. We went to places you just couldnâ€™t find or would never know about unless you were with a true local. Our tour guide Tea was the BEST tour guide we have ever encountered in our many travels. Her knowledge, joy, humor, kindness and photo taking skills just made the whole experience so much more memorable. I donâ€™t want to spoil the itinerary too much but it is unique and varied and the included lunch is delicious. Our driver Kool was a legend too!
101% recommended for young and old and well worth the price!

Title: Legend Travel Group
Description: And an absolutely amazing vacation! We had the best time on this tour. It was completely private for us and we were treated like royalty! It was comprehensive and covered everything we would ever want to see; from historical sites to adventurous snorkeling, we did it all. Danny, our tour organizer was simply amazing. He communicated the entire time, and once we reached Hanoi, he greeted us at the hotel every day, and made sure that we were taken care of. Any questions I had, no matter what country, he dealt with promptly. As two ladies, traveling alone, I felt secure and safe at all times. Every tour guide in every city was phenomenal. We were promptly picked up at every airport, and comfortably taken to our hotel, which was always above our expectations. Legend tour did not cut corners. They gave us the best. The tour guideâ€™s in every city really were wonderful. Each one was very caring and did the best to care for our every need. If there was anything we ever needed, they would often handle it. Even a simple thing like doing a particular activity that my daughter wanted to do, the tour guide, would make every effort to make it happen. I have zero issues with anything, everything was simply perfect. If you are thinking of traveling to Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia or Thailand, please use Legend Travel . They are simply the best. I am so glad we used this to a great for our adventure of a lifetime.

Title: Vietnam Easy Rider
Description:
I would 110% recommend this tour. There is no better way to spend a day in Danang. One of the best days Iâ€™ve had traveling, ever. I feel having a guide was well worth it so that you can safely stare at the gorgeous scenery.
.

My guide, Trung, was a friendly, safe, and knowledgeable driver. Very easy to be with, and I would definitely do a longer tour with him! You can really tell he is an experienced motorbike tour guide who has a passion for helping people experience the beauty of Vietnamese land and people. The tour schedule and itinerary was flexible, he gave me plenty of time to stop where I wanted. He also gave me several great local recommendations for our lunch stop.

10/10, itâ€™s a must do if you visit Vietnam.

Title: Freebird Adventures
Description:
I went in a 8 day bike tour with Mihn, as a rider with little riding experience. It was an awesome trip. Mihn knows exactly what he's doing, he'll help you order vietnamese food that he knows you'll like, he gives the trip the exact amount of adventure that is challenging, but fun and always safe, and the accomodations are top notch. Also if you are that not experienced like me, he'll teach you a lot.

The price is all included, and at an incredible price for that.

If you are on the fence about going with Freebird adventures, do it. You will not regret it. I cannot think a better way to discover Vietnam.
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 181 trÃªn 960 Hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng ngoÃ i trá»i á»Ÿ HÃ  Ná»™i

Title: Hoi An Motorcycle Easy Rider Tours - Tony Van
Description:
We did the Hai Van pass, including multiple stops along the way, easy rider day trip with Mr. Bat and it was amazing. Mr. Bat and his friend Phu(?) were very friendly, and had extensive knowledge of the areas we ventured to. Stopped for a delicious lunch by the sea before heading back, which was one of the best meals weâ€™ve had in Asia.

We normally ride our own motorbike in Asia but it was nice for a change to not have to worry about navigating, driving etc and just being able to soak up the scenery. Both of us felt safe the whole way as Mr. Bat and Phu are extremely competent at what they do.
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 61 trÃªn 314 Hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng ngoÃ i trá»i á»Ÿ Há»™i An

Title: Ethnic Travel - Day Tours
Description:
Using Ethnic travel is a great way to explore North Veitnam. Our guide Nghi was awesome, we trekked everyday and these were very challenging walks in the heat and humidty - but Nghi was a great guide who got us through! He taught us lots as bout the different ethnuc minorities in Vietnam and the flora/fauna and culture.

Thu at the office is very knowledgeable and will help you tailor a trip to your requirments.

We stayed in many different homestays which were all perfect for us. The food they provided is good and they were able to cater for me being vegetarian too. Most homestays had A/C, WiFi and private bathrooms so were well equipped! Our favourites were the Ethnic Travel Homestay in Ninh Binh and one in Ha Giang.

Our driver Tuang was excellent at navigating the difficult roads in Ha giang, I felt very safe with him.

The trip worked out about 70GBP per person per day which for transport, a driver, a guide, accommodation and all meals is good value.

We travelled as a pair alone with our guide for 8/11 days and on 3 days were with another couple. Amazing that the group sizes were so small.

If I came back to Vietnam I wouldn't hesitate to use Ethnic Travel again. If you are thinking of going to Ha Giang (you must - it is the most beautiful part of Vietnam), Ethnic Travel can help you navigate thr region without renting a motorbike, which is what most other tour companies provide.

Title: Vietnam Adventure Cycling
Description:
It was an amazing experience. Started our day at 8Am and during the journey our tour guide Duc shared many things about Vietnam. This was totally new learnings for us. Learning from him about their culture, food, and the local area and majorly the history of Vietnam was very much exciting.
We visited Handicap market, chi chi Tunnels,Bamboo factory, Coconut factory, Mekong delta and an Island nearby to Mekong delta where we ended our day.
The day went well.

Cáº£m Æ¡n Ã´ng bÃ , anh ChÃ¹, chá»‹ Chá», anh Dinh, chá»‹ An, RÃ¹a, Viá»‡t, báº¡n Ä‘á»“ng hÃ nh Nga BÃ¹i, má»i ngÆ°á»i vÃ  háº¹n gáº·p láº¡i áº¡.
â€”â€”
15 days at Indigenous Homestay is an impressive and amazing experience.
Everything here is provided at the most basic level: eat - sleep - clean hygiene, the seasoning is usually just salt and MSG, no TV, air conditioner or fan (there is still hot and cold water). Then I know that I really don't need too many things, my life still goes on and keeps comfortable. Everyday routine: cooking, listening to family stories, gathering around the fire and eating roasted sweet potatoes when the weather gets cold, every afternoon take Mickey for a walk in the terraced fields near homestay, learn basic H'mong sentences, â€¦ are all beautiful and unforgettable memories.
The tours of their family and Mr. Dinh are really interesting, lots of good information. Go to catch ticks with Rua, Viet and children in village, go to the stream to catch fish; harvest wild honey in the forest; go to beautiful view points around Mu Cang Chai are really worthwhile experience. Btw wild honey is very good.
Hope to be able to return in the other seasons such as the ripe rice season to harvest rice with the family, the apple season to see grandpa knitting a chair, the Lunar New Year season to see how everyone enjoy after a whole year of working.
Thank to grandparents, Mr. Chu, Ms. Cho, Mr. Dinh, Ms. An, Rua, Viet, my soulmate Nga and others do that I can have a wonderful trip.
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 1 trÃªn 1 Äá»“ Äƒn & Äá»“ uá»‘ng á»Ÿ Mu Cang Chai

Title: Uncle Sam Tours
Description:
Special thanks to Hoa(flower) our tour guide who was super friendly and knowledgeable. With her it never felt like we have a guide it felt like we are on tour with one of our local friends .

We were 6 people and she made sure that she gels up with everyone.

Coming to the tour , it was very well organised and everything started on the given time and driver and tour people were super friendly.

My Son, is one of the underrated places in Vietnam, I really enjoyed the whole campus. Performance by the local artists was awesome. It was fun filled tour with mix of ruins, rich history and performance my local artists

Title: Dragon Bikes
Description:
I contacted Dragon bikes a month before to arrange my XR 150, a great model. There is a wide range to select from. Would advise giving more time so you can secure it confidently.

Picked up the bike, it was in great condition and I immediately adored it! You can opt in for insurance which pretty much covers everything, just make sure you change the oil as instructed.

We went all the way up to the Chinese border and did over 3000km. Not a single issue the whole trip until around 40km out from my final destination, I noticed a change in sound of the bike. Immediately pull over and contacted Patrick and he gave me the support needed to get the bike back and repaired. Sending back to Ho chi Minh was as simple as it gets!

Overall, the service, country knowledge of routes, competative prices and personable nature from Patrick makes him unmatched in the industry. If your thinking about doing the trip then you simply have to hire from Dragon Bikes. It was the greatest adventure of my life so far.

Title: Guide Francophone Vietnam
Description:
Nous avons fait un trek de 4 jours en compagnie de Pham et avons dormi pendant 3 jours dans sa maison Amica House, maison dâ€™hÃ´tes tenue par sa femme.
Le trek fut incroyable ! Chaque jour faisait place Ã  de nouveaux paysages de riziÃ¨res toujours plus beaux les uns que les autres.
On aurait dit des paysages de cartes postales !

Par ailleurs, nos marches sont accompagnÃ©es des explications de Pham qui est un vietnamien qui vit auprÃ¨s des Hmong et des Zay et qui nous raconte pleins dâ€™anecdotes et nous explique les coutumes de ces peuples des montagnes.

En ce qui concerne notre accueil Ã  Amica House, nous avons Ã©galement Ã©tait trÃ¨s bien accueillis par sa femme qui cuisine super bien ! Notre chambre avait la vue sur les riziÃ¨res dans le trÃ¨s beau village de Lao Chai et le soir nous mangions avec Pham, sa femme et les autres hÃ´tes et nous buvions des coups tous ensemble !

Nous vous recommandons vraiment de passer chez eux et de prÃ©voir quelques jours de trek avec Pham, il feront de votre voyage au Vietnam le plus beau des souvenirs !

Antoine et Clarisse

Title: Rent A Bike Vietnam
Address: 15 Äáº·ng Thai Mai Quáº­n TÃ¢y Há»“, HÃ  Ná»™i 100000 Viá»‡t Nam
Description:
Best spent money in Vietnam.
After looking around for a good motorbike rental we eneded up renting at Rentabike Vietnam. Best choice. Wide range of options. From automatic to proper gear motorbike. All in good conditions. The straff is very helpful but the icing on the cake is Danny, the owner. When we went to choose our bike we met him. Very friendly he asked a few questions about our travle plans and started drawing us a map with many valuable tips. We kept in contact with him for updates on the road conditions and options to peruse. You can tell he is very passionate about what he does. I am sure that if we did go on a tour with him (it is an option) we would have had a great time as well.
Thank you Rentabike Vientnam for making our trip in the north unforgettable.

Title: Halong Bay Tours
Description:
Booked a Halong Bay cruise (Swan Cruise), loved everything but... via Halong Bay Tours.
Positive: Our private transfer to Hai phong airport was smooth, we requested to leave two hours after the cruise ended, so we would not have to wait 4 hours in the airport. There wasn't much to see in walking distance from the port and we had just eaten another good dinner, so did not use the restaurants, but had a walk and a drink in the port (very quiet after the cruises had left).
Negative: The communication with the booking agency was not amazing. Every time it was a different person who replied, they did not reply to my questions and did not give me the information I asked for. I plan our trips myself, therefore I am a very demanding customer (I want details!), and the information regarding transfer on the HP, did not match the information I was received after booking. We had to leave 8.00 in the morning for the cruise, which embarked 13.30, a trip which takes about 2-2Â½ hours. They did not tell me why, but it is because they schedule a shopping stop after reaching Halong. It did not figure on the itinerary given (I think we wouldn't be the only ones to questions this stop), it was sold by the guide as a restroom/refreshments stop, we never got ANY kind of refreshments, but was ushered into a very depressing building with very boring assembly rooms with bad chairs. We guess, to receive as spiel about the products they sold in the shop, locally produced. We didn't want to hear a spiel in that dreary room, found nothing of interest in the shop and waited standing outside for the rest of the group. It was sold as a 30 min. stop, but took 95 min. And then it took 5 min. to reach the port. If we could have waited in the port, it would at least have been more pleasant.
Oh yeah, and the schedule said pickup from our hotel 8.15-8.45, which was changed to 8.00 the evening before (I did not see the change until morning). And the guide was waiting for us at 7.45. So we really loved that we had to rush check-out, without time for coffee, just to sit 95 min. waiting outside a shop (again NO COFFEE!).

We bevelen haar dan ook voor de volle 100% aan als je reisplannen Hanoi doorkruisen.

Title: Dmz Tours
Description:
We booked a full day tour through our hotel, and visited the main DMZ sites with Mr Duy.
Good points; overall we had a good day and Mr Duy was a lovely man with some good anecdotal stories about life during the war. The driver was also great, very safe and we had no issues.

However, there were a few negatives we should mention. We already had some knowledge about the war from reading beforehand and visiting the museums in Ho Chi Minh City, and we were hoping this trip would add to that knowledge and give us some more detailed information about the various sites we visited. However, we asked several questions and Mr Duy wasnâ€™t able to answer them with any more information than was provided in the museum texts, and gave very vague, general responses. From reading previous reviews we assumed that the guide would have extensive knowledge about the military operations in the area and life in the tunnels and we were disappointed to find this wasnâ€™t the case. We had hoped the information given would be tailored to the knowledge/interest of the group and this certainly wasnâ€™t the case on our tour. At Khe Sanh, we were left to wander outside on our own and so we didnâ€™t get any insights into the base and couldnâ€™t answer any of questions about the ebb and flow of the siege that took place there.

We also specially asked to go to a local restaurant for lunch after reading previous reviews, but unfortunately we were brought to an expensive restaurant selling mediocre food with other tour groups.

All in all, we wished we had skipped the guide and gone on a cheaper tour and done the research ourselves, as we learnt more about the sites we visited and details about the war on Google during the drive home!

Title: Ancient Orient Journeys
Description:
We just returned from a once-in-a-lifetime trip arranged by Vinh of Ancient Orient Journeys. We went to Vietnam and Cambodia with 7 people in our family for a 2-week trip. The youngest traveler was age 6 and the oldest was age 63. Vinh did an incredible job incorporating activities that appealed to all ages in the group while making us feel like adventurers. We also felt like we learned a lot about the local culture from our guides, the sites we visited, and the activities. All of the hotels were 5-star and some literally made our jaw drop when we saw our rooms. The food was amazing, and our guides did a nice job of addressing food allergies and preferences.
Vinh also checked in with us throughout the trip. We were super impressed when he learned we were celebrating my parent's 40th anniversary and was able to arrange a nice surprise at the hotel the same day.

Title: Vietnam Tour Co.,Ltd
Description: I had travelled to Vietnam with my family in July 2023. I had contacted Vietnam Tours and Travels before my trip to arrange tours in Vietnam and Miss Minh helped me. She was very professional, extremely helpful and punctual. She sent me different itineraries that were budget friendly and also sorted out our visas to Vietnam. Their tours in Da Nang were really nice and well organised. The tour guides picked us up from the hotel and they were very good and knowledgeable. We had an awesome experience. Miss Minh coordinated with us very well and took note of all our details. I strongly recommend going through them. Thank you Miss Minh and Vietnam Tour Company.

Title: The Savage Dragon's Island Adventures
Description: Amazing experience! I was able to do spearfishing for the first time & fell in love with it. We were alone on an island and cooked what we caught (& some extra seafood). You can't beat that dinner at sunset. Not a "tourist tour" at all & I highly recommend getting in touch with Savage!

Title: Explore My Hoi An
Description: Of all the tours we have done in Vietnam, this was by far, my favourite. Because this is Sinh's own business, he makes you feel very welcome and tailors the trip to suit your interests and fitness level. We loved the scenery, the local people and boat ride. The market garden was beautiful and a special moment. But, THEN you arrive at Sinh's home and his beautiful wife Jessica just shines. Oh my goodness!!!! The fun we had cooking and eating beautiful food was the best!!! We laughed, we sang, we danced and left with full tummies and a warm heart. Thank you Sinh and Jessica for sharing a special day with us.

Title: Haivenu Tours
Description: We have just returned from our 4th trip to Vietnam and the 3rd time we have used the services of Haivenu. They are a very easy company to deal with and we have found them totally reliable. If youâ€™re thinking of traveling to vietnam, they are great to assist with internal transportation, by car, rail, aeroplane etc. making bookings where necessary. In past trips we have had many tours organized by Haivenu and they have always been exactly as communicated to us and always very enjoyable.

Title: Looking Glass Jeep Tours
Description: We had a great day with Mick, going by scooter! We headed up North via a new High Way not even taken into use yet and made some great pictures. He explained us a lot about the real Vietnamees people and let us swim in a hidden waterspring where only locals come. Then we went back via the east side, all the way up to Hai Van Pass. Mick showed us real bullets lying on the ground, coming from the war 50 years a go, where he knows a lot about. Heâ€™s a really kind and careful person!

Title: Footprint Travel
Description:
Footprint just wants to rob your money. We did the early morning Hanoi tour. They charge 65 USD per person and the tour definitely doesnâ€™t worth that amount. Itâ€™s a tour that you can actually do it by yourself, just check on the travel blogs about the early morning tour and ask help from the hotel to arrange a taxi and go for it. To visit the wholesale flower market and the whole sale fruits and vegetables market at 5am is very safe. Both places are busting of commercial activities at that time, with police patrolling the areas, so there is no risk or danger at all. You donâ€™t need such an expensive tour for this. Also, there is nothing really historical or cultural about this tour. After the visit of both markets you will have a stroll around the old quarter to see what you gonna see by yourself anyway. So. In conclusion, this tour lack of content to cost that much. In Vietnam thatâ€™s lots of money. You can even do a whole day Ha Long Bay for that price. Very bad footprint on trying to rob the tourist this way.
The tour guide was really nice and tried to do her best, but she even admitted that she thinks this tour is too expensive for the content it has.

Title: Cat Ba Kayak Adventures
Description:
Cat Ba Kayak Adventures had the perfect option for a self guided day of kayaking on Lan Ha Bay. We are experienced kayakers and were looking for an option that allowed us to spend as much time as possible on the water, without the many stops / structure of a tour.

This was perfect, we stopped by the pier mid day and quickly picked up kayaks. We were driven further out into the bay and agreed to return around sunset - that was all! From there we had the freedom to explore as much as we wanted. They were also great and gave us waters, hats, maps, etc. Definitely recommend.

Title: Mekong Eyes Cruise
Description:
We booked a 2-day Mekong Delta cruise with a transfer to and from Saigon. Our transfer was amazing, a luxury AC van to our boat in the Delta. Though we were supposed to be on a bigger boat with other people, we were upgraded and had a 2 cabin boat to ourselves.

My favorite thing about the cruise--the food. It was some of the best food we had in Vietnam! The chef was amazing!

I also enjoyed the orchard village tour, and seeing some of the things people do in the villages like making rice paper, puffed rice cakes, etc. Our guide Jonathan was great at explaining things.

I enjoyed being (and sleeping) on the Delta; its a special region!

I'd recommend this operator, hands-down.

Title: Hacoconut Boat Tour
Description:
Overall, a fantastic service and very enjoyable, smooth experience! ğŸ¤©ğŸ‘ I booked the package for the boat ride with lunch, and arranged it for a day before, thinking it might be too last minute, but I was pleasantly surprised by how well and efficiently they handled the whole process. All my queries about the package were well handled ( total price, process of bringing us) before I decided to confirm my booking via whatsapp.

Although they typically pick up within Hoi An, they accomodated to my needs to pick us up from further away outside of Hoi An. Even taking the extra step to help compare the prices to taking a Grab service and offered a lower price for the pickup and return trip.

The boat ride experience itself was satisfying and worth it! Couldn't have asked for a better experience! We did crab fishing, boat spinning and took many photos from the friendly and lovely boatriders who made our time so memorable. ğŸ«¶ğŸš£â€â™‚ï¸ The lunch provided after also had a good variety of local dishes.

ğŸ’«An additional service: My family also wanted to drop by to Hoi An Ancient town after the boat ride, so I requested if they were able to be included in the package and drop us there after. They were flexible and kind enough to accomodate to my needs! â˜ºï¸

Everything from the transport pickup from our hotel to the coconut boat ride, and including the drop off and pick up back home was extremely smooth.

Overall, it was very efficient, affordable, and I would definitely highly recommend the experience and service. The staff, the driver, the boat riders were always courteous, prompt, responsive and friendly and thank you to all of them for making our trip a memorable one. ğŸ™‡â€â™‚ï¸ğŸ¥° Would definitely reccommend Hacoconut! ğŸ¥¥

Title: Vietnam Cycling ToursÂ®
Description:
We took a trip with Vietnam backroads for my 50th birthday ten years ago and repeated with TWO trips for my 60th. Mr. Van and team did not disappoint - ABSOLUTELY thrilled with our experience! From helping us plan our bespoke itinerary to adapting along the way, the team at Vietnam Cycling Tours delighted us with their professionalism and flexibility. This review is for the Mekong Delta Trip, which included a week on the backend at La Veranda Resort on Phu Quoc. A perfect combination of biking and rest and relaxation. We biked about 25-35 miles per day and experienced small villages and rural areas that more visitors do not typically get to see. We enjoyed a nice balance of bucolic scenery during the day and the nightlife of smaller cities some of the evenings.

We found working directly with a company based in Vietnam and run by a Vietnamese team not only a MUCH better value than so many of the large bike companies (who hire companies like Mr. Van's anyway) but also a wonderful cultural experience not to be missed. The guides were super knowledgeable about the areas we biked through, in addition to being capable and professional bike guides. Whether you would like to bike 60 miles+ or do the 25-30 miles per day we did, you'll be in capable hands with this team. Because we requested it, Vietnam Backroads also arranged our week long trip on Phu Quoc at La Veranda Resort, the perfect place to unwind after the weeklong trip in the Mekong Delta.

We are grateful to Mr. Van and his team, especially our Mekong bike guide Dat, whose kindness and expertise we valued. Truly a wonderful trip!

Title: Pandaw River Expeditions
Description:
Looked like a very interesting Pandaw Vietnam river cruise and we originally booked in 2020. Then the Pandemic. They agreed to give a credit for another tour when possible. Then they bankrupted. Then they recapitalized and said they would apply our deposit on
another tour. When it was finally possible to do the trip in November of 2022, we paid the full trip amount of over $14,000.00. Their documentation stated cancellation would have to occur a month before scheduled travel. Two weeks
before the trip, my wife had a medical emergency with a dislocated hip and was unable to go on the trip on orders from doctors.
We had purchased trip insurance from Tripmate for $525 and filed a claim which was denied except for airline cancellation fees on fully refundable airline tickets. That amounted to about $1000. Pandaw would not offer a refund or even a credit for another trip citing their 30 day policy. As it stands, we are out $14,000.00 hard earned and difficult to replace. Pandaw is unjustly enriched $14,000.00. Tripmate is a fraud that needs to be sued but with cost of lawyers not possible unless some sort of class action since that seems to be their practice as we discovered too late.
Pandaw was rude when contacted nicely and did offer if we wanted another trip a modest discount. With their attitude and indifference to customer situations we would avoid them at all costs and advise you to do the same.

Title: Explore my Vietnam
Description: We had a super great day trip with Son and Tan. They are punctual, communicate well in English and they have a lot of local knowledge. my husband drove a motorcycle himself and has was guides between the other two bikes through heavy traffic in Da Nang, it was a very cool experience. We got to see a lot, while also having enough breaks along the way. Highly recommended. We were a family of 4, with two children aged 11 and 14 who also had a great trip. We have done a lot of fun in Vietnam but this was one of the best experiences.

Title: Authentic HALONG
Description:

Overall the crew is amazing! Davis was our designated waiter and did an amazing job. We were never thirsty, thanks Davis!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 12 trÃªn 83 PhÆ°Æ¡ng tiÃªÌ£n giao thÃ´ng á»Ÿ Vá»‹nh Háº¡ Long

Title: Origin Vietnam Travel
Description:
Origin Vietnam travel advisor Angela Thanh worked to customize this to Exactly our needs, wants, time frame and budget. I have been traveling since the mid-90s and this has NEVER happened. You guys are special.
The places we experienced, the amount of time we had for each and the overall pacing and variety were just amazing.
Mr. Tuy, our guide, was polite, informative, had answers to all questions and gave us a really great idea of what the Real Vietnam is. He was more like an informed travel buddy than a paid guide, which he was both. But he also gave us warnings, such as "When we get out of the car, there will be lot of women and girls trying to sell you something. Here's what to do..." Or, "I'll leave you here next to Sapa Station. Here's how you cross the traffic when cars and motorcycles are coming from every direction...."
Timelines: Communication was exceptional, from the moments before we got on the plane in Taipei until we said goodbye.
You know were didn't care for The View, BUT we LOVED SAPA and EVERY PLACE on the tour. Climbing up and down steps was challenging, especially CAT CAT, but that was part of the fun.
Balance, from the villages of Lao Chai to the hubbub of the Old Quarter of Hanoi, we just felt the electricity when we walked out the door., and we just felt alive every moment.
The Allure Hotel in Hanoi was perfect in every day, including the location, the room, the food and Especially the people who worked there. At the front desk, the woman Anna helped us set up Grab and we used it when we got far away at night. I loved pulling up a little blue stool and joining in really Vietnam life to have noodles on a summer night. You know what I mean.
I loved that we had free evenings in Sapa and Hanoi to explore, and we did. .
At Halong Bay, other than the cheap Kayaks, it was the experience of a lifetime. The captain, Mr. Ha Nguyen, and ALL the staff made this such a special experience. The people, including all Aspira workers, the excursions, activities and food were top - notch.
This company is 100 percent reliable. Our guide and driver met us at the airport and it was hard to say goodbye after a week

Title: My Easy Rider
Description: Suu Le and his friend picked us up at our hotel in Da Nang at 8am. He took care that our luggage was fixed safely on the motorbike. On our way to Hoi An he stopped at the marble mountains, Bana Hills, some local rice fields and various other points of interest. We felt safe during the whole ride and he really took care of us as well (offering cold water etc.). He explained a lot of things an gave local insights. The time schedule was very flexible and we arrived at around 5pm in Hoi an. We would recommend this tour for anyone looking for a trip outside of the city with reliable drivers and tour guides. Thanks again to both of you for this unforgettable adventure! :)

Title: AnyTrails
Description:
Thanks to AnyTrails, we had a really unique & tailor made return visit to Hanoi in November 2022.

We were keen on the local Market Garden tour, not cyclists at all but saw mention of Walking Tours, contacted Minh & was not disappointed.

Our day began with a walking lunch tour. Delicious Pho plus Hanoi Spring Rolls. Down lanes we went, Fish Balls on the way, to the BEST Bakery in Hanoi for the best Banh Mi EVER! The afternoon was spent at the local Market Garden, enjoying a very special smoothie, pleasant conversation & scenery.

We discussed a Ninh Binh outing & also a day exploring more on the back of Motor bikes while in Hanoi.

A jam packed moto adventure included the amazing Pottery Museum, crossing the Red River on a local ferry & a delicious Vegetarian lunch. Plus Flower & Vegetable Market Gardens close to the City. Loved being in the middle of traffic on the motorbike & felt very safe with our drivers!

Ninh Binh included a comfortable drive, stunning scenery, local towns, history & culture plus dining at a local restaurant specialising in Goat dishes. Minh pointed out the Cycling tour locations & if we wanted to cycle, had confidence he would cater to our fitness & cycle abilities. So maybe next time.

Minh listened & made suggestions for us as individual, mature age but young at heart travellers & his itinerary suited as down to the ground.
Highly recommend. Contact Minh, you will not regret the decision.

Title: Rosy Cruise
Description:
Overall this cruise was just OK. It was wonderful to experience the beautiful surroundings, however the accommodations are average. Iâ€™ll share some details that would have been helpful during my search:

The two options are for either 2days/1night or 3days/2nights. We opted for 3days/2nights. The longer trip includes a visit to the more remote Lan Ha Bay (via smaller excursion boat, for the day - you do not stay overnight in Lan Ha Bay). This was definitely the best part of the trip as we got to swim and cruise in the less populated area (and swim in an area free of trash, which is everywhere in the water in Ha Long Bay).

During the 3 days, there are groups shuffling on and off the boat - the cruise ship stays in Ha Long Bay, and passengers are shuttled to and from the dock via a transfer boat. Thatâ€™s why you will see options for both the 1 night and 2 night stays so frequently. It is definitely an efficient system, but I was under the impression this was a Lan Ha Bay cruise ship and more time would have been spent there. It seemed that this was generally the same program as all the other cruise ships. The cruise companies are definitely efficient and churning thousands of tourists a day from Hanoi to the Bay and back.

I think the 2 night stay was well worth it - if youâ€™re going to spend the time to come all the way out here, you may as well stick around to see Lan Ha Bay - nature at its finest with fewer tourists.

The food was ok, we enjoyed the lunches but the dinners were subpar. Service was very friendly for the most part. There is a loudspeaker in each guest room that wakes you up daily at 6:30am for breakfast, which was quite early for us.

Overall, glad I did it, but when you are part of a large group / ecosystem of tourists like this, you trade off a personalized experience.

Title: Go Viet Travel
Description:
My wife and I recently booked our trip to Vietnam through Go Viet.
It was the best trip we have had by far in terms of how the itinerary was planned.
We visited places like Hanoi, Ha long bay, Danang, Hoi Ann, Phu Quoc and Ho Chi Minh over a span of 16 days. The hotels we booked through Go Viet were top notch. We had absolutely no issues with traveling and sightseeing for the tour guides were extremely knowledgeable and very helpful. Travel and sightseeing through the places was on luxury buses that added to our comfort throughout the trip.
Ms. Oanh Ha from Go Viet ensured that we never faced any issues during our trip, she was always a call away incase we needed help.
I highly recommend for everyone going to Vietnam to get in touch with Oanh and book through Go Viet that's if you like comfortable Luxurious and a hassle free holiday.

Title: Mekong Prestige II
Description: My wife and I, along with another couple, did a seven-day cruise down the Mekong from Cambodia to Ho Chi Minh City on the RV Mekong Prestige II. We all loved every minute of it. The rooms are large and well appointed. All the staff were friendly and helpful, especially Marianne the cruise manager, who ensured everything ran smoothly. The meals were excellent and each day they were varied with an excellent range of choices. There were daily tour options to see a variety of local sights and meet the people. A special mention about the tour guide we had in Cambodia, Som, who was the best tour guide I have ever been with. He was a champion person as well! We met plenty of new friends on the cruise and would recommend it to anyone wanting to visit this part of Southeast Asia.

Title: Hoi An Scooter Adventures
Description: Loi was a great host for our day in Da Nang. He is friendly and personable and made us feel like VIPs. We visited the Marble Mountains on a scooter journey. It was my first time being a passenger on a scooter and Loi was a careful driver, this part was really fun for me. I am so glad we chose to have a guide at the marble mountains as we would not have known anything about the history of the place or how best to navigate the site without Loi. It was a hot day (by my standards!) when we went and Loi provided multiple cold water bottles which were very appreciated! Loi taught us about life for the local fisherman and we were able to see the bamboo boats up close. We also visited the Lady Buddha up close which we didnâ€™t realise was included so that was a big bonus! and then Loi took us to some of the most spectacular viewing points to see over the city. We also saw lots of monkeys!! Loi then took us to a hidden away cafe that was super cute and we had the most delicious coconut coffees. Loi shared lots of recommendations about local restaurants and foods to try and told us stories about his life. He is a natural host and has great English skills. He also took lots of photos for us which was great! Would highly recommend booking Loi for a jam packed and memorable day out and to learn about Da Nang from a lovely local!

Title: Vietnam Travel Advisory
Description: My family and I are satisfied customers under Stellaâ€™s service. We originally booked Rita Cruise for our Halong Bay cruise but they have canceled on us due to the weather and they were not operating on the days we are able to do so. So, I contacted Stella if she knows of a cruise that is operating on those available days we have left before we head home to Singapore. And yes voila, she found the best room at Athena cruise with excellent service. Couldnâ€™t ask for better. I am definitely going to contact her again when I visit Vietnam once again. Thank you for your excellent response Dear Stella. She is prompt and helpful.

Title: Culture Pham Travel
Description: Ms. Xi was amazing. Best tour guide Iâ€™ve had in Vietnam. She did a walking tour of the Hue Imperial City, and tailored everything to what we were interested in. We didnâ€™t have much time in Central Vietnam so she made sure to include a lot of the history that we otherwise would have gotten at other sites. The tour was also advertised as 2.5 hrs but she was with us for 3.5, and willing to stay longer at no extra charge. She also answered all of our many historical questions beautifully and gave us some great local food recs! Highly recommend :)

Title: Ivy Travel Agency
Description:
Ivy is just the greatest travel agent you'll find in Hanoi!!
She is so kind and helpful, she is so organized and helped us plan our whole trip to Vietnam:)
She first got us the visa invitation letter within a short time, then we consulted her about where to go around Hanoi and what she recommends in town and she gave us great tips and even suggested some changes to our plans which were awesome!!
We love Ivy and we highly recommend her! You won't regret it :)

Title: Vietnam Tour Fun
Description: All the excursions we went on were excellent, especially when we visited the river island. I really enjoyed working with clay and trying to make something local. Our tour guide in Bangkok was fantastic, very polite, and really introduced to us Thailand in the best way. The Samet island was lovely too, it wasn't too crowded, and we could enjoy some privacy. It definitely was an unforgettable experience for us. Vietnam Tour Fun did an amazing job in organizing the trip from the excursions, to our meals, and always provided fresh water for us. Thank you!

Title: DinHo Ecotour
Description:
Great experience, a much more quality and human touch than in any other place in Vietnam. The goide - Mr Thanh - was not only very kind, but most important very open for our interest in Delta and very involved to give us the best experience.

We were traveling throug Vietnam from north, so in Ben Tre we were already after two weeks of different experiences, with smiling tour operators selling services and later not relevant or even untrue services delivered. With Dinho Ecotour it was different! Open and helpful people, very human and friendly, but not fake smiling and most important incredible good treatment and all exactly as is should be for a local tour in local boat and food in homestay. :)))

ps. Mr Than - one of the coconuts is still growing :)))

Title: Flipside Adventure Travel
Description:
If you are looking for the right company to do the Ha Giang loop with then look no further than Flipside because it really doesnâ€™t get any better than this.

From the moment of arrival Tom and Lyn created the perfect experience for our 4 days on the loop. They were so kind and passionate and this is reflected in every detail of what they offer. In a small group we were able to truly experience the places we visited rather than just passing through as a photo opportunity. Flipside will take you off of the main tourist route to some indescribably beautiful locations. Along the way we were able to meet local communities, stay in fantastic homestays (not just warehouses full of 100 mattresses) and eat amazing meals in for every meal. The evenings are fun and varied each night, but here there is also no pressure to drink if that is not something that you enjoy.

The drivers are also truly cared for by this company and so provide an incredibly safe and enjoyable way to do the loop. This we did not fully appreciate until we saw the practices of some of the other companies we ran into.

We cannot thank Flipside enough for the wonderful memories we will take away from our time with them

Title: Indochina Holiday Travel
Description: In 2022 my wife and I joined IndoChina Holidays on a Trek/Cycle Tour of Laos. We were accompanied by four friends so a total group size of six (all 55 yrs plus plus). The experience was fantastic and I would thoroughly recommend it. It wasn't a restful holiday though...but the people, food, culture and scenery were well worth it. We were met by the Team in Luang Prabang and taken to remote villages for three days of trekking - it was very remote and the trekking was challenging. We stayed in villagers' primitive houses who had not seen Westerners since before Covid - it was a privilege to stay in their homes and experience their way of life. Something none of us will ever forget. We then climbed on our bikes for some very challenging cycling (distance and gradient) and to cover the full distances you would have to be a very accomplished cyclist. We worked with the Team to shorten the routes on a daily basis and to just take in the best parts of the routes - this worked really well and the Team were incredibly accommodating. The places we visited, the views we saw and the experiences we encountered were extremely memorable - well done IndoChina Holidays. A trip for the experienced traveller but if you put the effort in you get back great rewards - and yes I'd wholeheartedly recommend. Thank you IndoChina Laos Team you were fantastic.

Title: MANTA Sail Training Centre
Description: The experience was amazing! I rented a sailing boat (Laser Radial) and at first I received some instructions from the super sweet owner Julia. After the refreshment instruction one of the Vietnamese teachers joined me on board to guide me a bit (my last time in a laser was a couple of years ago). After 15 min he jumped out and swam back to the beach. I just had to pay the actual minutes I was sailing and even the short breaks (the wind was quite hard) where timed which I didnâ€™t had to pay. After the sailing we had some watermelon and we chatted a bit. The ambiance is very nice and relaxing! Because of the amazing experience I went twice! A friend of mine did a starter course and she learned a lot in one day! I highly recommend it!

Title: Good Morning Vietnam Travel
Description: Our friend refers James Bui from Good Morning Vietnam to us. We are family of 4 on a private tour to Danang for holiday. On arrival, the driver â€“ â€œLOCâ€ welcome us at the arrival hall at Danang International airport and drove us for a great Vietnamese lunch, restaurantâ€™s ambient is good and food very nice. We had the best White Rose at Hoi An Market; fantastic dinner at Hoi An; great buffet lunch at Bana Hill; unique and delicious lunch at QUAN NANH Hue. When we plan for the tour, James did ask us the food we like and dislike. And the food he arranges for us was very delicious and very much better than those Vietnamese food in Malaysia. James also advises us which mobile provider to use and help us to get the sim pack ready. We save our time on searching and just get the sim onto our phone when we are on the comfort luxury van at airport. The tour guide â€œTooâ€ is nice and helpful, he done a good job to take care of us throughout our travel. My wife ordered own design dress from B'Lan Silk Hiá»‡u, and â€œTooâ€ help us to talk to the tailor and she got her dress in 24 hours. The hotel are great with nice breakfast! I have shared my great experience we had with Good Morning Vietnam to my friends upon returning to Kuala Lumpur. They told me that they will sought the service from Good Morning Vietnam when they want to visit Vietnam. We shall see James in our next trip to Hanoi.

Title: HANOI PREMIUM TRAVEL
Description:
We had a wonderful 10 days in Northern Vietnam, with top service from start to finish.
All the arrangements were outstanding, with good hotels, great food, and the tours/ itineraries were fabulous.
Our guide Tuan was fabulous. Smart guy, full of information, and very friendly. He showed us around, made us comfortable, and gave us an education about Vietnam.
Thanks Hanoi Premium Travel for an incredible trip. We would recommend Hanoi Premium Travel and Northern Vietnam as a great place to visit.

Title: Vietnam Bikers Tour
Description: We went on a 6 day trip from Dalat to Hoi An with Quy Van Ho and Sang Nguyen on this trip. We had an amazing time!! Each day we started around 8:30 am and continued untill 5 pm and we saw so so so many places. Quy and Sang told us all about Vietnamese history, culture, language, nature and the wars. They were able to answer all our questions. Besides being professional guides, they were also really fun company. We ate together with them almost every night, trying all the different local food at cosy places (it is optional to eat with them, you can also eat by yourself outside or in your hotelroom). The hotels which they booked were also very comfortable and clean. We would definatelly recommend Quy and Sang as easyriders!! When we come back to Vietnam we will definitly ask them to be our guides and drivers again!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 18 trÃªn 66 Hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng ngoÃ i trá»i á»Ÿ ÄaÌ€ LaÌ£t

Title: I Love Hoi An Tour
Description: We have an incredible time with the I Love Hoi An team during our stay in this lovely town. We signed up for the sightseeing and vegetarian food tour and were not disappointed. We got to experience the local culture in the countryside, try our hand at pottery making, watch local artisans make traditional treats and then finish off with a vegetarian food tour of the town. The tour guides were outstanding and we were glad to support the I Love Vietnam movement. Highly recommend if you are in Southeast Asia and visit one of their tour cities!

Shi is een geweldig persoon met een enorme kennis van zaken. Hij heeft een groot oog voor detail en weet boeiend zalen te benoemen. Maar vooral zijn persoonlijkheid is geweldig. Wij hebben er een persoonlijke vriend aan over gehouden en kijken met veel genoegen terug op onze trip. Wat ons betreft van harte aanbevolen met 5 sterren.

Title: Halong Bay Day Trip
Description: We took the luxury bus tour of about 8 people. A 2 1/2 hour bus ride landed at the lower part of the bay They skip swimming off the boat and a 2 nd fishing village. More on the water no island land tour caverns or beach. just kayak in the water caves. Just be cautious of many different tour guides with pricing and tours of the same company . I spoke to someone who took *Arcadia* with island tour, biking, some military history, swimming .....

Title: Hanoi Airport Cab
Description:
I had booked an airport transfer from HCM airport to my hotel. Unfortunately our inward flight was cancelled 4 hours after the scheduled departure from Australia to be rescheduled for the following day.

Within minutes of cancellation of the flight the SnartRide service contacted us by WhatsApp to reschedule to our new flight. This happened to coincide with a holiday weekend but a new transfer was organised without fuss.

The car was at the airport arrivals as rearranged fir a smooth ride to our hotel.

The service levels experienced were fantastic.

Title: Hue Private Excursions
Description:
I had hope to write a glowing review related to the transportation from Hoi An to Hue and the full day City tour of Hue we took with Peter and Hoi An Private Tours however the Coronavirus conspired to cause us to cancel our trip. We were extremely disappointed to say the least but their is a silver lining in this black cloud in dealing with Peter. He has been wonderful to deal with - I sent a cancellation request advising why and asking for our modest deposit back. Peter, prompt as ever, came back with an email immediately and without any hesitation offered and delivered a full refund of our deposit. If this isn't worthy of a 5 star review I don't know what is!!
I can only highly recommend Peter and Hoi An Private Transfers from the beginning of our travel planning months ago to this wonderful pretrip cancellation response to difficult regional health issues. We only hope they are resolved very soon and and will look forward to working with Peter again with pleasure when reschedule our trip.

Title: Hoi An Tours
Description:
If you wan to see the Cham holy land and temple ruins of My Son you should choose this tour.Gettting up early is absolutely worth it having the site almost completelr to yiorself .Our group of Four people anly met three other tourists there.You can take pictures beforore the bif groups arrive and learn about Cham history from Tai.There used to be a guide from the government at My Son,but trere isn't anymore,so going with a froup and a knowlledgeable guide is the obly option you have ,if you Wan to learn more about the history and not just see the ruins.
The coffee and breakfast included in the tour was delicious as well

Title: Sapa O'Chau Trekking & Homestay
Description:
Si tratta dell'operatore piÃ¹ noto di tutta Sapa, citato spesso online e sulle guide di viaggio.
Molto professionali, hanno tante proposte, gentili e veloci nel rispondere alle email ed ai messaggi.
Consiglio l'esperienza con loro, il trekking che abbiamo fatto di 2 giorni era piÃ¹ votato all'esperienza in homestay e con le etnie locali, non tanto sulle risaie.
Se cercate un trekking per le migliori vedute delle risaie, provate a chiedere all'agenzia, magari vi indirizzano su un giro piÃ¹ adatto.
In ogni caso, mi sento di consigliare questa agenzia.
Il costo Ã¨ piÃ¹ che adatto.

Title: Local Vietnam
Description:
Wij hebben in mei 2023 een rondreis van 10 dagen geboekt via Local Vietnam.
Linh Bui van Local Vietnam heeft een mooi programma voor ons samengesteld. Alles was supergoed geregeld en waar nodig konden we via Whatsapp heel snel contact leggen. Goede hotels op mooie locaties. Prima mix van aansluiten bij groepstours en prive tours met goede tour guides. Op deze manier hebben we ontzettend veel mooie plaatsen in Vietnam kunnen bezoeken in een korte tijd, zonder haast. Het reisschema was heel goed samengesteld, alles sloot perfect op elkaar aan.

Title: Mekong Delta Day Tours
Description:
We have just spent the 5 days in HCMC and used AN Tours Vietnam  to organise all  our tours and airport transfers, which was all pre booked back in Melbourne.
Exceptional service  from the moment we arrived to departure always in contact with me through whatsapp!
Tran Van Qua as our guide absolutely fantastic, lots of knowledge & very funny.
My family really enjoyed every moment, really looked after my daughter (12yrs old).
I would highly recommend booking through this company everything was just so easy.

Title: MekongEcoTravel
Description:
We had an amazing time with this guide. We had a 2 days, 1 night tour with a lot of activities. She was attentive to our needs and although we are difficult to satisfy, we had no complaints, everything was perfect. We had a real taste of how life is in Mekong delta, and it was authentic and genuine. All the activities were very nice and interesting, we especially loved the boat trip in small canals, seeing heron birds and also the special secret activity in the evening, it was like a dream ! We learned how to cook the local dishes and could practice cooking it and taste it afterwards and many other really delicious dishes. We also learned about the work in the village, we roamed around in motorbike, visit an not touristic floating market, fish farm, fruit garden,noodle and cocoa factory and many more.
Our room at her house was also very cute and cosy. I strongly recommend booking this tour, we wouldn't want someone else to do it.
We want to thank her and her family again for hosting us and we hope to meet her again soon ğŸ¤—â¤ï¸
