Excellent service from Lucie and the team from start to finish. From planning the itinerary, to arranging transfers and making sure we always got where we needed to be.
Communication was easy and constant, with Lucie always checking up on us, or responding promptly when we had any questions.(whatsapp, with Vietnamese sim card and data)

I would highly recommend their service if you are looking for an un restricted tour of vietnam which suits your requirements but also safe, stress free, comfortable transfers from place to place.

Title: Ethnic Voyage
Description:
My partner and I did the 6 day hike in the Pu Luong Nature Reserve. Definitely a Vietnam hidden gem! We stayed with a number of ethnic minority groups, saw amazing mountain and rice field views as well as swimming in beautiful waterfalls.

This is the best way to understand ethnic Vietnam life! Get away from the hustle of the city and do something else besides the tourist hotspots.

The website is out dated - which did make me have scam concerns but I can assure you that they are legit :)

Title: Bamboo Adventures Vietnam
Description:
We had one free day in Hanoi during our trip in Vietnam and we booked a day trip to Mai Chau with Bamboo Adventures Vietnam. The natural splendor of Mai Chau was amazing, with vivid rice fields and beautiful limestone mountains making a breathtaking panorama. Our knowledgeable tour guide, Ivan, offered interesting stories with us, enriching our trip.

The highlight was meeting members of the local White Thai community. Visiting their houses provided an authentic glimpse into their lives, and despite the language barrier, our children formed relationships. The local cuisine offered was a delectable voyage through Vietnamese flavors.
Biking around the villages was a leisurely pleasure, providing views into rural life and showing the beautiful surroundings.

Our Mai Chau vacation provided us with priceless family moments as well as a deeper cultural appreciation. Thank you and highly recommend!

Title: Mekong River Cruise
Description:
AMA Waterways Mekong River Cruise and extra days in Saigon and Siem Reap (Cambodia). 5 star accommodations and 10 star staff. Our guides (Young in Vietnam and Peter in Cambodia) were beyond excellent. They spoke English clearly and understandably with concise descriptions of the sites and temples. They were fluent in the history and culture including dates and places . They gave choices in what to visit and were caring, professional and friendly. I always felt safe and cared for by them.
The cruise manager (Tung) was always present on all our excursions and during our time on the ship. He briefed us nightly on the next day's visits and how to best prepare. We used to joke that he had several identical twins that accompanied us because he was always around.
Because of these 3 people, I am hooked on AMA Waterways for all my cruises to come. We planed our next one already.

Title: Hoi An Cycle Tours
Description: Taxi from the hotel to the bikes with our guide Tim. The bikes were comfortable and perfectly functional for what we were doing. Cycled to the small ferry, across to the nice quiet picturesque island. Nice calm countryside, lots of rice fields with workers waving to us, children calling hello as we pass. First stop was Mr Dow who makes rice wine, rears pigs, plays guitar and sings. Very entertaining. Next was Reed mat makers, sadly a dying art, but great to have a go ourselves. Then making noodles with Miss Anne, very interesting and a delicious lunch. Gentle ride back to the ferry. A non strenuous ride for any ability. A great way to see a quieter side of Hoi An, meet locals and sample their skills. Great way to spend a morning.

Title: Mekong River Luxury Cruises
Description: absolutely amazing trip!! Treated like royalty as soon as you get on the boat with drinks and cold towels. The guide, Huey, was incredible- he knew about everything you would ask him and would always have a smile on his face. As a pescatarian, they were very accommodating to my food choices which is very appreciated and it was all lovely. We went on the most scenic bike ride- it was ethereal- and had some yummy native fruit in the middle of it. We also visited a floating market and a couple that made baskets which was so interesting to see. I absolutely recommend it to anyone thinking about it, it was once in a life time!

Title: Trung tÃ¢m VÄƒn hÃ³a- ThÃ´ng tin -Thá»ƒ Thao huyá»‡n CÃ¡t Háº£i
Description: We did the full day trekking tour which included a 4 hour hike in the National park, followed by lunch, then a bike ride to the port, a boat ride through the bay and then kyacking to an island beach for a swim! Every activity on our tour was so much fun! Our guide, Tong, was so friendly & kind, he made it such a great trip! The hike was a lot of fun - just the right amount of challenging. The food at lunch was good and our favourite part was reaching the island beach at the end. It was an amazing way to properly get to see the bay & we felt that it was so much quieter & cleaner than Ha Long Bay. We really loved the whole tour - it was our favourite day in Vietnam & we would definitely recommend it!

Title: Indochina Treks - Luxury Private Mekong Day Cruise
Description:
We booked 3 days mekong river cruise on the small sampan. It's a private trip for my husband and me. We enjoyed it very much. Our driver came in time to pick us up at the hotel, then long ride to caibe where we embarked our cruise. We enjoyed the trip very much. We visited villages along the river, see how they did for living. Our guide, Tan was very humor and informative. Food was just great!
Anna from Luxurymekong recommended and booked this tour for us. Very good price and assistance. We will recommend this company to anyone.

Title: Active Travel Asia
Description:
We booked the paragliding tour via Ms Min over email. Throughout the email conversations (of which there were many), she was always eager, patient and able to answer and clarify them. Our travel coordinate Mrs Ana was very punctual to pick us up on the day of the tour; with her were our paragliding pilots. The ride to the village was about 3 hours, including a rest stop to buy snacks. This was followed by a bone shattering, white knuckle ride in an SUV up the rocky hill in HoÃ nh Bá»“ where the take off would be - but we were in good hands (the driver is apparently a monster truck champion in Vietnam.)

The pilots were very professional, guiding us through the take off, flight and landing process and taking every safety precaution. It was a bummer my girlfriend was fitted with a heavier / more professional setup so she fell down while running down the slope during take off and had to redo it. It might have been better if the pilots decide based on our body size who should be fitted with which setup. Nevertheless the whole thing went on smoothly, lasting about 10 minutes. Being our first paragliding experience, it was exhilarating and at the same time peaceful, cruising at a high altitude and staring into the greenery below. They also provided a selfie stick attached to an action camera for us to take a video of the whole flight.

The tour then ended off with a sumptuous dinner comprising local seafood delicacies at a nearby restaurant before the 3-hour ride back to hotel.

Title: Sapa Authentic Tour

Sapa Authentic Tour is a vietnamiese family business. The boss speaks English very well and it was also very easy to write emails in French with him to arrange the trip exactly as we wanted it !
We did a 3 days 2 nights trek, and also another night and the Bac Ha market. So we didnâ€™t had to come back to Sapa before the market.
The trip was our favorite part of our 3 weeks travel to Vietnam. The better part : the people we met ! The guide, Sinh, was the nicest ! He lives in one of the village and knows the mountains by heart, the plants, the people, the traditionsâ€¦ it was so easy to talk with him ! He learned English by himself and by talking with all the tourists he met.
The home stay we visited also where so nice : people very friendly, amazing food,â€¦
We totally recommand !

Title: 365 Travel
Description:
From the planning process with Hanna, to the tours & local guides, 365 travel made our experience easy and very enjoyable. Our transfers, tours, hotels, and guides were all taken care of with no hiccups.

We enjoyed the flexibility of the tours as well as the professional, knowledgeable, and engaging tour guides throughout this trip. We took a total 10 days visiting Hanoi - Sapa - Hoi An - Ho Chi Minh City. Every city we enjoyed and were stress free thanks to the detailed planning of 365.

Our favorite was going up to Sapa and meeting the ethnic minority groups such as the Red Dao and Black Hmong, just to name a few. The trek was extremely scenic and the guides provided background on the culture, history, food, and local of the region. We are very happy with their services and I highly recommend to anyone who is visiting Vietnam. They are true experts with what they do.

Title: Maximus Travel Vietnam
Description:
This was fantastic! We were picked up from our hotel as a group of four. None of us had been on a scooter before and we were quite anxious but the drivers were fantastic and we felt entirely safe in spite of the Saigon traffic.
There was a a lead rider/guide and a mechanic with a spare bike in caser of any problems so all eventualities were covered. The food stops were all fantastic including a stop at a venue we would never have found for some local excellent singers.
The drivers and guide were all great and we felt completely unrushed throughout.
This was a great trip - value for money+++

Title: Medi Tours - Viet travel with locals
Description:
If you are looking for a genuine, knowledgeable, sharp & enthusiastic tour guide, look no further!
Kathy is one of the best tour guides that I have been with from my experiences in several cities across the world. She is a gourmet, so you have the best & most authentic places for food; she is well versed with History and culture, can answer most queries during your tours; she is a very engaging conversationalist, so you enjoy the time you spend with her; she is a safe motorcycle rider, so you are safe; she will tell you of things & places that may not be on the standard trail; she is excellent company; she is a proud Vietnamese, yet truly international.
Kathy had accompanied me for 2 days in Hanoi immersing me in deep history of the country & her people, and taken me to places serving awesome & original local food.
I wish her the very best in her endeavors!

Title: Hoi An Basket Boat Tours
Description: 20 minutes tops. Paddling around the river and stopping by performers who danced to some techno. I think the aim was to have tourists come through and create some cash flow, give tips and support the locals. Like a lot of tours in Vietnam, this tour did cram too much in too little time, and mostly was hot potato or pass the parcel. I think itâ€™s best to not get your hopes up for this one. Itâ€™s not a highlight activity, however itâ€™s good to go to support the locals. Just giving a heads up and lower some expectations.

Description: Eva at Local Hue Travel was amazing. She helped my boyfriend and I book a easy rider motorbike from Hue to da nang which was an incredible experience with professional motorbike riders that made me feel so safe on the bike. I was very very nervous beforehand but Eva was so kind and understanding and helped to put my mind at rest. She communicated with the drivers to let them know I was nervous and that it was my first time on a motorbike. In addition Eva booked us a private car to take us round different sights in Hue. Her knowledge is fantastic and she is so helpful. Thank you Local Hue Travel for making our time in Hue great!!

Title: Treking Sa pa With Trang Adventures
Description:
I came to Sa Pa in mid-July on my own and Trang brought me around for 2 days. Sheâ€™s a very cheerful person and is passionate about sharing about Hmong culture and giving you the best experience! She speaks fluent English, and knows how to engage you by being curious about your background.

After taking a sleeper bus from Hanoi to Sa Pa, she picked me up from the bus station even though it was extremely early at 5am.

We did a 4-5h trek on day 1 where she brought me around a few villages, before reaching my homestay which serves fantastic food and had a calm environment.

She always gave me a choice between an easy or harder route and there were many breaks in between for rest or for coffee! Sheâ€™s also a masterful photographer and always knows which places give the best photos, either of yourself or of the scenery.

Would recommend that youâ€™ve proper hiking shoes that you donâ€™t mind getting dirty as routes can be muddy, undulating and treacherous! Trekking/ hiking sticks will be very useful though I got through the trek without one.

Title: Asia Essence Tours
Description:
I've never been so excited to get home and write a review. Absolutely without a doubt THE BEST tour ever. We travelled from Hanoi, to Danang, to Hoi An, the Phan Thiet, HCMC and the the Mekong Delta with my husband and 7 & 9 year old daughters.
We trawled the internet for weeks to find a great local Vietnamese company for our family adventure holiday and hit the jackpot with Kate and Asia Essence Tours. As soon as I started making enquires Kate responded straight away. I was specific and knew what we wanted: Family Friendly, Private tours & transport, Adventure, Culture, Art, History, Travel, Farms, Poolside, 4-5star and Relaxation in two weeks. I gave Kate my budget (ex international airfares) and she sure delivered beyond our expectations!! She greeted us in person on the first day, gave us a SIM card and almost daily she checked in with us with meticulous details and made sure everything was running smoothly for us. We felt so supported and looked after by Kate and nothing was ever an issue. And her genuine kindness and concern was so comforting when traveling with kids somewhere totally new.
We did our own thing within our itinerary some days but as a family when there was a tour planned by Kate we had a motto 'if Kate planned it, it was going to be great" and it was every time. I think we may have even saved up to 30% on the prices of hotels and tours by booking with Kate also.
No one got sick, at no time did any booking not happen and Kate was always there to see us through.
I have done loads of traveling in my lifetime and this tour company without a doubt is the BEST I have ever felt with.
Look no further Kate at Asia Essence Tours gets 10 out of 10 from us and without a doubt we will be back to Vietnam!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 155 trÃªn 456 Äá»“ Äƒn & Äá»“ uá»‘ng á»Ÿ HÃ  Ná»™i

Title: Da Nang Tours
Description:
I was on a group tour to Ba Na Hills. The guide(Mr. Phuoc) was extremely friendly! Our guide did a very good job. He quickly found his voice with our team. Há»“ ThiÃªn PhÆ°á»›c was always kind and patient. He told many stories and stories and also the history of Da Nang, Ba Na Hills, while we were on our way there. These cannot be found online.
This is a full day program. We only came at closing time. I can only recommend it to everyone.
In the next few days, we will also visit the city of HuE under the leadership of Mr. Pouch. We visited the Forbidden City and walked along the Perfume River. We visited Marble Mountain and the shrine of "My Son" sanctuary. We received a lot of interesting and important information.
If you come to Da Nang, don't miss these programs.

Title: HoiAnbyYou
Description:
We were searching for something to eat and quite accidentelly arrived at Lucky's restaurant where he and his family welcomed us very friendly and warmly. He told us that he also offers tours and we booked a very spontaneous trip to a lantern workshop.
The next morning he and his friends picked us up at the homestay and took us first to a silkscreen fabric and then to a small lantern fabric where we also had the opportunity to do some on our own.
The whole tour was very interesting and Lucky and his friends took really good care of us (with fruits and water, yummy)
Some days later he organized a driver to get from Hoi An to My Son. It was a precious experience and we were really happy to get to know him. Nice, friendly and very helpful guy. Thank you so much. ( Also for the honey moon snack :) )
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 29 trÃªn 187 PhÆ°Æ¡ng tiÃªÌ£n giao thÃ´ng á»Ÿ Há»™i An

Title: Phan Rang Kite Center
Description:
I'm not sure where to start, should I start by saying that the owner Son is such an amazing guy, friendly and very helpful that during each kitesuring session you have on the water he will make sure that you are having a blast, or maybe should I start with the manager Jeff who's very friendly and will flood you with advises and tips to find your way around town and get the most out of your stay and not to forget his advises all around the center for people looking to improving their kiting skills...
The kite surfing instructors are knowledgeable, safety conscious and all round awesome people. The assistance on the beach launching and landing the kite meant I could make the most of each session.
This place exceeded all my expectations, from the local restaurant serving delicious food, to the rooms that are sparkly clean and comfy.
This place deserve more than just 5 stars, so if you are like me addicted to kitesuring, good vibes, friendly and awesome people then look no further as this is the place where you want to be for your next kitesuring holidays.

.
Well done Son! You have created something very special and I look forward to seeing you next season
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 2 trÃªn 12 Chuyáº¿n tham quan & hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng á»Ÿ Phan Rang-ThÃ¡p ChÃ m

Title: Go Southeast Asia Travel
Description:
It was a wonderful 7 days of sightseeing in Hanoi, Ha Long Bay, Ninh Bin & Ho Chi Minh with Go Southeast Asia!

Right from the meet & greet and welcome on our arrival at Hanoi Airport, we were made to feel at home!

Be it meeting our dietary or rooming preferences, providing top notch vehicles and knowledgable guides, it was well taken care of to the minutest details by Ms. Diu!

She has a great instinct of what travellers want and she makes all out efforts, to ensure they get it. Even if it was late at night, she was always available to assist and guide us.

I will for sure visit Vietnam and the other countries they operate in for sure. All the very best Team Go South East Asia.

Title: Tee Sa Pa, Trekking, Biking, Motorbike Tour
Description:
Tuong, or as he is more commonly known - "Tee", is an outstanding guide. This trip was my first time travelling with a guide, and naturally I was sceptical about the experience. However, Tee was the most wonderful tour guide I could ask for. I met a kind, gentle and caring person. It was a pleasure to travel with him. Tee displayed unlimited knowledge about the wildlife, culture and history of Viet Nam, and always with a big smile and positive attitude.
I would highly recommend travelling with this gem of a person. Had a beautiful experience, and I'm very glad I met him.

Title: Color Vietnam Travel
Description: The whole experience in itself was the highlight. The tour guide was well educated and kind, she was very thoughtful and always checked in on us. She spoke perfect English also and was full of exciting and insightful information. I stayed at the valley view homestay and I arrived in the morning, the house manager organized our tour within moments. Hung is incredible and helpful and the tour itself was impressive. I had a cultural experience and I left feeling humbled and happy. I would recommend staying here and organzing any tours through Hung. This is a small family business that are welcoming and kind. A huge highlight was the food we had the restaurant we were overwhelmed with a great feast. Everything tasted lovely. 10/10 coming back to the homestay was an absolute blessing. The views are priceless and special. Again I recommend this tour and homestay.

Title: Phong Nha Caves Tour Center
Description: Wonderful experience. They customised the tour as per our needs. Great guide. On time, catered to vegetarian meal options as well. Would recommend to everyone. Dark caves was a great new adventure. There was zip lining, swimming. Very helpful staff, we had last minute stay cancellation from other host, helped us find an accomodation at 11pm for early morning check in the next day. Super helpful people.

Title: Phong Nha Trekking Tours
Description: Once you passed the board walk into the darkness and quite, it was an absolute experience. Many caverns, tight passes and swimming then to top it off was the light at the end of the tunnel! The timing of the tour is important as just after you arrive at the end the sun peaks through and shines a heavenly beam onto the cave floor. Highly recommend this tour.

Title: Free Tours In Hanoi
Description: Well I read about University students guiding tourists to polish their English and I was so amazed by this effort. I tried booking a slot for a solo hoan Kiem lake, the big church and temple of literature tour. Nhung Kim was assigned and I was so happy to interact with her. She was extremely polite and patient with my questions and she showed me everything so well with lots of stories behind. I absolutely loved this experience and will be continuing with her in the coming days in Hanoi. It's a beautiful city with beautiful people. Please don't hesitate to book for these tours and Kim should be the choice of course. She is absolutely lovely. She clicked some amazing pictures for me which would not have been possible if I would have gone alone.

Description: I met Pat in 2007, he looked after my Lis, then did a total rebuild of my TV, which at that time was and engine case, a frame and leg shields, he also did the engine on my li, again total rebuild. he also takes care of my Vespas. he has a wide range of accessories, and a top selection of seats pipes etc. the thing that really puts him above the others here is his in depth knowledge of what is available globally in the way of top kits. he can also do modifications, such as disc brakes or electric engines. he is universally considered the go to guy by scooterists here is Saigon. he also arranges ride outs, charity rides and holiday rides to the North in which he takes part. in fact he arranges them mostly for the crack and love of riding. top bloke to take care of your beloved baby.

I had the time of my life, with a few others I meet when we started, and I enjoyed every moment of it â¤ï¸
The landscape was everything I imagined, and the people more than soo. Same dead, but fantasic humor, and an insight in Viet Nam, I always have dreamed of since I was a kid.
The trip was everthing from hiking for a cave half an hour, seeing the people and talking to them, learning the way of living and seeing a part of myself, i never imagine and soo much much more.
Ha Giang is sooo worth a visit, and with chosing thise guys, you gonna see all of the beauty Viet Nam can offer â¤ï¸

Title: Indochina Junk
Description:
We took the 1 night tour to Bai Ty Long Bay. Quieter than Ha Long Bay but still got all the cruising, sunsets, limestone pillars as well as trips to fish farm and caves.
Our boat, Prince 2, was a lovely small boat - 4 cabins. Staff were really great and a fantastic tour guide too.
Efficiently picked up from our Hanoi hotel we were take to the boat and a relaxing time cruising through the bay.
What was a real bonus was the food. Superbly prepared dishes for 24 hours.
We all loved it.

Title: Blueriver Tours
Description:
Wow what an amazing tour. One on one service there and back in a speedboat with our own food and drink in board.
Chou our tour guide was very helpful on the history of the Vietnam war giving an unbiased account of what happened and the reality of life of the Vietcong in the day.
The tunnels are a must visit.
Lunch afterwards in the beautiful surroundings ended the day perfectly.
Thank you to Chou and his driver.
Will recommend to friends and family.

Title: Vung Tau Hash House Harriers
Description: Vung Tau Hash (VTH3) is Vung Tau's original Hash House Harriers group. It all started back in 1992, and to this day still runs every Sunday, 1pm from Nang Vung Tau, 5 Le Ngoc Han. The group comprises mainly Vietnamese families, together with many people from around the world. Every Sunday we go on either a local (within VT) or away trail (bus out of town). It's amazing value as everything is included. It is such well organised and a great group of "Hashers". Not only are the trails amazing, but it's also a great opportunity for the local youngsters to learn some English. If you are free on a Sunday afternoon and fancy a bit of fresh air exploring the mountains near and not so near (but not too far), come along for a great day out.

Title: Sapa Authentic Travel
Description: Our experience with Mr. Sang was nothing short of extraordinary. His attentiveness, soft-spoken nature, courteous demeanor, profound knowledge of local culture (since he himself is from Hmong local tribe), and ensures that our stay is comfortable, sets him apart as an exemplary tour guide. We spent 3 days with him, trekking around Cat Cat village (Day 1), Fansipan mountain (Day 2) and finally Lao Chai & Ta Van village (Day 3). I wholeheartedly recommend his services to anyone seeking an unforgettable journey enriched by the presence of an exceptional guide like Sang.

Title: Vietnam Travel Landscape
Description:
I searched websites for cruises that would allow us to stay on the river or nearby. I am a photographer, an avid geography, culture, travel buff and my wife is not as willing. We both have dietary restrictions (I am vegetarian/vegan and my wife needs no/low fat food and no red meat). The overall experience was something I am okay with but the Mekong Delta is polluted, smells awful at some points (but this is not a criticism of Vietnam. Many places across the globe are struggling with the drastic effects of pollution along their major river systems).

There were some photo ops but nothing fascinating. Every time we stopped to visit something on the land, like an artisan shop, a workshop, a temple or something, it underwhelmed us. Song Xanh sampan (the boat) was average. The crew did their best and we are grateful to them to have made it good enough but the boat by Victoria Cruises needs better equipment. In May-Aug I cannot imagine night stays on the boat when the temperatures are 30+ Celcius (120+F) with humidity and still air. No breeze!

Song Xanh Sampan boat by Victoria Cruise had one fan and another portable fan unit. But honestly, if I had the energy, I could blow harder and faster the entire night. We both are not ones that need comfortable AC and pampered climate. They don't need to have AC units but the fans need to be more in number and better.

The sleeping is under a mosquito net and that worked well. Again, I didn't need an AC unit but if you can't tolerate an environment with no AC, then this trip (or this boat) is not your choice.

For a photographer, there weren't many excursions deeper into the country side to see rice fields or similar scenery. So your mileage may vary.

Overall:

Experience satisfaction: 3/5
Song Xanh Sampan boat/facilities: 2/5
Song Xanh Crew: 5/5
Restaurant staff at Le Longanier: 5/5

Song Xanh itinerary planning and value for sites: 3/5 (Cai Rang is the only thing of memory and that lasted 30 min. The bicycle tour in Cai Be is very poor thinking because you will be cycling at peak temperatures in the hot and muggy southern Vietnam region when even the locals are resting or having lunch. By the end of the bicycling, we both lost appetites to eat anything. So the delicious lunch was underutilized.)

Title: Saigon Motorcycles
Description:
Popped over to the D2 shop to look at the motorcycle clothing, have to say, they have the biggest selection at reasonable prices, a very good shop team, able to speak English and tried hard to accommodate all my needs, they have items up to XXL but for those taller or heavier, you might need to bring in from overseas, but for everyone under that, pop over to the D2 or D7 shops, they will have everything you need.
They also have a number of tour schedules as well as there normal bike rental business, there really is only two worthwhile bike rental companies in VN, one is Saigon Motorcycles the other is Tigit, both have a loyal following because they are both first class in their service to their customers, so to anyone considering coming to Vietnam (or based on Vietnam) use these guys for your needs, don't go the cheapest option.

Title: Victoria Hoi An Sidecar
Description: This was the most fun activity that myself, husband and niece had in Vietnam. Sidecars are nostalgic for me. It was the first family â€œ vehicleâ€my Dad had. I was just a toddler with a newborn baby brother, and our little family used to get around in that. In Vietnam, it was so exhilarating sitting in that sidecar, remembering days gone by, roaring down the streets and country roads, the pottery village was amazing too. Our two guides were friendly and fun to be with, and we felt safe the whole time. I have not laughed and enjoyed myself so much in years! We are frequent visitors to Hoi An, and each time we go, we do this tour. Highly recommend this group and their tours!

Title: Local Buddy Tours Da Nang Viet Nam
Description: This is a superb tour! It was our second one with Local Buddy Tours. My 11 year old son and I first went on the jeep tour of villages around Hoi An with them (also highly recommended!), and after it decided to book more. Thanh is a superb guide who speaks English really well and is a charming man really interested in people. My son really connected with him and insisted we have him on all three tours we did with Local Buddy Tours. Tai is an exceptional driver, we were very comfortable all the way. Thanh suggested we set off early to avoid the heat and crowds, which turned out to be an excellent idea! The sanctuary was a beautiful place and it was made more interesting Thanh's knowledge about its history and fascinating facts. The lunch we stopped for on the way back was a delicious authentic local meal, full of locals - I think we were the only travellers there. It didn't feel like a tour, more like being shown around by local friends. Go!

Seine besondere SpezialitÃ¤t ist es, die HÃ¤user von Einheimischen, von ethnischen Minderheitsgruppen zu besuchen, wo er offensichtlich jeden kennt. Wir waren stets willkommen, wurden zum Tee, zum Reisschnaps eingeladen und haben viele Begegnungen gehabt, die ohne Mr. Son nicht mÃ¶glich gewesen wÃ¤ren. Gesundheitlich bedingt, mussten wir auf Trekking verzichten, Mr. Son ging auf das Problem flexibel ein und fand das passende Ersatzprogramm. Die Fahrt auf den Mount Fansipan bei bestem Wetter war ein Highlight der Tour. Wir danken Mr. Son und seinem Fahrer fÃ¼r die sxhÃ¶nen Tage in Vietnam.

Ha Giang loop has been the most exciting experience in Vietnam.

Title: Educational School Trip
Description: The trip was successfully organized by Educational School Trips, which make my kids feel that they learned a lot about this country, knew how to tackle issues they might meet in life. The schedule was great and they could enjoy working and supporting. This memorable course allowed them to stay together and develop good relationships there. They did dive into fantastic activities, including staying at Kingfisher Ecolodge, forest trekking to a small village, participating in the cooking class, ... We particularly appreciate the support of the company.

Title: Authentic NINH BINH
Description: Wonderful experience! Tour guide was very hospitable and entertaining - drive to Ha Ling was very comfortable, we canâ€™t fault it. The food, drinks were very good and we enjoyed the cooking lessons (spring rolls) Highly recommend Jade Sails for the luxury, slightly more expensive both worth it. The boat ride was good and had the chance to kayak. Although extremely hot, we had fun and they timed the activities well. Good sight seeing + photo opportunities . If you are short on time and want to squeeze a day trip to Ha Long from Hanoi, I would definitely recommend this cruise.

Title: Mai Chau Trek
Description:
This was a long day trip from Hanoi for the three day tourists and many others taking an overnight trip. Stops were made each way for a drink and on the way out at Thung Khe Pass. Here stalls were set up at the side of the road selling various foodstuffs. One lady who dared enter the toilets out of desperation, warned against it.

Once we reached Mai Chai, we had lunch before the three of us set off around the paddy field for a great one hour cycle. It was the first time in 50 years that I have cycled but you donâ€™t forget. We then set off on our long trip back to Hanoi after a very worthwhile day.

Title: Mekong Villages
Description: Fabuleux voyage, pays magnifique et variÃ©, les vietnamiens sont adorables et extrÃªmement accueillants. Le voyage a Ã©tÃ© organisÃ© absolument comme nous le souhaitions par cette agence, Ã  partir d'une base que nous avions rÃ©flÃ©chie (nous devions partir en 2020) mais avec des bons conseils pour supprimer, changer ou rajouter certains points. Si nous devions repartir, nous referions le mÃªme pÃ©riple ! Nos deux guides Ã©taient formidables, en particuliers celui du nord du Vietnam qui Ã©tait exceptionnel. Tous deux adorables et d'une grande ponctualitÃ©. Nous avions choisi de ne faire que le nord et le centre en 12 jours et nous n'avons aucun regret, nous avons dÃ©jÃ  vu tellement de belles choses ! Notre prioritÃ© Ã©tait de faire de la randonnÃ©e, un peu hors des sentiers battus, cela a Ã©tÃ© le cas autant dans le Mai Chau que dans le parc de Bach Ma. Nous sommes passÃ© dans des villages trÃ¨s authentiques, avons bien marchÃ© et fait du vÃ©lo. Nous avons bien sÃ»r visitÃ© aussi les sites touristiques (Baie d'Halong terrestre et maritime, HuÃ©, Hoi An, Hanoi) et des temples et pagodes mais nos plus beaux souvenirs sont la rencontre des vietnamiens dans les villages, qui travaillaient pour eux et non pour les touristes et la beautÃ© des paysages de riziÃ¨res ou des forÃªts de bambou. Un sans faute !

Title: M'gloria Cruise
Description:
The cruise was well organized and run, we did kayaking on the first day and took boats into some of the caves on the second. The food was super and the staff, Willy and Tracy in particular, were really helpful and friendly.

We were asked to postpone the visit by one day but we had time so spare so it wasn't a problem and we had our cabin upgraded in return.

Title: Asia Trip Deals
Description:
I started my trip with Helen in September 2019, as my daughters' honeymoon was organized by Asia Trip Deals and they were very happy with it. Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos and Thailand were the target and 31 days. I gave the company some ideas on what I would like to see. Over the course of 3 months we organized it almost daily and refined the 4 week trip with Helen. Thanks for her speed and helpful advice. Special thanks for suggesting that I stay in Vietnam until the Lunar New Year. It was wonderful!

An exchange took place in December and Lam took over the organization of the trip and finalized the program. Lam made some very good suggestions for some changes, which also took into account that I'm no longer 20!
Lam met me in Hanoi personally and promised to follow me to the last stop, which was the case.

The hotels were perfect, the transports to the programs, the programs themselves and the guides were perfect. In addition to the "must-see" sightseeing tours, I am pleased to have learned about the lives of ethnicities, markets, and rural people. In particular, I would like to point out that not only the Vietnamese programs succeeded well, but the other 3 countries were also well organized by the trusted companies, especially A&Ftour, Nongnoot, who has always been a fan of my programs in Thailand. I have put these 4 countries in my heart, the cheerful people, the wonderful flowers and the delicious food! Thanks for the organization! It was perfect from the first minute to the last!
A 69 years "young" lady from Hungary

Title: HSG EasyRiders & Motorbikes Ha Giang
Description: What a trip! What an experience! For us the highlight of our Vietnam trip. Driving around freely gazing across the rugged Karst mountains on a semi-automatic motorcycle. Highly recommend to do this trip now as it still is somehow off-the-beaten track and no doubt to do it with Bike Tour Ha Giang. Hieu knows the nicest route and little places, and gives several options for your overnight stay (homestay or guesthouse). He neatly adapts the driving speed for those who are a bit inexperienced (like us). Hieu also promptly and profoundly answers all your questions via e-mail or WhatsApp in very good English. He is also setting up a homestay in Ha Giang, which could be very convenient at the start or end of the trip. Bike Tour Ha Giang is a small but solid family business, therefore no extra middlemen costs, in short the perfect QPR!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 16 trÃªn 49 PhÆ°Æ¡ng tiÃªÌ£n giao thÃ´ng á»Ÿ HaÌ€ Giang

Title: Vietnam Local Adventures

Title: Con Dao Experience
Description:
I booked the Island Hopper Tour for our family of 4. The advertised tour was for a visit to 2 islands for snorkelling, a talk about the turtle conservation program at the National Park with a visit to the turtle beach and incubation pond. It also advertised an english speaking guide and lunch. As we have food allergies in our family, we were told we could do one without lunch, but confirmed with the operator that the rest of the itinerary would remain the same.

However, on the day, the organisation for pick up was chaotic, and there was no English speaking guide. We did visit the 2 advertised islands for snorkelling, but when we asked about the turtle beach, we were told we had to go at night to see them. Although they did not deliver on what they advertised, we were charged 4 million VND.

I would not recommend this tour operator.

The main issue is that for 3 days and 3 nightswhilst in Pnomh Pen we were moored looking at the underbelly of the quayside most unpleasant also the restaurant on 2nd deck was in darkness due to being tied alongside another river boat hence the curtains were drawn . Breakfast and lunch very good evening meal mixed . Food not hot enough . Not enough sun loungers which as per normal weâ€™re reserved early morning by same people â€¦.. That never changes wherever you go in the world but apart from those grumbles we had a great time . Staff delightful beautiful well maintained accommodation well organised trips

Title: HaÌ€nh TriÌ€nh ViÃªÌ£t
Description: We had a half day trip from HCMC to Cu Chi tunnels with Rachel My Tien in a private tour. We were picked up from our airbnb promptly. Communications from Rachel prior to the trip was brilliant. The tour was interesting especially with Rachel's company who talked us through not only the history of Cu Chi tunnels but also the sight seeing points and Vietnamese culture when we were in the car journey on the trip. Rachel was welcoming and passionate on what she did. The programme in Cu Chi was amazing and we got to get into tunnels, watch the traps set up by the Viet Cong and many more. It is highly recommended who has not been should pay a visit to the place with a trustworthy travel agent such as Vietventure.

Title: SSC Viet Nam Travel
Description:
My family and I travelled to Hoi An and Da Nang with SSC Viet Nam Travel recently. Given that we have two young children and elderly, we opted for a private tour with spacious van (flexible schedule). The experience was good including the 3 meals (B, L, D) they prepared.
The hotel accommodations were also exceptional, particularly the Deicacy Hotel in Hoi An. Our tour guide, Nam Ho, was an absolute delight. He was punctual, friendly, and incredibly knowledgeable about the local area. His fluency in English certainly helped us communicate with ease, and my kids absolutely adored him. We also want to give a special shout-out to our agent, Lily, for her kindness and prompt attention to all our requests including helping us make a last-minute change to our itinerary and arrange a visit to the Mikazuki Water Park, replacing Hue City. In short, we had an amazing time with SSC Viet Nam Travel and can't thank them enough for delivering an unforgettable travel experience.

Title: Simply Toan
Description:
Toan is so much more than a guide.
He is so easy-going, friendly and easy to adapt, that it really is hard to imagine anyone not having a great time with him!
He did so much more than initially agreed, kept his plan very flexible to ensure we will really enjoy and kept giving us useful information through the day.
We spent amazing time with him, trying traditional food, hiking, having boat tour.
Also, the fact that his tours are private, makes it so much more personal experience, where you can focus on what is important to you, not large group of people you donâ€™t even know.
Highly recommended!!!

Title: Serenity Cruises
Description: We booked a full day tour from cat ba. The whole day was perfect. Firstly, the staff, from our guide, to the chefs and captain and crew mates. Every single person was so friendly and helpful, and our guide was incredibly knowledgeable. Secondly, the boat itself is stunning. There are 3 decks, with indoor and outdoor areas, each decorated beautifully, with plenty of comfy areas and furniture to relax and enjoy the views. The boat has fans and air con, 2 bathrooms with hot showers. The dining room where we ate our lunch was also beautiful. Thirdly, the food!!!! It was abundant and delicious. Fresh clams, fresh squid, fish cakes/fritters, spring rolls, chicken, salad, green vegetables, rice, fries and many more. They cater to all dietary requirements and requests so everyone can enjoy the food and be full! As for the tour itself, the main draw is the sceneryâ€¦ which is totally breathtaking! We also kayaked through caves and lagoons, jumped off the boat and swam in the water, visiting local fishing farms and villages and relaxed on deck just appreciating the beauty around us. We passed other boats and none looked nearly as nice on the outside or inside as this boat. I think the value for money is outstanding. Myself and my partner have been traveling around SE Asia for 5 months and this tour was a definite highlight of many tours/excursions/scenery/adventures that we have done and seen ! Having read reviews and looked at photos, we knew this was going to be great! However, thanks to the high standards of safety, the interior and exterior of the boat and the absolutely amazing staff who make this tour, it managed to exceed our expectations in every way. I recommend anyone in cat ba to book a tour with serenity!

Title: Jackfruit Adventure
Description:
Our team of 19 went to HCMC for our annual teambuilding. We thoroughly enjoyed the teambuilding event that the Jackfruit team organise for us.

Right from the start (when I sent Dung Ho a WhatsApp message late at night), the Jackfruit team has been personalised, professional and thoughtful. We received overwhelmingly positive feedback from all our team members who attended the event.

Dung Ho and his team were meticulous in their planning of the event and always mindful of how they can create a more local experience for our team. This can be seen from the meticulously planned visit to the local market, arranging for us to prepare the ingredients and cook the food in a local soup kitchen (rather than at the orphanage) and the well-planned trip to the orphanage. There were English speaking local guides with us all the time, which was helpful as none of us could speak Vietnamese (the guides did try their best to teach us a few Vietnamese words to help us make our way around the local market). Our event ended with us serving the Vietnamese food that we have prepared (rice noodles, spring roll, BBQ pork) to the children at the orphanage, and performing and playing games with the children.

In all, I would highly recommend the team at Jackfruit if you are considering a teambuilding event in Vietnam. Before our trip, we were considering a more conventional teambuilding event (e.g. amazing race type) vis-Ã -vis a more customised teambuilding with a CSR element that Jackfruit offered. We are happy that we went with the latter â€“ the memories that our team brought home with us were invaluable and in our view, brought our team much closer together.

Title: Hoian Daily Tours
Description:
Booked the following with Mr. Ly. Airport transfers, Ba Na Hills trip, evening trip from Hoi An to Da Nang, Hotel transfer from Hoi An to Da Nang.
Excellent, 1st class service received. On all occasions the driver was on time as per my itinerary, drivers were excellent, very helpful and courteous.
If / when we next holiday in the Da Nang / Hoi An area will have no hestitation in making my arrangements with Mr. Ly.

Title: Great Indochina Travel
Description: We went for 7 day, 6 night tour around Vietnam covering Hanoi, Da Nang, Hoi An and Ha Laong Bay. The hotels and local tours were arranged by the Great IndoChina travel and they were splendid! The hotels and cruise were good, rated locations with good amenities. The tours were well planned, relaxed and we had good English speaking tour guides. We had small groups and were taken in air conditioned vehicles and tour guides were knowledgeable and very entertaining too. All our pickups and airport drives were on time. Mr Tony always made sure to check up on us and also took care of food preferences. We had an amazing time and did not have to worry about a thing. Would love to come back here again with a bigger family next time.

Title: Indochina Sails
Description: Highly recommend you include at least a 1 night Junk cruise on a tour of Vietnam. This was one of the highlights of our trip. We did the 1 night, 2 day cruise, might be worth considering a 2 night option, as we really enjoyed it. The boat was luxurius and we had a superior cabin which was very plush, including a spa bath. There is a narrow balcony suitable for standing only. All areas were clean and the staff were accommodating and friendly. Our dietary requirements were accommodated without any fuss. There were activities on board and 2 excursions.

Description:

Lucky me, i have a great and wonderful host, Wall. He give me a good reference and advice for me to arrange our schedule in Hanoi, Halong and Sapa.
My Mom and my aunties very happy with our ittinerary. they still talked about it after we arrived in Jakarta, Indonesia.
This travel Planner give a good advice and they are very flexible too. i take 2d1n full package for Halong bay. i asked help from them for transfer Hanoi-Noi bai-Hanoi, and transfer Hanoi-Sapa-Hanoi.they make our I'm very happy because they made everything runs smoothly and give us freedom to arrange my ittinerary by ownself. they give us a wonderful experience along north vietnam trip

Title: Azotour.Vietnam
Description:
Lien from Azotour was amazing, we booked the Ninh Binh and Halong Bay Cruise through her. Her service was incredible, she made sure that the Tour bus picking us up at the hotels ok, she made sure that the bus driver knew; where to drop us off, so that we did not have to deal with getting on the wrong Tour.

Subsequently, I asked her to book limousine bus tickets for me To and from Ho Chi Minh City to Tay Ninh. She managed to arrange all the pickup logistics from hotel to destination hotel and back without any charge.
She went above her job for making, our time in Vietnam very easy and enjoyable.

Thank You so much, Lien. I will for sure keep your contact for my future travel to Vietnam. I will also pass on your contact to any of my friends coming to Vietnam.

Description: â€œKneeâ€ is a great guide. We went fishing in basket boats and cast nets on the river. After fishing we went back to her home on the outskirts of town where we had a terrific lunch followed by rice cultivation and milling. We got to ride the water buffalo, plow the rice paddy with the water buffalo, plant rice, and husk and mill rice. She is a lovely guide and our entire family found the day to be informative and fun. Title: Kimie's Tours
Description: I lived in phu quoc for a few months at a time and never made it on a tour of the islands nearby. I kept hearing about how beautiful they were and how good the snorkeling was. Thanks to Kimmie I was able to go because the tour wasnt super early but there was one at noon also, and I saw the islands for myself. We went to three islands with good snorkeling, the last one in particular had perfect clear water and it was like an island from paradise, with many fish. Kimmie is a real professional and very genuine and caring so people feel comfortable and friendly on tour and enjoy themselves. Then we went to eat on one of the islands and the food was great squid fresh grilled fish, oysters, it was a really great price for the tour for all the things included and the speed boat is a fun experience ill never forget. Recommend everyone to do this when in phu quoc because its really the most beautiful beaches and places to dive.

Title: Smart Asia Travel
Description:
My small group of five had a great experience with Smart Asia Travel on a customized tour of Vietnam and Cambodia. Duong handled the booking with detail and care and Tu, Huyá»n and Chhiev guided with knowledge, care and enthusiasm. In Vietnam, we explored historic Hanoi, experienced the breathtaking sites of Halong bay including kayaking and cave hiking, immersed ourselves into New Years in Ho Chi Minh City and took in the Mekong Delta by water, on foot and by tuk tuk. And in Cambodia we explored Siem Reap, especially Angkor Wat and Angkor Thom and explored the floating fishing village on Tonle Sap Lake.
All the plans were made by Smart Asia Travel including flights, transfers, hotels and guided excursions.
Smart Asia Travel is first-class and delivered exactly what we requested and more.
Girl Travel Tours highly recommend this local agency and plan to send more groups their way.

Description: We took a one day tour from Hanoi to Ninh Binh with Sa after we received a recommendation from fellow travelers and had the best time! We started the morning by going on a small local boat ride down the Tam Coc River, along rice fields and mountains, and even into caves. We then had a delicious lunch in the small â€œdowntownâ€ area, followed by a bike ride in the local villages to the Hoa Lu temples of the Dinh & Le Dynasties, climbing the 500 steps to get to the top and take in breathtaking views of the towns & river below. Sa was an amazing tour guide all along the way and gave great insight into Vietnamese culture. We highly recommend taking a tour with Sa!

Title: The Bike Shop
Address: 250 Nguyen Van Huong, Thao Dien, District 2, ThÃ nh phá»‘ Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh 70000 Viá»‡t Nam
Description:
Recently I had a 2 day bike trip with James Wolf, co-owner of the Bike Shop. It was a great time. James took great care of me planning fun and interesting rides. He provided a great bike, I had never ridden a fat tire bike before but I found it fun and perfect for the terrain. We biked through a forest, on a beach and through small towns. He is American and it was so nice not to have any communication problems. He has lived in Vietnam for some 25 years so he really understood the culture and area which made for an informative trip. He loves photography and we got some great shots. We made tons of stops for pics and questions about what I was seeing.
Bradley his partner helped set up the trip and provided guidance for me while I was in Ho Chi Minh city. These guys were great and I highly recommend using them!

Title: Indochina Trends - Asian Tour Operator
Description: Organized by Thuy of Indochina Trends (IT), we covered Hanoi, Halong Bay, Hue, Hoi An, and Ho Chi Minh City in 12 days. She put together a thoughtful itinerary with great guides (notably Long in Hanoi and Nhug in Hue). Unmissable: Hanoi street food, 2D1N Bai Tu Long Bay cruise, Thuy Biey village in Hue, and the Cu Chi tunnels in Ho Chi Minh. When we wanted to change our itinerary in the last minutes, Thuy came back with the amended program in within a day! They didn't put a foot wrong. I strongly recommend IT for their thoughtful planning and excellent services.

We ordered the trip a day before, and there was some problems with the website, but we called the staff and they were very helpful.
We drove in a very good private bus, with an awesome guide called Betty. She was super nice, and made the tour fun and memorable. She was very good at answering questions, and explaining the Virtnamiese culture to us, which we found interesting. She kept a good mood all day, and smiled a lot. She were also a very good friends and polite to all the locals, which made them more positive and open to us :)
We really liked all stops on the tour, and we would recommend this trip to everyone!

Title: Flamingo Jeep Tours HANOI Vietnam
Description: Flamingo Jeep tour of Hanoi was such a great experience! I was working as a gap year instructor and took my group of 14 students who were 18 years old on this trip which was such a great way for them to see so much of Hanoi in a short amount of time, especially because we only had a limited time to see the city. Our guide was great and super informative and explained a lot about the history. We were able to see parts of the city, West Lake and the beautiful Banana Island which feels like youâ€™re in a different world. Chris and his team were super helpful and professional and were open to making accommodations for our group. We loved playing our own music and cruising around, taking in all the crazy sights of this incredible city! Definitely a highlight of our time in Hanoi and perfect for so many types of groups/families/friends! You can check out my Instagram for more where I share a reel and stories from our trip @wildkat.wanders

Title: Uyen Tran
Description:
My Wife & I, have just finished a 5day tour from Da Lat to Hoi An.
We were recommended to Uyen "Ian" by a friend who previously did a tour with him and Raved about it.
Uyen responded quickly to Any questions or queries we had & put them to rest.
He arrived the day before and wanted to explain how he conducts the tour & summarizes what we want to experience along the way.
Uyen made us feel very comfortable & relaxed with his approach & manor.
And what an Experience this turned into, we can't Praise Uyen enough & this has proven to be a Highlight of our trip.
This Experience introduced us to the local people, the food and the coffee of the regions we traveled through.

We Highly Recommend Uyen as a guide and his experience really Shines through

Title: VietMate
Description:
We arrived in Vietnam, (Ho Chi Minh) for our 3 week trip with a loose plan of travelling to Hanoi then working our way back to Ho Chi Minh, We had booked the first two nights accommodation, Internal flights and a Halong Bay Cruise. With nothing else booked we contacted Minh and asked if he could organise tours (Meekong Delta, Chu Chi Tunnels, Ninh Binh, Phong Nha Cave, waterfalls, Ba Na Hills, the Marble Mountain and Hoi an). Minh arranged all accommodation, travel, guides, meals and activities to suit exactly what we wanted to get out of the trip. The highlights of this trip where definitely all the great places we visited and the icing on the cake was the Cyclo ride around Hue with Minh and dinner at Banana Mango. The conclusion of our Vietnam visit was made complete by enjoying lunch with Minh in Danang before flying to Ho Chi Minh to get our flight back home.
Huge thanks to Minh, his family and his team for making our trip Awesome.

Title: Perla Dawn Sails
Description: We were transferred to the Perla Dawn Sails when our original booking didn't go ahead amidst drop in demand over the coronavirus outbreak). We were not disappointed - Quynh picked us up in Hanoi and proved a brilliant tour guide - super-friendly and enthusiastic, full of information, and speaking excellent English. We had just the one night in Kan Ha Bay but managed to fit in a small boat trip to Cat Ba, where we saw the monkeys in the wild, kayaking round an oyster farm, cookery demonstration by the amazingly talented chef (whose fabulous food we had already thoroughly enjoyed) and of course just relaxing in the very comfortable cabin taking in the incredible scenery. All the staff were delightful - we particularly remember Mr Lucky, who was always helpful and attentive and made sure everything ran smoothly. Cocktails on the upper deck as the sunset are a patricular memory, as is the shrimp fishing from the deck after dinner, chatting to Quynh about all things to do with Vietnam. This was a highlight of our trip - we are so sorry that the coronavirus outbreak has closed all Halong Bay tours for the moment and send all the staff our best wishes - we hope that you all stay safe, and that fantastic trips resume as soon as possible.

Title: Hoi An Bike Tour
Description: This part of our tour was lots of fun. We were met in a parking lot near the edge of the city where we got our bicycle, adjusted our seats and off we went. All but 3 of our group of 35 followed each other. The remaining 3 were able to hire a rickshaw to follow us. The bike ride was about an hour long and we pedalled through the countryside and ended up in a small covered installation in the middle of a field. We got a cooking class on how to make imperial rolls etc. which we ate for lunch. Refreshments were also served. We biked a bit more and left our bikes in a predetermined location and were picked up to continue our journey by bus. Nice touch away from the big city noises.

Title: Footstep Travel Group
Description:
It's been 15 years passed since I've been to Hoi An at the first time with my sister before she's been living to Germany in 2005. And I remembered that time my mum was booked for our trip at the tourist office called Vietnam Tour Expert, and now is called Footsteps Travel :). And we met Hung here :).
As you may not know, that time we were both 15 years old ,teenagers and never got any experience to go anywhere without my mum and dad. So, almost 24/24hours if we didn't understand anything or just worried about got lost at somewhere, missed the bus, stucked at the plan or something wanted to changed, etc ,...I called Hung straight away and he answered me even the clock said it's 4:00am in the morning or 12:00pm at the midnight. Sounds like ...lot of memories reminded me at the moment !.
My sister and I were both safe and enjoyed our trip from Hanoi to Hoi An for five days. We all enjoyed everything, everything in Hoi An.
After 15 years passed, My parents, sister's family and I all just been back to Hoi An last 3 month ago ..And yes, still definitely stick with Hung and booked our trips in 6 days to Hoi An and Da Nang with Footsteps Travels....All the things were great , best trip and the best service ever . All the memories were made us cried in happy tears.
We couldn't met Hung again in Hoi An, but he gave a big surprise for my dad with a redwine bottle as a gift on his belated birthday in Dao Tien riverside Restaurant. :).
The driver're friendly, foods're delicious, the accomodation even were upgraded to Family suite at Bella Maison Hotel. ...
Believe me, choosing Footsteps Travel or talk to Hung, he will not only a good agency who will give you all the best things. Also, he can be a good big kind brother that treat you as a special sister ever .
Highly recommend all of you guys should come to Hoi An and believe me, Footstep TRavel is number one in your list that you won't be dissapointed with any purposed of your travels.
Thank You Hung and Footstep Travel .
Regards,
Thuy Nguyen

Title: Kin Trekking Tours Sapa
Description:
We had the best time trekking for two days in Sapa. Kin has arranged everything for us, transport from Hanoi to Sapa, homestay, tickets for the cable car and areas which we visited, water, breakfasts, lunches, everything.
I have contacted Kin on Facebook, and he responded very fast and answered all of my numerous questions. He wanted to create a plan which suited us the best.
We arrived at Sapa at 4 am and Kin got to the station to pick us up, we went to the homestay where we could shower, sleep and eat breakfast.
On the first day, we hiked to Cat Cat Village, had lunch in Sapa town and after lunch went to Fansipan by cable car.
On the second day, we walked through rice terraces, Y Linh Ho village where we also had lunch. After lunch, we continued our walk to Lao Chai and Ta Van villages.
During the day Kin asked us multiple times which route suits us better - if we want the route which goes up and down or the one where you walk on the road.
The price was fair. The food was great. The homestay - GreenHouse Sapa is also really nice. The night bus from Hanoi to Sapa was also much more comfortable than we expected.

I can not imagine a better tour guide, we have experienced Sapa, learned a lot about their culture and seen beautiful nature. If we haven't booked a tour guide, we wouldn't be able to see so much and hike on such interesting routes.

Thank you Kin, and I would recommend him to everybody!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 4 trÃªn 11 Äá»“ Äƒn & Äá»“ uá»‘ng á»Ÿ Sapa

Title: Wendy Tour
Description: I have just got back from the Vietnam Panorama tour, what an absolutely fantastic tour. My second tour with Wendy Wu and everything is faultless. The two tour guides William and Peter were excellent. All of the hotels were of a very high standard. All of the meals were superb. The excursions were all excellent and give a real insight into Vietnam. I honestly cannot recommend Wendy Wu enough! Just a warning- there are lots of steps involved and getting on and off of some of the fishing boats was slightly difficult, so if you are not too good on your feet I wouldn't recommend this trip.

Title: Asia Highlight Travel
Description: We had the most amazing family vacation in Vietnam and Cambodia organized by Asia Highlights. The organization was perfect. Albee was very knowledgeable, proactive (e.g. reminder to organize visa) and responsive. Everything worked very smoothly as promised. The design of the trip was perfect. The guides were outstanding, especially Chan Sovannarith in Siem Reap and Zen in Saigon. Asia Highlights are my go-to-guys for the next Asia vacation as well.

Title: HIFI Travel
Description: I had the pleasure of joining Hifi Travel's basket boat tour and cooking class, and it exceeded all my expectations! The basket boat tour was a serene and scenic journey, allowing me to soak in the beauty of the surroundings. The guide shared interesting stories about the local culture and history, making the experience even more enriching. Following the basket boat tour, the cooking class was a hands-on experience where I learned authentic Vietnamese recipes. The chef was knowledgeable and patient, ensuring that everyone understood the techniques and flavors. The class ended with a delicious meal that we all prepared together. Hifi Travel offers a well-rounded and enjoyable package for those seeking to explore both nature and culinary delights in Vietnam

Title: Thong Dong Vegan Tour Sapa
Description: Friendly and open local tour guide. We could ask anything we wanted. Together with the booking agent they were supportive and flexible in changing plans because of the weather. They even insisted to compensate us for our decision to cut the trip short. Even though we did not complete the tour we had an amazing time. The landscape was so beautiful and the things shared in conversation with our tour guide really gave us an insight into the lives of the tribes living within the valleys. To top it off you get a delicious vegan lunch and a voucher for the Thong Dong Vegan Restaurants. We really recommend doing the tour with these beautiful souls! Thank you Khai and Ãnh!

Title: Mike's Travel Agency
Description:
I travel to Vietnam with my elderly mum so I booked VIP cabin bus transfer with Mike from Ninh Binh to Sapa then transfer to Hanoi then Halong Bay and Airport. It is so easy to communicate with him. My bus is scheduled for 10.30pm so he stay with us till the bus arrived. He is also very responsible to follow up with you on the bus schedule arrival and make sure you get onto the right bus. Also he speak fluent english so asked away all you question with him.

His office locate next to bus station in Ninh Binh 2 min. walk from Tam Coc boat ticket booth.

Thank you,

Title: ELON FARMSTAY

Our farm stay was incredible, a highlight of our Vietnam trip. I would love to visit again the next time I am in Vietnam. Jenny and her family made us feel so comfortable and at home from the moment we arrived. We were given a very interesting and informative insight into life in their village. Jenny and her husband are very knowledgeable about everything in their village and so happy and proud to share.

The food was incredible. The accommodations are very comfortable. It really felt like hanging out at a friend's place. I love the fact that the tour can be customized to your individual interests.

Title: Snail Adventure Tours
Description:
Tony runs an excellent bicycle tour. My husband and I are Hanoi residents and we did a 5 day ride in Cao Bang with Tony. Normally, we do self guided bike tours, but in Vietnam, we felt it was wiser to go with a tour and a guide. Due to Covid, there were only 2 of us on this trip.

Tony knows what he is doing and he is a true professional. He knows all of the small village roads and took us through some jaw dropping scenery. His bikes are high quality (Trek and Cannondale) and are incredibly well maintained. We were able to get off of the beaten path and ride to and through regions that arenâ€™t too used to western tourists. Tony includes a support van and takes safety seriously.

He booked hotels that were clean and comfortable and selected delicious dinner spots that served local cuisine. Lunches were cooked by Tony and Mr. Tang (the driver) and were excellent.

You canâ€™t beat the value for the price. We are looking forward to another bicycle trip with Tony. I highly recommend Snail Adventures.

Title: Sapa Tours With Pham
Description:
What a wonderful, unforgettable, authentic experience!
We booked the 3 days / 2 nights tour with Pham. Everything was perfectly organised including the pick up from and drop off at the Train Station in Lao Cai.
The trekking introduced us to the beautiful nature of vietnamâ€˜s north, the homestay to the way of life of the Red Daos.
Pham and her family welcomed us warmly, we laughed a lot and had many interesting conversations. Everyday After the Trekking we enjoyed an amazing herbal bath in Phamâ€˜s Spa. A looooot of Food was cooked in the evenings, and there was more than enough vegetarian/vegan food for me.
If you want to experience the north of vietnam in an authentic way, do it with Pham and der lovely Family! We will never forget this!

Title: Vietnam Motorcycle Tours
Description:
Je voulais dÃ©couvrir le delta du Mekong sans prendre de bus. J'aurais pu louer une moto et y aller seul mais je prÃ©fÃ©rai avoir un guide pour pallier Ã  tout alÃ©a.

J'ai eu qqes difficultÃ©s Ã  joindre TÃ¢m dans un premier temps, il n'a pas de bureau pour recevoir les clients, pas de moto en dÃ©monstration, pas de catalogue des excursions... Mais beaucoup d'avis positifs sur TripAdvisor, alors j'ai fait confiance.

Pour ces 2j de voyage j'ai eu KC comme guide, sur sa propre moto qui Ã©tait similaire Ã  la mienne, j'avais rÃ©servÃ© une Honda xr150 car je suis trÃ¨s grand et trÃ¨s lourd. Il semble que TÃ¢m loue la moto Ã  une autre entreprise, ce qui permet d'avoir des motos bien entretenues.

Un guide pour sortir de Hcmv Ã©tait bienvenu, la premiÃ¨re journÃ©e, nous avons beaucoup roulÃ©, sous la chaleur, des arrÃªts rÃ©guliers pour s'hydrater, qqes visites d'artisanat et de fermes. Le soir une excellente surprise avec un hÃ©bergement trÃ¨s sympa et un bon dÃ®ner. Le deuxiÃ¨me jour trÃ¨s chargÃ© en activitÃ©s touristiques mais surtout nous avons empruntÃ© de nombreuses petites routes (que pour les motos) au cÅ“ur du delta. C'Ã©tait un plaisir.

Title: Tour Guide in Tay Ninh
Description:
I chose Binh as I was interested in a tour that would take me to a different attraction in Vietnam from normal and let me learn more about the local cultural / religious practices. Do check out Binh's Facebook as he has come up with new tours besides this one - for the tour I chose, I believe he is the only English-speaking tour operator who has an itinerary that combines the Black Virgin Mountain and Cao Dai Holy See in one day!

I had a great tour with Binh, who was happy to answer my questions about local cultures and practices, all while navigating the crazy rush hour drive to and from Ho Chi Minh and the long drive to Tay Ninh. Being a local from Tay Ninh and having grown up in a Cao Dai family, he gave a lot of much needed context to the various places that we visited. Not to mention the food that he got throughout the tour - he was accomodating of my dietary restrictions and gave me a chance to experience some truly local delicacies.

I highly recommend booking a tour with Binh - he is a passionate, knowledgeable tour guide who strives to give his best and the most authentic local experiences, all while charging a fair price for the tour that he gives back to his local community. Wishing Binh all the best for the future!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 1 trÃªn 3 Hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng ngoÃ i trá»i á»Ÿ TÃ¢y Ninh

Title: Dalat Easy Rider
Description: We did the fantastic country tour with Dalat Easy Riders as two adults and two kids aged 8 & 11. Our guides, Vu, Peter, Kai and Son took really good care of us, they spoke excellent English and drove really carefully at all times. We always felt safe despite the traffic. The tour avoided the heavy sell, we saw some really beautiful and interesting things and the extremely cheap restaurant we were taken to for lunch was absolutely delicious. Highly recommended.

Title: Shore Excursions Asia
Description:
We went on this tour with a cruise critic group and in general, it was very good, but didn't quite measure up to the tour we'd had the previous day. We started in Hoi An, which was really fun to wander through but mainly a shopping expedition. Our guide then asked if we wanted coffee and since several in our tour said yes, we stopped, and then were surprised that we had to pay. Why did we stop if it wasn't included in the tour? Then we went to the Marble Mountains but since we'd been there the day before, we waited for our group outside. (They also had to pay for their own elevator tickets). Since they weren't in for very long, I'm not sure if they got into the grottoes or not. Finally, we went to the Cham museum. So many people on the tour were tired and wanted to cut it short, but I'm glad we stayed for a full 40 minutes. It was fascinating.

The tour included a very nice lunch in a local restaurant consisting of many courses.

Our guide wasn't as engaging as some others we've had. He seemed to know a lot but it always required us asking questions before he shared the information. We drove past the old US airbase and he didn't even mention it! Perhaps he was trying to guide the tour according to the wishes of the group, but the result was a tour that didn't really seem very organized or informative. On the other hand, he did make an unplanned stop so people could buy masks as the coronavirus was just beginning to hit the news.

Title: DNQ Travel
Description: From the moment we arrived until our departure, we were looked after and escorted by local guides who were very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the whole tour, including a magnificent overnight cruise on Halon Bay. We travelled in air-conditioned mini buses and also had two internal flights to Da Nang and Ho Chi Minh City. The whole tour was extremely well organised and we are very grateful to Mr Dong, at DNQ Travel, who personally made sure that every part of our tour went smoothly and was an unforgettable experience for us. We had the best time of our lives and would highly recommend using DNQ Travel.

Title: Asia Tourify
Description: I recently joined Asia Tourify for a tour to the historical city of Hue in Vietnam, and it was a remarkable experience. The tour guide was passionate and shared fascinating stories about the city's imperial past. Visiting the ancient citadel and exploring the royal tombs was a journey back in time. The boat ride along the Perfume River, with its picturesque landscapes, was serene and beautiful. The accommodations provided by Asia Tourify were comfortable, and the overall organization of the tour was commendable. I highly recommend Asia Tourify for a culturally enriching trip to Hue.

Title: KN Golf Links Cam Ranh
Address: Long Beach, Cam Ranh 650000 Viá»‡t Nam
Description:
Every country I go to I try and play the best few courses in that country if I can. I have always found Top100 to be a good gage and have yet to really disagree with the ratings. However the KN Links course south of Nha Trang in Vietnam is the most underwhelmed and disappointed Iâ€™ve ever been playing golf. It started when they texted me at 8pm the night before telling me that the front 9 was out of use and I could only play the back 9 and the 9 hole course The Ocean. This was despite me making my booking several days before and insisting I only wanted to play if it was the KN Links as I wasnâ€™t fussed on playing the 9 hole course.

Then when I arrived I found out that the whole course was undergoing maintenance with the greens basically bunkers, diggers all round the side of the course and the general standard of the course being about that of a Â£30 pay and play course in the U.K. I havenâ€™t looked at the finances of the club but I got the impression from the lack of people and poor condition that they are struggling financially, perhaps still suffering the impact of Covid which is understandable, but the price should come down accordingly.

As for the design, I am a low single digit handicapper and really into course architecture and I have to say that out of the 10+ Norman courses I have played, this was the least inspiring design. The course is not a links course at all and the majority of the holes were completely forgettable. It still had the Norman look to it in terms of the shapes of the fairways and positions of big fairway bunkers, but just lacked any interest or real creatively.

Overall out of the 3 courses I played in Vietnam (Ba Na Hills, Vinpearl Nha Trang and here, it was by far the worst and nowhere close to being worth the fee charged. This is the first time I have left a golf course feeling truly disappointed and ripped off and so the highest I can rate This place is 2.5 star.

Title: 1925 Halong Adventure
Description:
opted for a different experience and got to see the night scene of Halongâ€™s beauties through a night tour with Halong Adventure where we went â€œfishingâ€ for squids!

went on a local boat, got to see the fishing village and went further out in the dark to catch squids. rods are provided and guide will show you the technique to fish for them

felt kind of like a local fishing and it was nice to just be surrounded by peaceful waters. it was a beautiful experience to see the limestone karsts at night and even got to see the bioluminescent phytoplankton through the waves of the boat!

tours are customisable with the company- can let them know what you have in mind to see/do and they will happily curate accordingly for you

Title: Hagiang Trekking Tour
Description:
I arrived alone in Ha Giang, last 14 august, and have no idea of how preparing my trip in this province, just arrived I checked lonely planet and saw thart Jonhy where the only guide recommended in lonely planet Vietnam. Went down main Street and maybe because of karma I saw a big truck with his name, five minutes later I found Jonnhy and from this moment everythig Flow.
We did a fantastic round of five days tour in two superb motocross bikes, lliterally he is the boss, everybody knew him, and his driving experience is notoriuos and helped so much to feel you safe in every moment.
He has two homestays, personally y I stayed with his beautiful family two days, and make me feeling like if I were at home. He treat you like one more of his family. I had been five times before in Vietnam, and Jonh makes me feel that this time had been the most beautiful experiende in many years travelling. After this time I feel I have a gOOOd friend in Vietnam

Title: Phong Nha Pioneer Travel
Description: Great trip to Phong Nha Cave and Paradise Cave in one day from Dong Hoi. The best tour company in Dong Hoi I would say. The tour was done in a professional way with excellent English tour guide, spotless car with friendly driver. The sites of Phong Nha Cave and Paradise Cave were absolutely amazing. The scenery on the way to Phong Nha cave entrance was marvelous with gorgeous mountain ranges and tranquil landscapes. We thus explored really beautiful caves and grottoes in Phong Nha and the ones in Paradise cave as well. Both caves with magical scenery and it is a truly adventure tour for us. So, we love Phong Nha Cave and Paradise Cave so much and a big thank to Phong Nha Pioneer Travel for a great trip worth value with our money.

Title: Go Surfing

Location had a good balance of big and small waves this time of year for beginners and the ratio of instructors to students was 2:3 which means plenty of direct attention and help. Super great class and I felt a lot better catching waves by the end of the session. Rob and Alex are also just all-around super friendly and great people so no matter your surfing experience, you'll have a fun time. Excited to go surfing here again if I'm ever back in Hoi An.

Title: Stone Motorbikes
Description: Great experience with Stone Motorbikes! There are a lot of motorbike rental shops in Hanoi, but most are not helpful (and don't speak English). My girlfriend and I wanted to take a tour to Sapa by motorbike, and we were recommended by a friend to go to Stone Motorbikes. The owner Stone Le booked our tour and motorbikes so we had no hassle to worry about! Stone is Vietnamese, but speaks fluent English, and he's very friendly and funny! Sapa was beautiful, I highly recommend taking this tour! We each had our own motorbike, they worked very well, and Stone even taught us how to drive so we felt comfortable. If you're planning a trip from Hanoi, or just need to rent a motorbike, definitely check out Stone Motorbikes!

During the hike, he was very patient with us and often guiding us when the trail gets slippery/ challenging. Overall, it was a very fun and enjoyable experience to have Toa as our guide.
