Title: Vietnam Bike Tours
Description:
Trung took 3 of us â€œMedicareâ€ eligible on a 1/2 day country side tour of Hanoi. But to get to the countryside we first had to cycle about an 1/2 hour thru the craziness of Hanoi city. Cars, rickshaws, motor scooters, potholes, , No stop lights, no lanes, free full all traffic. I swear my heart has never beat so fast. But Trung was very good about guiding us into the country. I swear a bus was inches from me along part of the way. But we made it to the countryside and so enjoyed the rest of our trip. We crossed the Red River twice on a very old ferry. Truant stopped and bought us rain ponchos with the threat of rain. We visited a pagoda - we were the only ones there along with the Buddhist monk. Stopped by a small market and bought some local fruit and sat and ate it at a beautiful temple.

After returning to the city, Trung took us to a local street PHO place. Followed by some famous EGG coffeee. Sounded terrible but try it.....a real treat.

Scarey but great bragging rights! Try to get Trung as your guide.

Title: The Real Kangaroo CafÃ© Tours
Description: We'd like to thank Max and Miss Thuy for the wonderful organization of our 19 day Vietnam holiday in March. The thoroughness they went to, to ensure we were looked after, and the places we visited were amazing. To experience the flavourism food with all those spices was one of the best things we enjoyed. Our guide Vinnie was exceptional and we couldn't fault him. He went above and beyond what was expected. They made our holiday seamless from the bouquet of Rose's upon arrival at HaNoi airport through to riding with them and Foxy on their scooters weaving in and out of dense traffic. The accommodation was superb. Even though Max is an Aussie, from these kiwis, we think you're the best. These guys add the personal touch that other mass merchant travel agents don't. If anyone needs any reassurance about the Real Kangaroo Cafe, this is the real McCoy. No fake news here.

Title: Yen's Tour
Description:
Fantastic tour. Yen greeted me in HCMC, from where we made our way to the Mekong Delta by minivan with bicycles in the back. Over the next three days, Yen took me on some amazing bike rides through areas that were so interesting and diverse. We took ferries on several occasions and jumped back in the van once or twice. The tour covered area around Vinh Long, Can Tho and Cai Be.
We stopped at several places of interest over the three days, took in a great boat trip and the floating market near Can Tho. Yen organised a wonderful trip for me. Included breakfasts and lunches were wonderful and the accommodation each night was of very high quality.
Yen was fantastic. Her knowledge of the area was first class and she had everything so well organised .. from accommodation to the boat that met us in the middle of nowhere to take us on a great trip down the river to where we could continue cycling from ... Thank you Yen, for a very memorable tour. I highly recommend her, fantastic guide (I would have got totally lost trying to do this on my own!) along with being very friendly and personable. Thank You.

Title: Vietnam VIP Tours & Private Transfers
Description:
We are Best friends from USA traveling together only for a week, we had decided to go 4 days starting from Saigon to Dalat and did a flight to Danang.

The trip from Saigon up to Central Highland and Dalat was amazing with their guides Mr Sunny and Mr Li who really good took care for whole trip about accomodation, foods, place to see . Can say everything were awesome and we were so happy and enjoyed every minute.

This trip you can be explored all special thing from central highland and historical that haven't to much tourist yet.

They're so great in accommodating good room, good local food and beautiful landscaping.

Thank you so much for great experience for us in Vietnam.
Hope we will do another trip from Dalat to North more days with you.
Would recommend this company to everyone who want to explore Central Highland from Saigon.
Best Regards
From Anna

Title: Top Motorbike Tours Vietnam
Description:
Im from Australia and I wasnt sure which company to choose when riding around vietnam. I am so glad i went with Tan!

The scenery was amazing. The bikes were excellent. We chose to ride on crf250 which was plenty enough power for the trip.

The homestays where amazing with friendly home owners cooking amazing meals and the homes where massive with plenty of space for privacy and own time if wanted.

The tour came with bikes, riding gear, wet weather gear, tour guide, mechanic, 3 meals a day and more food and drinks anytime you were hungry.
Accomodation which was two nights in homestays and two nights in hotels.

We went on the 5 day ride. I wish i went on a 7-8 day ride actually.

Tan gave us plenty of options each day on which tracks to ride. Choosing easy riding or scenic or motorcross. Depending on how our bodies fet or what mood we where in.

Tan adjusts the trip to suit you and make ot the most pleasurable for your fitness and capabilities.

Some days we rode hard and other times just cruised and soaked it all in. Ive never seen such constantly changing and amazing scenery in my life and ive travelled 14 countries so far. From UK, Europe to Asia to Americas.

I highly recommend to go with Tan. You will not be disappointed at all. And hes rates are super competitive. Some companies give ypu far less for more cost.

Overall 20 out of 10.

Thanks Tan. Cant wait to come back again:)

Title: BRG Legend Hill Golf Resort
Description: BRG Legend Hill Golf Resort was our final game before our flight home, with Hanoi Airport just 20 min away. However, we were advised to leave 2 hours earlier from our hotel in Hanoi Old Quarter, to allow for the morning traffic delays and to complete our game in time. Checking- in was quick probably due to weekday low demand. A friendly course layout that has uniquely 2 greens per hole and is very playable from white tees with some challenging, but manageable holes. Gentle valleys, plenty of green space and planted trees blooming with flowers . Greens were reasonably fast but the caddy was helpful with her excellent line readings, though she spoke limited English. Generally, the condition of the course was excellent and well maintained.

Title: Da Nang Hoi An Waterfalls
Description:
Had the best day in Vietnam so far with the guide Tony. We were looking for something off the beaten track, and this was definately that! One hour motorbike ride and we went into the jungle. No other people, just amazing scenery and a good vibe. You can choose different waterfalls, we went for Kaylene and do not regret it. He also brought us lunch which his grandma had made - delicious, thanks!

But, you should be somewhat fit and adventurous to do this trip as the jungle trekking and rock climbing can be a bit challenging at times:)

As a car rental company to Thung Nai from Hanoi, we have many opportunities to visit this place with customers.
It has long been known as one of the top beautiful tourist destinations of Hoa Binh province. With charming natural scenery, the harmony between nature, mountains and rivers, creates a poetic picture.
Quite close to Hanoi, so you can go to Thung Nai to visit and sightsee within a day. If you are a person who likes to experience, you can go by motorbike, go by private car or rent a car to Thung Nai of service companies.

Title: Dark Cave Phong Nha Tours
Description: A friend and I came to the cave and spent a hilarious couple of hours getting involved in the sporty and active adventure within the cave. We missed the safety video which in hindsight would have been helpful as we did not know how to successfully stop ourselves as the bottom of the zipline (we both graciously crashed into the mat). We had a lot of fun with our tour guide who helped us get equipped with helmets and torches before we acclimatised to the cold water, swam 10-40m to the cave entrance and hiked in through a muddy pathway. The guide called out when we needed to slow down to get safely through the tunnel. We arrived at a mud bath which was very slippery but the whole group loved getting fully involved in the mud and we had a great laugh all together. If you do not want to get muddy, this trip is NOT for you. Then we went back out for a cold dip and to remove the mud from our bodies and clothing, before kayaking (which was a lot of effort after we had laughed so much) back to the adventure course. This part is optional but we stayed and did a mini zip line, a big dive into the water and a small assault course over the water. A very fun afternoon and well worth the price if you are with a good group of adventurous people!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 1 trÃªn 2 GiaÌ‰i triÌ vÃªÌ€ Ä‘Ãªm á»Ÿ Son Trach

Title: Viet Beauty Cruise - Private Day Tour
Description:
Picked up right on time and had a pleasant drive to Ha Long Bay in an air-conditioned bus. The guide was friendly and spoke good English. Food on the boat was REALLY good! Rooms were good and clean with private bathrooms. Boat only had about 12 rooms so it is small and that is really nice. In the tour you see some cool caves and a pearl production place. You can also get kayaks and get the chance to swim off of a beach one day. Water is however very dirty and pretty crowded.

We decided to pay slightly more and go for Viet Beauty which we are happy to have done. If you want good food, clean rooms, a small and calm boat, Viet Beauty is great. Many other boats are huge and dirty, many are also over booked and have people sleeping on floors, really loud karaoke etc.

Title: Golf in Danang
Address: 12 4, Bach Dang Street, ÄaÌ€ NÄƒÌƒng 550000 Viá»‡t Nam
Description:
Our G4Fun group descended on Danang for a 5 golf game schedule in the cool weather at the beginning of the year. The 5 courses are BRG Danang, Ba Na,Montgomerie,Hoian A Shores.
I like golfing in Thailand as most of the Clubs there provide for yellow tees for the benefit of seniors. Not so in Vietnam. On this trip, I opted to play from red tee and was happy to do so.
Both the BRG courses are well designed,with enough hazards to challenge both social and good golfers.
On the other hand, Montgomerie earned the distinction of worst value for money course.
The Group was unanimous that Hoian A Shores is the best of the courses on this trip. The greens and fairways were immaculaete.
The toilets and amenities are the best we have experienced on this trip. This link course is close to the sea and the winds were one of the challenges.
Understand this course is regarded as the best in Vietnam.
On a personal note, the BRG course designed by Nicklaus is the best as l had my best score on this trip at this course.

Title: Hoho Travel
Description:
Our guide seemed nice but didn't speak English, so he wasn't able to tell us anything about the places we were at. He took us to a marble factory, which was interesting, but he just dropped us off. He then took us on to Hoi An, which we were looking forward to. When we asked if he could recommend a restaurant, he dropped us off in front of one and just pointed. We would have liked to try the Anthony Bourdain restaurant, but forgot it was an option to ask for and did not have it offered to us.

In the end, we feel like we ended up paying $100s of dollars for a taxi ride to Hoi An and back.

Title: Blue Swimmer Sailing
Description: We're ib Cat ba island during the Corona time, so our time here was so quiet and empty. The highlight was our day trip with Blue Swimmer Adventures on private wooden boat. The guide was so friendly, knowledgeale and professional, they told us a lot about local life and floating villages. The kayaking tour was really cool to explore hidden lagoons and beaches and lunch was just amazing with a lot of seafood. This tour agency was recommended to us by friends and we 're so happy to go with them. Excellent value for money and highly appreciated

Title: Halong Bay Tourist - Private Day Tours
Description:
We booked a tour with Halong Bay Tours and have had a wonderful holiday in Vietnam. Halong Bay Tours are organised, punctual and we have felt well looked after from a schedule and transport point of view too in a very foreign environment where few locals speak English. Having said that, once you have familiarised yourself with Vietnam, you discover the people to be incredibly warm, friendly and helpful.
One leg of our trip was a boat cruise to Halong Bay. Fantastic guide called Minh. Very informative, helpful and very entertaining with a great sense of humour. The boat itself, V'Spirit, was great with spacious and very comfortable clean 4 star cabin. Good good and amazing scenery. Highly recommended.

Title: TaÌ€u cao tÃ´Ìc Cam ViÃªÌ£t
Description:
Bruce at Mandarin Cruises helped me arrange a fantastic 5 day custom private charter cruise of the Mekong delta, plus return transport on his ferry service between Phnom Penh and Chau Doc. I can't say enough good things about their service, amazingly personal and responsive to my endless emails and WhatsApp messages.

Vien and the rest of the staff on the ferry were excellent, really friendly professional services. Super easy border crossing. Our party had the ferry to ourselves going down, so very comfortable. Bruce met us at the ferry terminal in Chau Doc and helped to get us set-up with SIM cards for Vietnam, then picked us up in the morning from hotel for a ride back to the dock.

The next morning we set-off for a 5 day charter on one of Mandarin's slow boats. Highly recommend if you're looking for a unique experience for a few days and have a sense of adventure. Very relaxing, just sipping drinks, playing cards and watching the world go by. There are endless small canals and waterways in the area to explore, and plenty of small towns along the way to stop along the way and get a room. Our captain was excellent, very accommodating to our requests. Basically worked like a self-hire boat with pilot, he took us anywhere on Google maps we wanted to go (but be prepared to do some of your own navigating).

These guys are pros and really put in the effort to provide a high standard of service. While everyone else said "no" to my travel plans, these guys went the extra mile to make it special.

Title: Halu Vietnam Tours
Description:
We booked our 10 day trip via Halu tours and it was perfect ! Booking requires a lot of thought and time to time management for a smooth experience and thanks to them we were able to enjoy a wonderful time. Most important of all: communication- we landed- our driver was ready, he already knew our airbnb location and if there was a problem at all even late night our operator miss Anne would gladly help out. Next day our route was already set with stops in between for lunch and every single one of the tour guides provided were knowledgeable and friendly, they also helped out with other personal needs like finding places for shopping particular items. Overall as a family of 4 our experience was very smooth and we definitely recommend it
to our friends ğŸ‘âœ¨ï¸

Title: Datanla New Alpine Coaster
Description:
such a fun experience! highly recommend if youâ€™re around. you get to control the speed.

the ride is split into two parts- first 3/4 of the ride has turns and ups and downs so play around with the speed as much as you can. you will stop at the waterfall for pictures and the remaining 1/4 of the ride isnâ€™t as exciting- more uphill and wonâ€™t be able to play with the speed much.

you can have a walk around the area to check out the other activities. thereâ€™s also a restaurant where the canyoning counter is. enjoy!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 34 trÃªn 66 Hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng ngoÃ i trá»i á»Ÿ ÄaÌ€ LaÌ£t

Title: Asia Tour Advisor
Description:
We booked the Mekong delta trip through Asia tour advisors as part of a 12 day trip through Vietnam. We dealt with Mr Luong for our trip and he was great. The guide who joined us on the delta trip was Tien and he was a lovely, sociable and informative guide who was fun to be with.
The tour through the Mekong was truly fascinating and the homestay an experience we will never forget for lots of reasons
We enjoyed learning to cook with the hosts in their traditional kitchen and it was a good way to meet the other guests.
The accommodation was very basic but the experience of being in the Mekong region and being closer to the lovely people who live there was worth it. Take bug spray though and use it liberally!!
We asked the host if she could provide us with a bowl of pho rather than the set lunch. she was very accommodating and at lunchtime presented us with a steaming bowl of the most fragrant and delicious pho we have ever eaten
The trip to and through the Mekong was organised with the precision we experienced through our time in Vietnam with Asia tour advisor and would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending them to family friends and everyone else!

Title: Sapa Hill Tribe Trekking
Description:
I can thoroughly recommend using this company. We had Ms. Chi Giang Thi as our guide on a trekking excursion and she was excellent. Chi speaks fluent English and she is from the local Muong tribe. Her history from childhood where she never went to school, from starting as a tour guide 10 years ago and learning English from the tourists, and now married with her own son is a remarkable story, and Chi is a fine example on what can be achieved. Full credit to her and her family.
The vehicle and driver she provided was very good, safe and comfortable.
In fact I only wish we had known about Chi before we arrived as I would have planned at least 5 excursions with her.
Chi also works for the Hotels as a guide for their guests, and this is how we first met her. This again reiterates her qualities, care, and reliability she gives to her clients.
So if you are staying in Sapa and want the best at a very good price then contact Chi or ask for her at the Hotels, you will not be disappointed.

Title: Indotrek
Description:
We have decided to visit South East Asia and looked for a local company that could organise our trip through the following countries: Myanmar, Thailand, Laos, Cambodia and Vietnam. We had a list of sights we wanted to see as a minimum, and a budget on our mind, so I have sent a request for proposal email to about 6 tour operators in SEA region. Some of them tried to talk us out of the idea of visiting so many countries at once, some tried to sell their existing package not caring about our individual needs. And there was Indotrek who replied fastest, fitted the budget the most and tailored our trip to exactly match our wish. Now that we are heading to the airport after our almost 3 weeks visiting the above countries, I would like to express my eternal gratitude to Indotrek to have organised such a faboulous and unforgottable tour for us.

Already from the beginning our consultant (Ms Trang) was very responsive and helpful, always giving exact answers to all questions we had. She has dutifully made sure our agenda fitted all our flight times (flights booked by myself) and that we had the necessary visas for the travel. We even were asked to fill out a guest profile form which then was sent to all our guides to get know us even before we met. All this lead to a perfectly organised journey, during which everything happened perfectly as scheduled. We were greeted by their reps at each airport, from and to where we very safely driven in brand new, clean, huge cars supplied with unlimited amount of bottled cold (what a treasure!!) water, and refreshing towels. The same standard applied to all sightseeing tours and roadtrips.

We had local guides in each region, all of them were very helpful and knowledgeable, speaking at least a good level of English in the ever-so-typical local accent.

For the budget we had we were accomodated mostly in guesthouses and 3* hotels most of which were centrally located, and equipped with the basic amenities you would look for on such a trip (mini fridge, aircon, hot shower, wifi, etc). Breakfast and 1 bottle/person complimentary water however were included in all cases. Whenever lunch or dinner was included as part of the trip (mostly on the cruises) they were delicious local dishes.

Finally, the sights that were included in the journey were carefully selected, providing a really enjoyable agenda with sufficient free time too. Once in Saigon (the city where Indotrek is based) we were invited to meet their brand manager who came to see us in our hotel, invited us for a drink and we could give feedback on our tour. Very nice idea.

To sum it all up, I would like to recommend Indotrek when you visit Indochina and I would definitely choose them again. It would be difficult to enlist all the names one by one, so collectively we would like to say a big thank you to Indotrek office team, to all our guides, drivers and cruise crew (Sompoo in Laos and Aclass in Vietnam) to make this a memorable dream holiday for us!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 163 trÃªn 425 Hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng ngoÃ i trá»i á»Ÿ ThÃ nh phá»‘ Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh

Title: Gem's Rider
Address: 34/1 Nguyá»…n Tri PhÆ°Æ¡ng, HuÃªÌ 530000 Viá»‡t Nam
Description:
I rented one motorbike from Hue to Hoi Han and they sent my luggage with their car. Once in Hoi An the motorbike had problem with one brake so temporarily they changed it with a smaller bike until the day after.
First problem: my luggage arrived 8.00pm instead of 1.00 pm. So at 8.00 pm when I was eating out in a restaurant they called me saying they were at my hotel with the luggage but they needed my passport. I told them I was going to give them my passport the day after when I was taking back the motorbike after been repaired. He answered no passport no luggage and he took my luggage back to his office. I had to leave the restaurant in a hurry so I could get my luggage.
In the morning of the forth day I went there to ask if I could rent one extra day. But they told me you must leave the motorbike now because your 4 day rent they ended. It was 10.00 am. So I went to my hotel walking to get the contract and went back there. So they understood after showing the contract they were wrong because my day ended at 9.00pm. So I asked for one extra day and I paid him cash. The next morning at 9.00am he texted me saying bring me back the motorbike unless you pay more money. When I wrote him of course not I already paid you yesterday he said no money no passport. If you don't want to have nightmares stay away from this company.

Title: Ha Giang Hideaway Tours
Description:
This was an incredible trip and must do for anyone travelling Vietnam. It gave me and my 4 friends an incredible insight into Vietnamese culture food and drink (CORNWINE!)
We were very unexperienced with motorbike but our tour guide Trung never rushed and always made sure we were safe and happy. Trung brought us to his Homestay where we had amazing food and drinks ! We travelled 380 km and saw incredible sights like the death cliff. Each day was filled with short breaks so you never felt as if you are driving for too long.
10/10 everyone is incredible from the sleeper bus to the people who cooked for us and our tour guides.

Title: Halong Bay Luxury Cruises
Description:
All our trip
to Vietnam got messed up because my husband whose US citizen didnt know he needed the visa. I call Mr. Lucas initially to cancel our schedule cruises and he ask me what is the problem, turns out he be able to help us, it was a huge help for us. Im thankful for Mr. Lucas, he takes good care of us before we arrive and till the day have to leave Vietnam,he never leave us , his just one message away. His very helpful and trustworthy. The cruise is very nice, especially we got a great tour guide as well. We would love to be back next year. If you ever need any help in your Vietnam trip, try to message Mr Lucas from Blue Asia Tours.

Title: Vietnam HIGHLANDS Tours
Description: We visited many places in Vietnam like Saigon, Hanoi, Halong bay and Kontum. Each destination has its own attraction. However, the trip in Kontum made us impressive because: local people are very friendly, local food is very delicious, the weather is really nice that we wish we could stay there for months. I certainly stay there for long time on my next trip to Kontum. Everything made our trip unforgettable. Thank you Mr Dung, our motorbike driver. You told us many helpful and interesting information about Kontum. I will recommend Vietnam Highlands Tours to my friends who plan visiting Vietnam next year. That was GREAT!

The bus was spacious and clean, we know what we pay for. May Hotel in Sapa was amazing, staff was very professional and thoughtful. We had a good time with cable car to Fansipan with lots of photos.
We could not say how much thanks enough for excellent customer services from Asia Holiday Deal. I definitely recommend your company to my friends.

Title: Halong Orchid Cruises
Description:
We went on the 3-day Orchid Trendy cruise. For us, the planned activities (visiting Trung Trang cave and cycling on Cat Ba Island) were the highlights. The whole trip was very well planned and run very smoothly. Every single one of the staff are amazing, so eager to help out where they can. A special shout out to our server Lisa who looked after us over the three days!

The ship itself is quite nice but feels a bit tired. Our room had some fixtures that were broken and the tap to fill the bathtub was so weak that it wouldâ€™ve taken hours to fill the tub so we had to abandon the idea of a bath. The water pressure and temperature of the shower was also a bit unpredictable.

I would recommend this cruise for anyone looking to do a combination of relaxing on the ship and doing activities off the ship.

Title: Mui Ne Tour And Transfer

Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 4 trÃªn 16 PhÆ°Æ¡ng tiÃªÌ£n giao thÃ´ng á»Ÿ MuÌƒi NeÌ

Title: Ninh Binh Daily Tours
Description:
The whole tour was almost perfect. Points:
1. The tour guide was A.M.A.Z.I.N.G. unfortunately I don't remember her name, but is a 25 year old Vietnamese girl with the best energy ever, she made the experience even better.
2.The bus and driver were fine, no complaints
3. The temples, I honestly didn't like this part, however is not about the tour itself, more about the temples, not very impressive if you've seen temples in Asia already, they are small and quite similar, at some point I just went to wonder myself around the area.
4. The boat part obviously is the main attraction, it was great scenery, the local boat lady was fine, the trip feels long and refreshing, we even jumped into the water out of craziness. My only complaint is about the system itself, not the tour company. 70% of the time you are being asked for money, in one way or another, by taking photos of you, by giving tips, it's gets to the point of being very annoying. But the worst part is when you reach the end of the boat ride (or the point where you turn around) and they offer you to buy some snacks, they also offer you to buy for the boat person, as a tip, the annoying part is that they give without you even saying yes or no, OF COURSE, at any point you can just say no, but it's very annoying nonetheless, and the worst part, they don't even eat/drink the snacks, they storage them and return them back, so they can keep doing the same.
5. The bike ride was too short and the scenery was quite normal, I wasn't really expecting much from this so it didn't disappoint at the end. (be aware of the people taking photos again, so they can sell them to you later).

At the end the Ninh Binh scenary is beautiful and amazing, but the whole experience is annoying with SO MANY people doing stuff to get money out of you, I was in Sapa and Halong Bay during the same trip and didn't feel like I felt in Ninh Binh regarding this topic.

The tour company and the tour itself is recommended, it's only ruined by things out of their control. The tour guide did warned us about only buying what we liked, she was great.

Title: Bassac River Retreat
Description:
Well it was beautiful. The boat reminded me of being in an Agatha Christie novel it was all dark oak beautifully clean and polished the rooms are small but quite adequate and beds are comfy. No need to take much luggage our hotel looked after ours and we just packed an overnight bag for the cruise. The bathrooms are small but lovely and enough for 1 night, I didnâ€™t wash my hair here.
The staff are amazing and our guide was fantastic his American English was excellent , he took us on a very informative walking tour explaining all of the fruits and rice farming. The other guests chose to ride bikes!
The food on the cruise is beautiful, please be aware that most of Vietnam offers a lot of fish and if you are not a fish lover please make them aware beforehand. There are none fish options available.
I now love river cruising and this will not be my last.

Title: Lighthouse CÃ´n Äáº£o Travel
Description: We are travelling a little off season and weren't sure how best to spend our time. Our hotel recommended Lighthouse travel. We visited the office (beware of the pig lounging on the sofa!!) where Trinh set up a tailor made tour. We were driven in a lovely comfortable Toyota and Trinh took us to the museum, the cemetery and the pagoda (we didn't want to visit the prisons. We then drove up a new road which wasn't fully open but had lovely coastal views before going round the bay on a boat. We were dropped off for lunch in a local restaurant and taken to the beach near the airport in the afternoon. A very good day- thanks
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 4 trÃªn 10 Chuyáº¿n tham quan & hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng á»Ÿ CÃ´n SÆ¡n

Title: Vietnam Retro Tour
Description:
Our guides were Eric and Henry. They were very attentive, courteous, knowledgable and good fun. They take you round to all the sites in Hanoi, some less well known ones amongst them. We also visited a cafe to have an "egg coffee" this apparently is something they developed due to a shortage of milk in the Vietnam war. It tastes surprisingly very nice.
We were a bit apprehensive when we booked it due to the traffic in Hanoi and us only having a motorbike and sidecar to protect us. But we felt safe the whole time. Its an exhillerating way to see the sites either riding pillion or in the sidecar.
The whole way round Eric was taking photos which he later sends to you on Whatsapp.
So we thoroughly recommend this trip. If you only do one site seeing trip in Hanoi you wont go wrong with this one.

Title: Cat Ba View
Description:
We met le Trung by chance, because we were hosted at the hotel next to his office. We immediately appreciated his way of proposing discreetly some trips, without insisting and offering very convenient prices from the outset, sparing us bargaining, and setting up a trust atmosphere. Le trung arranged for us a 1-day boat trip in lan ha bay, with kayak, monkey island visit, floating fishermenâ€™s village. We were afraid it could be long for our2 daughters of 2 and 9-years, but it was just perfect, well rhythmed and nice. Based on this great experience we also asked le trung to organise for us the liaison cat ba/tam coc. We took the bus of 12.30, the good surprise was that we took the speed boat (hydroglisseur)and the whole trip was very effective.
I definitely recommend Le trung, manager of Cat ba View, for his solicitude, kindness, sincerity and discrete and effective support. And the quality of the services he offers. Thanks again!

Title: Go Local Phong Nha
Description:
My partner and I did one day Around Phongnha with local expert. It was one of our best day on my Vietnam trip. Dong our local guide were amazing, He is so friendly, knowledgeableâ€¦ He love what he does. Our local driver who are the farmers. They are really helpful and friend as well. We felt safe while being back on thier bike. Paradise cave is unbelievable.Boat ride was amazing as well. We had a swim in the river which was really nice. We are very glad that we did this trip. Its way better than being in the bus tour. you could support more Local too.
Highly recommend this activity

Es war eine perfekte Mischung aus Kultur, SehenswÃ¼rdigkeiten, Kulinarisch war es der Hammer, Erholung und EinfÃ¼hrung in das Land. Selbst fÃ¼r unseren Sohn (12 Jahre) war es eine Bereicherung und eine Horizonterweiterung! Die ReisefÃ¼hrer waren deutschsprachig und haben uns, durch ihr Fachwissen, das Land Vietnam nÃ¤her gebracht und dazu beigetragen, dieses tolle und aufregende Land in naher Zukunft wieder zu besuchen!
Wir kÃ¶nnen Tam Travel sehr empfehlen. Es ist ein tolles Land mit herzlichen Menschen und das Essen ist genial! Wir freuen uns heute schon auf die nÃ¤chste Reise (-:

Title: Columbus Travel Vietnam
Description:
I reached out to Columbus Travel last minute for help with booking a cruise in the Halong Bay area. Within less than 12 hours, me and my girlfriend were able to book and start our cruise journey.

It was an extremely memorable and enjoyable experience and would definitely not have been possible without the speedy and professional responses of the Columbus Travel team. We were also able to get our cruise at a rate better than others who booked the same cruise which was an added bonus on top of everything.

Would highly recommend reaching out to Columbus travel if you're looking to travel in Vietnam.

Title: Bravo Indochina Tours
Description:
The below is a complaint we are lodging against Bravo Indochina. This will also be repeated via other social media platforms including Tripadvisor.

We made our booking with Bravo Indochina (via Tour Radar) two months ago and were initially impressed with their statement of, 'We hope our dedication and commitment can be the best assurance of the quality of service you can expect from Bravo Indochina Tours'. Unfortunately, our experience was far from this, and the problems started immediately.

Problems before departure:

1. Tour dates booked incorrectly with confirmation being sent to us showing the arrangements starting in November 2022 and finishing in September 2022!

2. We had an original print out of the itinerary, and it states Domestic flights were included. We paid in full and later were told that two of the flights were not included. Mysteriously the wording on the itinerary appeared to be dynamically changed and we were forced to pay more, which amounted to USD$229pp more. Bravo denied anything was changed, but our print-out proved otherwise

3. We requested to be picked up from a local hotel on day one in Phnom Penh instead of at the airport. We asked for 12 noon, but the itinerary was sent to us showing 12 midnight. Surely the person typing this would have realised this was an obvious error, but the errors and issues just kept on coming!

4. On the second day of the tour, the itinerary mentioned we were having a 'full day tour' of Phnom Penh starting at 0725, but the airport transfer was booked for 1300. Not sure how they thought this was a 'full day tour' instead of a 'half day' tour?

5. The itinerary stated the Angkor Wat tour started at 0900, but they were calling it a 'Sunset tour' without any suitable explanation given as to what we would be doing for the entire day until the actually sunset at 1730!

6. Another itinerary mistake that just showed no attention to detail for the excursion in Hoi An. It stated the My Son Sanctuary tour started at 2350 and finished at 0450!... Seriously, was anyone reading the itinerary!.. We ended up not doing this anyway.

7. Booking numbers for the flights were not shown on the itinerary, which concerned us. We were told to not worry about that and the airlines would have our details. In the end, we had every right to worry as will be explained further below.

8. We were told the Sunset tour river cruise in Phnom Penh would pick us up around 1500 and then the sunset would be at 1730. We thought the pick-up time was very early but accepted it.... As it turned out in reality, we were not picked-up until 1630.

Tour departure onward:

Day 1: The transfer from our local hotel to our first hotel on the tour (G Mekong) was provided with a non-English speaking driver in a Tuk-Tuk.... The image provided on the itinerary provided by Bravo Indochina showed a comfortable van and stated the driver would be English speaking. We appreciate we were not coming from the airport, but a taxi at least should have been provided. Instead, we had a Tuk Tuk with luggage on our laps roaring through the streets of Phnom Penh. The driver was supposed to arrive at 1200 noon, but instead turned up at 1100am whilst were having a late breakfast and therefore had to be turned away by hotel Management until 1200 noon.

Day 2: We were given the inclusions for the tour of Phnom Penh that was re-scheduled to 0700am, but the driver did not arrive until 0720am. After we rushed breakfast for the supposed 0700 pick-up time and based on the wording of the itinerary were expecting a decent view of the Royal Palace. In reality we were whisked past, and it was almost a blink, and you would miss it moment. We even had to mention to the guide about the visit and he seemed to be surprised that we were wanting to see it. The driver also thought the time stated on the itinerary for the flight departure to Siem Reap of 1300 was too late and was suggesting 1130 instead, but eventually sorted things out with Bravo Indochina with a compromised time.

Upon arrival in Siem Reap, we were offloaded at The Sanctuary Residence Siem Reap hotel. This was certainly not a sanctuary. The bed was so hard, that we had to end up asking to change rooms for the second night and signs inside the lobby mentioning not bringing firearms into the property was a little disconcerting.

Day 3: The bad experience at the hotel continued with an abysmal breakfast. There were three staff standing at the entrance to the restaurant to welcome us, but none of them seemed to want to do any work to replenish the so called 'buffet' with empty juice containers and scraps left in the Bain-maries. The restaurant opening times stated that breakfast was still had an hour to go, but there was virtually nothing left, and I was forced to speak to Management to get the staff to re-fill the breakfast items. The whole situation was so bad that we decided to eat out independently the following morning at a Cafe.

We then flew to Ho Chi Minh city. Upon exiting the Arrivals Hall our driver was nowhere to be seen. We eventually found our driver, but he did not have our names on his sign and for some reason had an 'Intrepid' holidays logo instead of 'Bravo Indochina'.. We ended up being dumped at the 'Blue Diamond Luxury Hotel. This property may look okay in the pictures, but it is certainly not suitable for Western travellers. The decor and restaurant offerings seem more geared to the local Asian market. The only good thing about this hotel was the location.

Day 4: Today was a tour to the Cu Chi Tunnels with lunch. I don't think the guide was reading the itinerary as tour spots were either missed or jumbled around. It is appreciated that you need to be flexible on vacation, but no explanation was given for the changes and it always kept us guessing if points would be missed and as it turned out we did miss the local market and documentary film. Lunch was beyond terrible. We barely ate anything. The Waitress seemed a bit upset, but what do you expect when options are not supplied, and you are just expected to eat foreign food without any explanation in English provided to advise what you are eating. No thought was given for clients coming from a Western country.

Our Vietnam airlines flight from Ho Chi Minh to Da Nang got changed to a later time, which was totally unnecessary and meant we did not get to Hoi An until 2200. Our guide to the Cu Chi tunnels was aware of the change, but Bravo Indochina failed to tell us at the same time. Bravo advised the change was done by the airline, but Vietnam airlines provided us a screenshot of the air booking and it showed the booking was ticketed on 12 Nov for the later flight. If Bravo had actually booked us on the flight shown on the itinerary, it wouldn't have been necessary for the guide to take us to the sheltered workshop with staff making lacquer art in a factory. We had no interest in this at all and I'm sure the guide did not like us not making any purchases and thus missing out on a potential kick-back.

Arriving in Hoi An much later in the day than expected, we were eventually given the room category (river view) that was shown in the itinerary picture and that Bravo Indochina confirmed they would request. This was the view we were really looking forward to, but the hotel initially tried to give us a room at the back of the property, which was not appealing at all. The issue with the room was the last thing we needed after a long day and the hotel made us feel like we were trying to get something for free.

We asked Bravo Indochina what compensation could be provided for these continual issues as they were certainly not volunteering anything before this, and they advised they could provide a dinner for us. We never ended up getting this meal as the company could not find a suitable Western restaurant for us. They only seemed to want to keep constantly steering us towards a Pan-Asian style eatery in Hanoi that they had contracted. We ended up with nil compensation as it all seemed too difficult for them.

Day 5: Another itinerary mistake with the journey from Hoi An to Hue. It stated at 0700 departure, but at the same time, it mentioned 'enjoying a morning at leisure'.... Why was this not being picked up by staff at Bravo Indochina?... An obvious mistake and we had to fight to get our morning at leisure until 1100am.

Upon arrival in Hue, it was obvious there was really only one thing to see in the city for tourists and that is the Citadel. We really could have missed this and would rather have stayed longer in Hoi An or at the next spot in Hanoi. The two-three hour journey to get there was not worth it and Bravo conceded that Hanoi was much more interesting than Hue.

Day 6: The Vietnam airlines flight shown on the itinerary was changed to budget carrier Vietjet. We therefore were expected to get up earlier again unnecessarily because of this change. It was explained the original flight shown on the itinerary was not suitable, but why was it shown if it wasn't?.. Again, lack of attention to detail or an error?... We spoke to Customer Service at Vietnam airlines and they confirmed we were never booked on the flight shown on the itinerary. We should be compensated for this change to a lower class of carrier than what was paid for, which we worked out was half the price of Vietnam airlines. All of this confirmed to us the real reason the flight booking numbers not being supplied was because in our opinion the flights were not booked when the itinerary documents were emailed.

After arriving in Hanoi, we were met by the guide for the city tour in a sedan. He seemed to think we would be driving around for the duration of the tour and knew nothing about the rickshaw component mentioned in the itinerary. He did call his office and got it organised, but it was concerning that he did not know about the rickshaw ride, which ended up being the best part of the tour and we would have been very disappointed if we had of missed out.

The hotel in Hanoi was the Hanoi Nostalgia Hotel & Spa. We were given a room overlooking an inner courtyard but had expected a room at the front of the property. The room attendant told us the rooms at the front were VERY noisy and therefore we stayed with the room provided. When we came back for our second visit after the Halong Bay excursion we were then put into a room at the front, and it turned out the rooms have double doors facing the street and therefore noise was not an issue at all. Unfortunately, the hotel was caught out with this lie.

Day 7: We were really looking forward to the Halong Bay Cruise. Yet again the itinerary was incorrect and stated we would be travelling with a company called Indochina Junk. We had researched that cruise company and were happy with what was going to be offered. As it turned out, we were put onto a company called Cozy Bay Cruises. What a dump of a vessel!!.. It started with an uncomfortable bus taking us to the pier and once we got on the boat, we had a cabin with a bathroom that flooded from a mysterious water source, a shower door that did not seal properly and a bathroom curtain that we could not open and close. Most of the food and fortunately our fellow travellers were the only saving grace.

The guide for the Halong Bay excursion advised us before travelling back to Hanoi that our hotel in Hanoi had been changed. This was supposedly done to upgrade us to a nicer property. We are not sure what the true reason for the change was and were even questioning if our original hotel had been booked, but we actually liked our original hotel in old Hanoi and had booked to go to see the Water Puppets near the hotel.

We were two men travelling on this holiday, but the hotels and drivers seemed to be often confused and were expecting a man and a woman. Even one of our air tickets said Ms instead of Mr, that really could have caused a problem at the airport, but fortunately did not. Again, attention to detail by Bravo Indochina was lacking. WhatsApp messages would come through saying Hi Sell, instead of Hi Mr Sells.

It seemed almost impossible to get straight answers from Bravo Indochina as our difficult questions were either not answered or very minimally answered. This all proved very frustrating and ruined the vacation. We know Bravo Indochina have the right to change the itinerary, but it seemed to be a convenient excuse to cover up mistakes and it always worked to our detriment.

Final documents were also very slow in coming and had to be chased up though Tour Radar.

All in all, this vacation was a total disaster from start to finish and we would like to see an adequate response from Bravo Indochina and Tour Radar with suitable compensation.

Title: Fansipan 3143 Travel
Description:
Prior to our booking, Terribletour has promptly replies to our queries and made booking a pleasant process.
The hike to fansipan was amazing with wonderful tour guide Minh. He speaks English quite fluently and has a good sense of humour. He shares his interesting knowledge of the forest as we hike.
He is very caring and attentive to our needs. He noticed that me and wife are not as fit and gets tired easily, he initiated a lot of times if we need a short breaks throughout the whole hike.
He created pleasant surprise by plucking wild mushroom
during the hike so that we can have delicious mushroom soup for dinner.
Thank you Minh for taking care of us, and you are a great asset to the company.

Title: Chuong Nguyen
Description:
What a great way to see a great place!

I thoroughly enjoyed the 25 or so km walk through this still low-key rural area. It was spread over most of 2 days and a very relaxed, informative ramble with our guide, Mr. Chuong Nguyen. He seemed well informed generally and very well known to locals who often stopped to chat. He spoke English quite well enough to keep us in the know.

Some of the folks I was with were not prepared for the walking so Chuong arranged for our driver to pick them up along the way.

Pu Luong has a local and traditional feel to it. It's super lush, small villagers and farmers were doing what they'd been doing for generations. And as was my experience in Vietnam almost universally, they were oh so friendly and kind.

I loved seeing how simple irrigation techniques keep the rice growing. A woman graciously stopped spinning cotton to show us how local Hill People wore the beautiful weaving she produced. The inter-village soccer match we happened upon was also great fun!

We had a great stay at our homestay in Pu Luong which featured individual huts for guests. The food and hospitality was great!

Our tour had been seen to by our hosts at the Trang An Precious Homestay. It was well organized the the guide and driver were great choices!

And I'm not saying that just because the three of us went out for a beer afterwards! ğŸ˜†

So overall, if you want a great walk in beautiful, rural Vietnamese countryside, this tour is for you!

Title: Asia Legend Travel
Description:
Beautiful waterfall very close to the road, about 30 min from Sapa. Pay 20 000 vnd and walk up the 200 steps.
We rented a taxi in Sapa to visit both Silver and Love waterfall, snd paid 550 000 vnd. The trip took about 2,5 H.
We also very much enjoyed the short walk to the love waterfall 1,5 km, 10 min walk. Entrance 70 000 vnd.
Nice trip to do in the morning before you leave Sapa.

July was a good time of the year to visit these, lots of water!!

Title: Kong Forest
Description:
We did the ATV and Zipline activities. The zipline was fun and varied but the extended course had some difficult portions where people with less confidence and upper body strength had to tap out and perhaps there should have been a warning or an easier option for people to quit.

The ATV was definitely a great experience but was very challenging for inexperienced riders. I have ridden ATVs before and I still found this tricky. Itâ€™s a gorgeous and fun course but I do think a heads up should be given on the website that this is by far an easy course.

You also go through a lot of mud and water and itâ€™s prone to rain so you should definitely bring a change of clothes. The meal they serve is actually quite good and the staff are incredibly friendly.

Title: Vietnam Backroads Travel
Description: My boyfriend and I booked the 3 day mekong delta tour from HCMC to Phnom Penh (Cambodia). The first two days we did some great cycling with our guide Phuc, while we took the speed ferry from Chau Doc to Phnom Penh on the last day. We had lots of fun exploring the countryside and learned a lot from Phuc's local knowledge. We even visited the floating market in Can Tho, which was really nice. The border crossing by boat was well arranged and an easy way to get into Cambodia from Vietnam. The bikes provided were in great condition. We would recommend this tour o everyone!

Title: Danang River Tours
Description:
I went with a lot of expectations.

There are about 11 boats that cruise around the river and they have small launches that pick you up from a small jetty tucked away in the corner

As you get on the launch they serve you fruits and a bottle of water. However on my boat they didnâ€™t have any guide talking about the bridges and there wasnâ€™t the advertised cultural dance on the boat.

Overall it was a dull experience (2115 hour boat) which was delayed.

I travelled on My Xuan II boat. Can give this a miss.

Title: Gotta Go Indochina
Description:
Recently completed a two week family trip to Vietnam fully arranged through Ms. Nga Nguyen at Gotta Go Indochina on advice from a a friend. We are very happy we took their advice. Ms Nga Nguyen provided exceptional advise, options and suggestions, including great value for money. I really recommend contacting Ms Nga Nguyen for all your travel needs in Vietnam. Our trip ran exceptionally smooth with all transfers on time, safe and pleasant. Tours were great fun and accommodation provided was perfect. Throughout the trip Ms Nga kept in contact with us to make sure everything was running smoothly - which it did.
If you are traveling to Vietnam from Australia and want the best price and service I would highly recommend to give Gotta Go Indochina and ask for Ms Nga Nguyen - you will be glad you did.

Title: HAPPY PLUS TRAVEL
Description:
I had a wonderful time visiting the Cu Chi Tunnels and the Mekong Delta with the help of David, who was an excellent planner and organizer. He understood my requirements well and was always available for any kind of query resolution. He arranged the best tour guide one can ask for, Mr Bui, who had deep knowledge on our tours and Saigon culture and always kept the group intact with beautiful stories and history.

I was scared of being asked for tips at random places as I had read about it (especially in Mekong Delta). When I let David know the same, he made sure that we were comfortable everywhere by letting the tour guide know in advance who would then always come up if he saw someone persuading for tips. So we had nothing to worry about on this perspective and this reassurance of not worrying about anything made our trip really mesmerizing.

Our requests for vegetarian food and small group (< 10 pax) were also considered, so the tour guide could focus on us and it was not crowded. Our limousine bus was extremely comfortable, very silent so we got a good amount of time to relax in between and yes not to forget cold water bottle was provided 500 ml each and pickup & drop was exactly from the hotel point. Excellent Hospitality & the pickup and drop services were well informed in advance.

Unlike many tours that are about money, here the focus is solely on hospitality and rich experience. We were given options to pay for the trip whenever we felt the most comfortable with - be it cash or online payment (with no platform charges for international travellers, so we paid exactly what was asked). Along with the bigger things, all the other little things, like proper wait time for restrooms and time for breakfast, were adequately provided for each one of us.

David made our day in HCMC really brighter and I would 101% recommend him to anyone for any kind of trip planning. He is the best planner you can find in HCMC!

Title: Spa HÃ  Thá»‹
Description: This is not a luxury experience where you'll be wrapped in thick warm towels and there will be dolphin music and silk eye masks and people whispering, 'madame, how is the pressure?' But what you get instead are skilful local therapists in a pleasant, clean environment (look for the fish bowl in the eye hole beneath the massage table) and great value for money. I went back a few times for a massage but also had a fabulous facialâ€”collagen, I thinkâ€”which was professional and effective and cost half what it would have had at my hotel spa over the road. There were lines out the door for a mani-pedi.

Title: VMES Yacht Charter
Description: I had an amazing unique experience touring around Halong Bay on the super yacht, navigating on the green water paradise between rocky islands is unforgettable. The crew is fantastic, especially while riding jet ski with a monitor I can film the bay perfectly and it was so enjoyable. My friends did kayaking and love it, but my favorite parts are riding on the jet ski and chilling on the yacht watching wonderful landscapes and beautiful sunset. Of course I must mention the BBQ diner party, such joyful and fun time! Nothing compare to this trip! Even the trip I had once visiting Halong Bay on a 5* stars cruise ship. Because this is so private, so privileged. Thanks to the crew and Mr Viet! I wish to come back on your yacht again!

Title: Thang Long Water Puppet Theater
Description:
I thoroughly enjoyed the 45 minute show. It was colourful and the music was great. Very clever. The two lady singers on the right smiled throughout, they obviously enjoyed their work.
The theatre was beautiful and efficiently run.

The only thing that spoiled it was that three people in front of me used their phones constantly during the show to video it. This was so distracting. One lady was on Facebook the whole way through.

Title: Hash House Harriers
Description:
The Hash is one of the best ways to get out of the city and potentially explore the countryside, with a bunch of Vietnamese and Expats.
Generally, the club catches a bus out to the countryside (Rice paddies, mountains etc), goes for 7-10km walk/run that has a Beer stop along the way, and then more beer afterwards.
A great Saturday afternoon.
Be prepared to get a bit wet and dirty (bring a change of clothes!) and for a bit of wicked/foul/filthy/crass language - but all in good fun!

Title: Dragon King Cruises
Description: Took a 1-day Ha Long Bay tour with pickup from a Hanoi. Frankly can't find any cons of it - pickup from hotel was on time, bus was in good condition, air conditioned. We took a highway to get to port with short stop on pearl shop (noone was forced to buy anything) and toilet. Boarded the boat on schedule. Boat was pretty nice as well. We've got a tasty lunch and visited 3 destinations - everything as advertised (worth noting - kayaks were included in price). During cruise back we've seen a wonderful sunset and a little party on board. The same bus picked us from port and drove us back to our hotels. Definitely recommend!

Title: Pham Tours
Description:
We were met at our ship by Annie our guide â€“ a very pleasant and informative person with a super personality. We started with a visit to the waterfront and the Dragon Bridge where we stopped for photographs. Then we visited a marble works where we saw some amazing sculptures being created. We drove to our next stop which was a pottery. A lady in our group was brave enough to â€˜throwâ€™ some clay and for a beginner she created an excellent shaped dish. She explained that this could possibly be her next hobby! We then took a boat down the river passing many villages on the way. We later ambled along the waterside, seeing a Japanese bridge and taking photos of people in national costume etc. From here we were taken into the countryside for a very pleasant lunch where we were all given Coolie hats to wear to help keep off the sun. The food was delicious and plentiful. Following lunch our group of eight each had a shoulder and head massage followed by a foot and leg massage. Part relaxing, part invigorating! We then headed off to the Paddy fields and stopping to look at the water buffalo. A few of our party were invited to sit on this wonderful looking beast. He was not at all disturbed by the experience. From here we were driven through a very pretty village which had small national flags strung like bunting from building to building. After passing through the village we arrived at the river where we all were given a very memorable ride in small round fishing boats (known by the Welsh as coracles). Each boat held three people, one being the very capable young girl that did the rowing! They stopped mid-stream and as a group they all sang to us as they made floral rings and hairpieces for us out of the palm leaves they picked. All in all this was a trip we would not have missed, far better and much cheaper than anything our cruise ship could offer and therefore reckon anyone wanting to do something different then do use Dung Pham tours â€“ you wonâ€™t regret it. Plus you only pay at the end of the tour.

Earlier I mentioned the national flags, well I collect a small one from each country I visit and up until then had failed to get one of Vietnam from previous places we had visited. I had mentioned this to Annie when I saw all the bunting hanging throughout the village and to my surprise when we came ashore after our small fishing boat ride our driver very kindly presented me with one. I was thrilled. It not just reminds me of our visit to beautiful Vietnam but our very pleasant trip with Annie and her driver and the excellent tour that Dung Pham organised for us.

During 4 days, we enjoyed every single minute. we visit Bac Ha market, did some trekking to see some village that very far from the town. The hotel and the homestay were nice, the itinerary is not too rush but enough and doesn't make you fel tired or boring. the tour guide was very friendly and helpful. if I have a chance to come back here, i will travel you you again :).

Title: Kitesurf Mui Ne Village
Description:
We stayed for just a couple days in Mui Ne and we knew we wanted to learn kite surf. We arrived in the afternoon to get some information and ended up having our first kite surf lessen just a few minutes later. This was awesome since we had only 3 days in Mui Ne. Hoang was a very good teacher and we were able to learn all the basics very quickly. He really took time to teach us everything.
After the lessons we had the opportunity to ask questions and talk about everything we liked while enjoying a beer.
We had a great time and I can totally recommend it to everyone who likes to learn kite surfing.

Description: My two sons and I did a combined tour of visiting My Son temples in the morning and the Hoi An Food Tasting and Walking Tour in the afternoon. The tour guide was immensely knowledgeable and made great recommendations of what food to try. My youngest son who can be a rather picky eater at times was even happy. Our tour guide recommended great photo spots and offered to take photos for us so that we would have great memories to look back on with all of us in it. The guide sprinkled just enough history and culture into the conversation to be educational but not boring. He was immensely good with kids and showed genuine concern for our well being in dealing with the heat and humidity which we were not accustomed to. It was a great tour and definitely well worth the money spent.

Title: DUYEN LE THI THAO
Description: What can I say except that she made ho chi Minh city feel alive in a way I couldn't have ever imagined. She really made every location an adventure. This tour was super fan and all of the spots she picked lead themselves to fun adventures where I could try the local cuisine. The rides in-between the restaurants and locals were also very safe and she is a great driver. She also did a great job explaining the food and the importance it has in he culture and never made me feel bad about my chopstick skills haha. Her English was also at a level that I felt I never had to explain my self too many times. She also was very good at anticipating my needs. I will definitely use her services again! I would also recommend anyone who is traveling solo to look at this tour as a great opportunity to explore one of Vietnam's biggest city ho chi Minh city.

Title: Sapa Trekking Tours
Description:
I arrived in Sapa after taking an overnight bus from Hanoi, and I met a friend of Pham's in Sapa who took me trekking through the mountains back to the village, where I stayed with Pham for 3 days and 2 nights. This trek was unlike trekking anywhere else I had been - hiking through the mountains, seeing the rice and corn fields, the orchid farms, water buffalo, and more!

Pham is a very welcoming host, and her English is quite good, which made communication simple for me. She prepared a nice supper and understood that I have food allergies and was able to accommodate that. I had my own room at her place with a comfy mattress, and I slept well after the long trek. Pham was very responsive over email as I planned the trip, and everything was well organized when I arrived.

If traveling in July, be prepared for heat and rain. A large water bottle and waterproof hiking boots will come in handy.

Title: Can Tho Mekong Tour
Description:
Iâ€™m here with a 13 and 15 year old while their father stayed in Melbourne to work. I felt terribly sorry for him as we said goodbye at the airport however that was a week ago and it turns out I drew the short straw!!!

However, our tour guide Jackie remained super positive throughout our tour, was so kind and informative and was not thrown by their truculent behaviour. The noodle factory was actually really fascinating but I suspect these traditional manufacturers are few and far between these days. We also went to a cacao farm and factory which was really interesting and Jackie was very well informed regarding the entire process.

Take Jackie! Leave the teenagers at home

Title: Sapa Trekking Adventure
Description: This was an incredible experience - truly could not have done this on our own. Over three days, we trekked ~40 kilometers in the Sapa region with a knowledgeable, friendly, local guide. Our guide Chu (Sinhâ€™s cousin) even invited us to her home for an amazing home-cooked lunch on the second day - talk about hospitality. We stayed at nice homestays each night with home-cooked meals provided by local families. They are not luxurious, but they are comfortable and it was nice to connect with locals and other travelers. Be prepared to sweat and make sure to bring comfortable shoes - this is a workout but youâ€™re surrounded by some of the most beautiful hills, mountains, valleys, and rivers imaginable. Book this now!

Title: LÃ½ Má»¹ SÆ¡n Travel
Description: Arranged for the My Son afternoon tour the day before. Texted via WhatsApp and confirmed pick up between 1300-1315. Hai, the driver, was right on time and we picked up our tour guide, Uncle Chin on the way, because Chin had done an AM tour and needed to have a short break. Had a pleasant ride to My Son and Uncle Chin told us a few things along the way. We saw part of the ruins before the show as Uncle Chin has done this plenty of times and knows the ins and outs. We had sites left to see after the show so while the crowd queen for the carts back to the start, we utilized that time to see the remaining sites in virtual solitude. After completing, we caught the cart back and our van back toward Hoi An. We stopped at a dock and were picked up for our sunset boat ride to Hoi An. We were given soup on the ride and the opportunity to purchase beer or soda for $1. Boat dropped us in Hoi An where the van picked us up for the return to our hotel. 500,000/person, well worth it!!

Title: Halong Bay Vietnam
Description: A beautiful spot, BUT the boat was talked up by Tom the host and was well below what we anticipated. On route to the main boat it was described as 5 star and less than 4 years old. Well our room on level 1 was next to the engine room and you couldn't hear yourself when under way. Considering the boat was not full room 102 should never be used. The rooms outdoor balcony had a broken door and could not be locked to seal the noise from the engine and the chairs did not match with one not having a cushion. The shower had a broken soap holder. The room looked run down. The food and beverage was great but once you ordered a drink you had to wait far too long. All emphasis was on larger groups, couples did not get much attention. The canoeing was fun and the fishing activities were also great. The excursions was well below what we expected as we expected a cave visit but instead visited a horse shoe bay that was nothing special. At the end of the tour we were asked to complete a survey and when the host was informed of our issues he did not handle it well leaving us no confidence that he would address the issues for future travellers.

Title: Sapa Tour Daily
Description: Sapa's valley is breathtaking with mountain sides filled with multi-tiered rice terraces. There are a few companies offering this one day tour. This tour will take you into two distinct villages: Lao Chai and Ta Van. They are habited by the Hmong ethnic people. Ours was a 7 km walking tour. We visited a primary school and a day nursery. We were also able to visit a local's house. This was a bit intimidating for me but I guess the owner gets some sort of remuneration. BEWARE!! The locals will start offering you their goods (trinkets, bracelets, purses, etc.) right from the minute you step out of your vehicle at kilometer 0 and will pursue you constantly right through kilometer 7. So...it will take all of your power and patience if you do not want to by anything. Getting mad at them will not work because there will assuredly be another vendor to entice you to buy. Good Luck
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 81 trÃªn 152 Hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng ngoÃ i trá»i á»Ÿ Sapa

Title: Mountain Light Travel
Description:
Morgens frÃ¼h wurde ich am Hotel abgeholt der Reiseleiter kam in die Lobby und brachte mich sicher Ã¼ber die StraÃŸe zum bus.
Mir wurde am Vorabend per Whatsapp mitgeteilt das man zwischen 8-8.20 Uhr zu mit kommen wÃ¼rde am Ende waren es 8.40 Uhr aber bei dem Verkehr kein Wunder.Der Bus war sehr komfortabel mit viel Beinfreiheit und USB Anschluss
Nachdem alle Leute abgeholt wurden fing unser Reiseleiter Hoan an zu reden und einen mit den wichtigsten Informationen zu informieren.
Die fahrt sollte ungefÃ¤hr 3 Stunden dauern mit 2 pausen.Die erste Pause war eine Toiletten pause von 10 Minuten, die zweite eine Pause von einer halben Stunde auf einer Perlenfarm diese hat eine an eine Kaffefahrt erinnert aber immer hin war es interessant zu sehen wie so etwas hergestellt wird.
Als wir in Halong angekommen sind ging es auf das schiff mit zwei Etage unten Esszimmer oben Aussicht deck
An Board gab es dann 10 verschiedene Vietnamnesiche Gerichte mir wurde sogar extra was vegetarisches serviert.
Als erstes wurde the amazing cave besichtigt danach Tiptoe Island wo man sich aussuchen konnte ob man schwimmen mÃ¶chte oder 400 Treppen hoch laufen mÃ¶chte kann ich aber jedem nur empfehlen toller Ausblick danach ging es weiter zum Kajakfahren bzw bamboo boat trotz regen.
Nach einem anstrengenden tag ging es dann wieder 2 1/2 Stunden zurÃ¼ck mit kleiner essenspause

Title: Arcady Boutique Cruises
Description:
The van taking us from Hanoi to Ha Long Bay was very comfortable. At the Bay, we boarded a boat - there were only 11 of us. The lunch was excellent- plentiful and very fresh. Our tour guide was fantastic- very knowledgeable, friendly, and well-spoken.

The cave is quite large but it doesnâ€™t appear to be active. Our guide said that there are sections in which visitors are not allowed. Most of the cave tour involved being shown figures in the formations.

The Tiptop island has a lovely beach where you can relax or play volleyball. I did the hike to an observation point at the top of the hill. This involved climbing many steep and sometimes uneven steps. The climb is also quite crowded.

I would recommend this trip.

Title: Daily Vietnam Tours
Description:
We booked with a local travel agent in Hanoi and our tour guide from "Vietnam Daily Tours' was Mr T , they picked us up at the arranged time which in our travel experience was a first so started off well and only got better throughout the day albeit very long which we knew from the start,(to do Halong bay from Hanoi and back is a LONG DAY) Mr T was a wonderful guide very Knowledgeable and quite different from other Vietnamese guides who can be very brash and annoying, He was gracious and very pleasant but able to guide all 25 or so on the bus with what felt like a personal touch from pick up time until drop off some 13 hours later.
Had a great day at the bay, wonderful weather which always make it good..
Totally recommend these Guys and if you can get Mr T your tour will be the better for it.

Title: Travel Hub Vietnam
Description:
From our first contact by email, the representatives of this company made our visit to Vietnam super easy.
They met us at the airport and we were through the Visa process in minutes, leaving behind all those in our plane who were waiting for their stamp.
We planned a boat trip through Halong Bay for my husbands birthday and it was perfect- they even arranged for a cake! We did a cave tour and overnight stay in CatBa island. We met back up in Hanoi and They became our friends throughout our stay in north and south Vietnam, popping in and out for airplane transfers, car rides, hotel reservations and food tours. I honestly donâ€™t think our trip would have been as enjoyable without them.
They customized each part of our trip according to our needs and budget and we never felt like we were really in a â€œtourâ€
Highly recommend them!

Title: Tonkin Cruise
Description:
Traveling from south to North escaping the heat and rain that followed us from HCMC through our adventures to HoiAn and Hue, we were finally in Hanoi. The weather was amazing and my friend and I took no chances with making certain the weather would be perfect.
We booked with Tonkin Cruise because the one day on Halong Bay was all around the best on all our shopping points: first the earliest start and arrival to board the ship of the 1 day cruises we considered. Local pick up at your hotel/hostel in old quarter of Hanoi made it easy to start our day at 7:00 am. We picked up a group of just under 20 people (2 being children under 10). This was accomplished in 40 minutes! By 8:00 am we were leaving Hanoi and made a rest stop for 10 minutes before arriving at Tonkin Harbor to board our ship by 10:40 am, ahead of schedule.

The ship is well maintained, clean and even luxurious for a one day cruise. Beautifully set tables for dining, a dozen lounge chairs to sun on and relax and enough seating all around the outdoor deck areas. There are shaded areas and the main deck entry conversation corners to also make and get to know new friends.

The toilets are all fully functioning, immaculately kept and all around the Tonkin is a lovely ship. Staff are friendly, Captain always has his doors open today hello and food is delicious and varied. Special dietary needs and allergies were also a concern if the staff in initial booking and again on day of cruise.
The route through the limestone hills and islands allowed for a good survey of the Bay and itâ€™s most beautiful views.

We had ample down time between the many events planned: Kayaking, swimming or lounging in hammocks began our daysâ€™ events. Land transfer and a cave tour was a break from the ship, landing on Cat Ba Island. A spring roll making class followed as we also enjoyed fresh fruits and tea on our way back to Tonkin Harbor for sunset.

WiFi access is a availableâ€”so says the tour informational Booklet, but we were never told of this by our guide.

Our English speaking guide managed to keep us all on schedule and afforded us the promised FULL DAY on the water we wanted from 11am until sunset.

The cruise was US$70/person and booked the night before. All went according to plan promised us.

Beer and other soft drinks are available for a reasonable price onboard. Water was provided on bus to boat and lemon tea while on the boat.

Bus has AC and is clean and comfortable.

All-in-all, an excellent cruise, well managed and guide â€œHungâ€ is so pleasant and funny.
Great value for a full day!

You arrive back toHa our by 8:30pm
(See attached Agent Sales book pic)

Title: Vietnam Motorbike Tours
Description:
Went on a solo guided trip to cu chi tunnels from ho chi minh ciry along with Mr. Tam who made a good trip, great.

Had no expectations apart from riding a 150CC city bike when i booked and when i met Tam and spoke to him for a few mins on my way to the bike pick up point from my hotel i had made up my mind that im upgrading my bike.

Tam quickly upgraded my bike to a 400 CC at a very nominal cost and we we both were geared up to start the trip.

All i was expecting was a Tar mac road trip but our pal brought in various legs of off roading with his well aware detours from the main roads which made it completely enjoyable.

I would recommend this guys as the guide too as he is bit only knowledgeable about vietnam but can enlighten you about various global topics and make your breaks even more interesting.
Also he paid for all entries and meals and refreshments which was a total surprise and an amazing gesture from the most genuine guy i met.

Thanks for the wonderful trip Tam. Hope to see you soon for another amazing journey together.

PS: all shots were taken by Tam who shot this while riding his bike ahead. Truly talented man.

Description: Na bestudering van reviews op internet, bij Mango terecht gekomen. Twee keer in korte tijd een scooter gehuurd. Grab werkt hier overigens ook perfect, maar het is gewoon fijn dat je zelf kunt gaan en staan waar je maar wilt. De prijs is echt uitmuntend. Voor 100.000 dong, ongeveer 4 euro, heb je een volautomatische scooter voor een hele dag. Scooters zijn niet helemaal nieuw, maar het functioneert allemaal prima. Uiteraard ook met helmen. Ook voor mijn zoontje was een kinderhelm beschikbaar. In Vietnam hebben de kinderen overigens geen helm op, heel apart. Vriendelijke, lieve mensen die je kunt vertrouwen. Je kunt hier trouwens ook je vuile was wegbrengen. Ik beveel Mango zeker aan!

Title: Pony Club Hanoi
Description:
I took my daughter for her first experience on a Pony - she was so excited to go but they experience was a real let down.

We were told to walk around and see the animals - many of them were thin looking half starved - I am no expert in the field but it just felt all wrong -

My daughter was unceremoniously plonked on a pony by a morose elderly word who clearly wanted to be elsewhere - he didnâ€™t crack a smile or day a word - just led her up a hill and back - which was pretty much the whole experience - I had to walk with my daughter and hold her hand the whole time as she was so scared of the situation and the guide!

It was a nasty badly managed experience .

Title: Apricot Cruise
Description: You leave the bustling city and head out in the river cruise boat with design open on all sides to allow river breeze to flow freely, it takes down the Mekong. You get a chance to observe local lively activities from the comfort of your boat. We stopped at the local market saw wholesale coconut market, some local families and gained insights into local traditional methods to utilize every bit of the coconut, how to make local cake etc. We also met a veteran who provided his perspectives of American and Cambodian war.

There are many attractions that would suit young children, teenagers, singles, couples, and the elderly.

Title: Phu My Quang Travel - Day Tours
Description:
Do visit if staying Da nang.
Beautiful area where Lady Buddha stands.
Marble mountain I visited was Water Mountain. Take the lift up as still fair amount of walking different levels. Lovely statues.
Dragon Bridge, the dragon breathes fire every Saturday and Sunday night at 9pm, all traffic stops, unmissable!
Enjoy beautiful Da nang and area.
Suggest 4/5 days though we stayed for 9.

Title: Hoi An Eco Palm River Tour - Day Tours
Description:
Simply had a great day. We hired bikes from where we were staying in Hoi An (Thao Hieu Homestay) and rode down to Cam Thanh Village, taking our time and exploring the local surroundings.
On arrival we had lunch and a couple of rehydrating 333's. The Banh Xeo (rice pancake with pork and shrimp) sounded delicious but in the end I opted for the open faced wantons which were also excellent.
After lunch it was into the round wicker boats (local version of a Coracle I guess is the best way of describing it) for an hour or so paddling amongst the palms.
The locals were friendly and engaging and could not do enough to ensure we all had a special day.
Just a great way to relax, meet the locals and have a bit of fun and a good laugh.
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 208 trÃªn 314 Hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng ngoÃ i trá»i á»Ÿ Há»™i An

Title: YEN BAI ECO TOUR
Description: We are a group of international students from different countries in Vic Uni of Wellington, New Zealand. This is our trip in Vietnam but so far it is one of the best trip weâ€™ve ever had. Weâ€™ve heard that Vietnam is such a beautiful country but we were still amazed by the beauty of the nature in Yenbai. I love the food of the ethnic people in here, the taste is very different, but in a super good way. I wish I can stuff heaps of those dishes into takeaway boxes and bring back to NZ. I was very impressed. The trek and the bicycle tour was nice. The homestay was nice as well, friendly staff, very helpful and the house was clean. I love it. People in Vietnam are generally very friendly, I think. Oh, swimming in the waterfall is a MUST. Overall, we are very happy with everything in this trip.
