Title: Ruá»™ng Báº­c Thang Sa Pa trail
Description: The trail begins when Lao Chai street connects to main road TL152, few kilometres, you climb down on concrete road. You can get to the point with taxi, motorcycle or walking 30 minutes from Sapa with good pace. In peak season, there are many people with tour guides. We had bad luck as heavy fog was sitting in valley but later got brighter and warmer. The trail will lead you to spot to see the rice fields. You can come back and follow direction to Tan Van village through Muong Hoa valley. Extreme nice mountainous scenery, fresh air and rice field. Good shoes, especially when rains and water and special attention for winter ğŸ¥¶ time You can spend there whole day but be aware about weather change quickly and get ready with water ğŸ’§ or snack
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 34 trong 48 hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng giáº£i trÃ­ táº¡i Sapa

Title: Lao Chai Trail
Description: This trail starts in same point as Ruá»™ng Báº­c Thang Sa Pa trail. It is almost ten kilometres long through Muong Hoa valley with hundreds of rice fields, many villages. You can start from Tan Van village or at cross road where Lao Chai street meets TL152. Mostly concrete road, sometimes you pass bikes or smaller truck. Fantastic nature, fields and many local ethnic people selling souvenirs. Good shoes, water needed. Winter time is more challenging for being careful and well dressed than summer person. Sometime, you are lucky to buy something in villages. You meet many local ethnic people selling souvenirs

Title: Cat Co 3 Beach
Description:
Just 2km from the center of the Cat ba shopping center is the most spectacular perfect white sand beach that no western tourists have any idea that it exists.
Catch a taxi to the " Pearl of the Orient Front entrance"
Opposite the entrance is a public walkway to this pristine beautiful white sand beach with sun umbrellas and sun lounges all along.'
Almost no westerners even know about this despite the fact that you could walk to it in 30 mins from the town.
The waves crash in, the view is spectacular, and the landscape is outstanding.
Most western tourists pass through Cat Ba without ever visiting this beach, which is the best-kept secret in town.

Title: Victory Cruises
Description: Had a fabulous 2 night/3day cruise on Halong Bay as part of a Mercury Vietnam Odyssey trip. Loved our cabin which was spacious enough for the trip. Very clean & most areas seemed to be well maintained. We had no issues. Middle deck had dining room and upper deck was for chilling. Sunbathing on the deck & nice drinks up there in the evening. Drinks were a wee bit pricey we thought. Food was amazing & beautifully presented & service professional. Lots of fish/seafood, but non fish people were well catered for too. Scenery was spectacular and the trips out in the tender were enjoyable. There was even night fishing. This cruise was one of the highlights of the whole trip. Thoroughly recommend.

Title: L.A SaigonTours
Description:
My tourguide was a young student , he was very hillarious and excellent knowledges, she took me to go around the Saigon city, from D1 to D3 to see the local area which was located in the central area and it made myseft really suprised because i have never seen it before, we went around the flower market and cambodian street food to try the cuisine and enjoyed the local beer. after that we went back to D4 to see the Saigon river in the night time which was very gogerous and mysterious . I highly recommend this tour to every one
Dear
Bela

Title: Hoi An Water Coconut Forest Tour
Description:
We went to the water coconut area by taxi who dropped us off at the restaurant where the basket boats start. The taxi then wait d for us to get back. Apparently this is the standard so they donâ€™t have to call a new one.

They bargained hard for the boat. Online says 150,000 and they started with asking for 800,000! In the end we paid 300,000 for 2 ppl. The tour was nice but has turned into a party tour rather than an eco tour imho. They essentially row you briefly through the grove and then to an open area with blaring music and ppl putting on a show. I tried to communicate that this is not what we wanted to see but with limited English it was difficult.

Aside from the â€˜partyâ€™ this was a nice few hours out of Hoi An.

Title: BRG Kings Island Lakeside Golf Course
Description:
A mature course that is located on an island. It is not too crowded, even on a Sunday. Had a great golf experience. A group of 11 of us had fun. The course was still quite well maintained. Some of the holes are quite challenging. The golfing staff was mostly helpful. While assigned caddies may vary with experience, generally, they know the course quite well. Line reading assistance was pretty good.

However, do be prepared to wait for your food at the club-house eatery. The staff is less motivated and unless you speak Vietnamese, ordering of food may be challenging as they tend to send the newby to take your order.

Overall, it is quite fun to golf in King's Island. Thank you

Title: Vietnam Today Travel
Description: I was recommended Vietnam Today Travel by my friends who have traveled with the company. I also tried to find some Vietnam agencies on internet. There are a lot of agencies which will promise you so much. It can make you very confused. Luckily, I got very helpful suggestions from friends. I firstly, requested the tour to Vietnam Today Travel and go the reply very fast (just in some hours). I was surprised that they called me and give me very useful information about my trip which made me secured.As soon as we landed into the airport, we were welcomed by a guide â€“ Mr Toan. The guide was excellent because, he always made me feel at ease straight away and gave us much information about the destinations. During the tour, the company staff called me some times to ensure my safety and suitability of the tour. All my questions were answered efficiently. I highly recommend this agency to any of my friends and will surely use their service again

Title: Xe Ã”m Tours
Description:
This Xe Om tours (motorbike tour) was fantastic. This is the best way to see the popular sights in Hoi An and surrounding areas. Being on a motorbike is actually much easier and comfortable than other transportations.

We visited Hoi An ancient town and several neighborhoods that not to be missed. Our tour guide, Mr. Vu was a very nice and informative man. We learned a lot about the history of Hoi An.

If you're visiting Hoi An, you should take "Xe Om Tours", definitely recommend this fantastic way to see all different types of places,

Thank you!

Title: ET - Pumpkin Travel
Description: Prior to my trip, i had read many negative reviews about this Train service so, it's an understatement to say i was really nervous. To my surprise, my cabin shared with 3 other strangers was pretty pleasant - the cabin was pretty clean and we saw no roaches. However, the cleanliness of the sheets is questionable as mine had a smell (travel with a sleeping bag liner) The AC was directly above our heads on the top bunk so, being frozen the entire night was very unpleasant. The public toilet was smelly but, if you're an Asian living in Asia like myself, it isn't anything too terrible, lol. The train left and arrived on good time. Hot drinks are available first thing in the morning, if you are ready to pay (20k per cup). Overall, the entire experience was much, much better than anticipated. I was lucky.

Title: Vung Tau Surf & SUP School
Description:
I usually like to support local vendors(this owner was Russian, his name was Aram) but had no other option on this beach. That man was the rudest business owner I have encountered while travelling. Unhelpful when asked about surf conditions and slightly annoyed even. No advice as to which areas to avoid and which to target as a beginner. No help whatsoever for new tourists to the area looking to get a feel of the conditions surrounding.
Finally, board rental prices were ridiculously expensive. I believe he quoted us 20 USD for 4 hours (extremely high relative to the Vietnamese currency).

Title: Kite With Me â€“ Kite & Surf School
Description:
Very nice place to start training Kite Surfing.
At first you can get a free lesson with instructor.

Nice and friendly people, strict as a teacher (as it should be) they'll take care about your safety and improving skills.

They are also very cool. Had a lot of fun on training, watched tv together at the evening, had a little party together.

Languages: English and Russian at least, but might be more.
Price: cheaper than most of the schools. I searched and spoke at least to 10 different schools before that.

Title: Má»™c backpacking
Description:
My Ha Giang trip with Má»™c backpacking was more like the trip with friends than with a travel agency. Both Bac and Harim from Má»™c backpacking were friendly, funny, kind, very professional motorcycle riders and very much flexible and responsive planners with the desire of the customers.

I did 3 nights 4 days motorcycle tour in the mountains of Ha Giang with a friend of mine. We had a very amusing landscape witnessed with great company. I suggest not to miss the Sunday market of Meo Vac. If Bac and Harim could have provided more information about the locality, history, culture and people and also more interactive activities with the local people this trip would have been excellent. Well, Má»™c backpacking is an aspiring group with a vision of sustainable natural based tourism in the country so I hope you will improve a lot targeting local as well as foreigner tourists. I wish you for greater success.
Thank you for the wonderful trip.

Title: Ninh Binh Trekking Tours
Description:
We had a trekking tour in Ninh Binh after Free Walking Tours in Hanoi. When we finished Hanoi Tour, A guide call me and inform me that they will pick-up me after 2 hours.Quickly ,we arrived Ninh Binh at 5.00 PM. It is wonderful. Ninh Binh is a nature and beautiful city. We walked around and received our room. Next day , we trekked Cuc Phuong Park. Good experience. After that, we rode bike around Bai Dinh. Our guide was cute and lovely.
Good service. We satisfied. Thank you

Later i realized she was not honest and charged me the full amount.

Defenetly would not recommend !!!

Title: Motorbike Dalat
Address: 19/28 Nam Ká»³ Khá»Ÿi NghÄ©a PhÆ°á»ng 1, ÄaÌ€ LaÌ£t 670000 Viá»‡t Nam
Description:
I hired a Honda XR150 but they had a good selection of manual, automatic and semi-automatic bikes. I hired for 2 days to go from Dalat to Nha Trang but had to cut my journey to just one and a half. Despite this, Mr. Phuc, one of the owners, sorted out the return without any issues, and I received a full refund of the deposit.

I paid around $15 a day but the smaller bikes are cheaper (but not as fun!).

The bike was great and Iâ€™d definitely recommend the XR150 if youâ€™re wanting to get off the beaten track.

In response to the other review, the actual address is in the alley 2 minutes away from the main road of Nam Khi Khoi Nghia and it might be quite difficult to find without guidance so just call the number that is on the website.

P.S I am just a traveller and Iâ€™m in no way affiliated with the company, I just felt giving a one star review without using the service seems harsh.

Description:
Unfortunately my snorkelling trip with Pacific Boat was unable to go ahead because of bad weather. I wanted to review this company, however, because if the trip had been even half as good as the communication, it would have been amazing!

From the time I first enquired, Henryâ€™s communication was outstanding, prompt, clear and respectful. The weather wasnâ€™t great during my three days on Phu Quoc but Henry stayed in touch and was ready to proceed with the trip right up until the last minute

Pacific Boat are clearly a company that put safety and customer experience over profit.

Thank you, Henry, for your kindness and honesty and for the great restaurant recommendation!

Better luck next time I visit! Lisa from NZ ğŸ˜Š

During a 1.5-day rent, my first bike broke down in the middle of the road and they came to replace another one for me, which again broke down the following day and required another replacement. Although the staff was nice and polite, I highly recommend looking elsewhere for better motorbikes for a more pleasant experience and your own safety.

Title: Panorama Cruise - 1 Day Trip
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 430 trÃªn 556 Chuyáº¿n tham quan báº±ng thuyá»n & thá»ƒ thao dÆ°á»›i nÆ°á»›c á»Ÿ HÃ  Ná»™i

Title: Hanoi Motorcycle
Address: 95 HÃ m Tá»­ Quan, HoÃ n Kiáº¿m 33 - Ma May - Hoan Kiem - Ha Noi, HÃ  Ná»™i 10000 Viá»‡t Nam
Description:
A guy from this store went to the hostel where I was to show me the motorcycle. He seems to be a nice guy and also give you some informations. But he is a good actor, don't get fooled. Do not make business with them as I did. That's why I'm writing, to alarm you.

I paid 250 USD for a motorcycle that was supposed to be trustable. However, after driving 300k, I had to change the shock absorber (40 USD more). The oil was leaking all the time and the front wheel was off-axis. Really dangerous.

I have never been so scammed in my life. I was supposed to finish my trip in Ho Chi Minh, but the motorbike was falling apart in Da Nang.

So, if I can give you one honest advise, I say: do not buy a motorcycle there. It's not only about money, is about safety.
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 692 trÃªn 960 Hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng ngoÃ i trá»i á»Ÿ HÃ  Ná»™i

Title: Vietnam TravelMART Da Lat
Description: Vorsicht hohe Nebenkosten - wie das fahren mit der Hochbahn an den WasserfÃ¤llen - oder das Erdbeer pflÃ¼gen - die hohen GebÃ¼hren sind vor Ort zu bezahlen. Der TouristenfÃ¼hrer spricht mit starken akzent.
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 11 trÃªn 24 PhÆ°Æ¡ng tiÃªÌ£n giao thÃ´ng á»Ÿ ÄaÌ€ LaÌ£t

Title: Asean Travel Smiles
Description:
During our stay in Ho Chi Minh we discovered this small travel agent. We went in as we had a few things we were interested in and found the people here were extremely helpful and polite. One thing we booked was a dinner cruise and to our surprise after we were picked up by taxi the travel agent Mrs Ngoc was there to greet us. Mrs Ngoc escorted us onto the boat, found our table, and took photos for us. Through the evening Mrs Ngoc checked on us and made sure everything was satisfactory.
We also booked bus tickets, private tour to Long Tan, and a show at the Opera House. We were not disappointed.
When we walk by the shop we always get a friendly hello from the staff.
I would not hesitate to recommend them.
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 97 trÃªn 155 Chuyáº¿n tham quan báº±ng thuyá»n & thá»ƒ thao dÆ°á»›i nÆ°á»›c á»Ÿ ThÃ nh phá»‘ Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh

Title: Há»™i An Travel
Description:
First of all picked up 40 mins late
A lot of waiting until we actually got on the boat to Cham island
We made several stops on the way, with not much to see - more time wasted getting everyone on and off the boat!
Eventually went snorkelling. Coral is all dead and very few fish. A lot of boat trips go here (about 15 in the same area). The overcrowding might have been due to the Da nang fireworks this weekend.
Then told to get out after 40 mins
We went back to a beach for lunch. Again overcrowded due to all the boats going there. But had a good selection of different Vietnamese dishes which were all included in the price

Title: Danang Backpacker Tourist
Description:
Booked via this company to take myself and bike from Dalat to Nha Trang to avoid to two day journey via bike.

Arrived at the office then Informed to follow a very slow moving car to the actual pick up point outside of town.

The coach arrived and the bike was torn apart and chucked under the bus when I told them to be more careful they became aggressive.

The bus was worn out with a broken toilet that stunk for the whole ten hour journey.

Dumped at the side of the road at 3 am with the bikes somewhat re assembled.

When the sun came up the damage to the bike was clear and it was a real mess. Cracked panels deep scratches bent levers. All caused by the transport of the bikes on the coach.

Asked for compensation for damages to get a crap response stating the hire company wonâ€™t care.

Complete con man so had to spend 100 dollars replacing parts before returning the bike.

Do not make the same mistake take the train I beg you !

Title: Diamond Bay Golf
Description:
The WORST golfing experience of my life. I'll explain. I played last week (Nov 3, 2022). I went out as a single. I was prepared to wait...no problem. The caddie, however, didn't want to wait. We started out on hole no. 10. No problem. Then, because there was a group in the fairway on no. 11, the caddie drove us back to hole no. 7. I played that. Then there was a group on no. 8, so we drove to no. 13. Played that. Then didn't want to wait on no. 14 so we drove to 16. Just driving all over the course. I teed off on 16, and then a foursome came up behind me. The caddie said that they should play through me because it was their turn?!! A FOURSOME PLAYS THROUGH A SINGLE!!. I'm pissed now. I say skip the hole to the caddie so we drive back to the first tee. It was wide open but as I am about to tee off a FIVESOME comes up and the caddie says that they should play through because its THEIR turn. A FIVESOME PLAYS THROUGH A SINGLE.
At this point I have been driving around the whole course for 1.5 hours and played four holes!!

I quit! I went back to the clubhouse and complained about the insanity. They didn't quite get it. I told them I was quitting. Instead of doing the right thing they insisted that I still pay for 9-hole rate. Horrible.

The course itself was mediocre. It was probably nice at some point but poorly maintained. Lots of water around the course but it was more like grey toxic sludge.

Overall, a horrible experience. There are other courses around the area. Vinpearl and KN are both nicer and professionaly run.

Stay away from this place!!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 119 trÃªn 196 Hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng ngoÃ i trá»i á»Ÿ Nha Trang

Title: Sun World Ba Na Hills
Description:
Starting with the positives, it was a welcome drop in temperature from the rest of our trip. Some of the buildings were great to grab a photo next to.

We went with our daughters aged 7 and 4. The staff at the entrance were keen to charge as much as they could but then once inside our kids had very, very little they could go on. Even the soft play area was restricted for the 4 year old to something more suitable for a 2 year old.

Walking an age between pretty looking buildings which were as devoid of content as the park was of soul.

I managed to go on the 4D experience whilst my wife went on the (baby)soft play with the kids as she'd gone on something aimed at the over 130cm and like much of ba na hills it was underwhelming.

It's got the foundations of a great attraction but needs to up its game in terms of content.

De gene bij wie je boekt spreekt uitstekend engels. De boot is goedkoop in vergelijking met andere tours. Het eten is uitstekend. Het snorkelen bij turle island is zeer mooi.

Title: Indochina Explorer Tours
Description:
I have just completed a 13 day motorcycle tour of Vietnam conducted by Explore Indochina who are based in Hanoi. We were provided with 650cc Russian Ural motorcycles which proved to be a great bike with low down torque. There were 5 customers in the group plus our tour guide, Glen, and our mechanic, Diep. We were all riding Ural motorbikes.

It was a well planned tour with fantastic scenery, good to excellent accommodation and of course plenty of excellent food. Nothing was a problem for the Company's staff and we were treated very well indeed.

I can recommend this company to anybody who is considering a motorbike tour of Vietnam.

Title: Area11DiverPQ Diving Center
Description:
I booked 6 dives in advance. One day before I showed up to discuss the details and pay. The next day it turned out that the plan changed and they left earlier without me. I was informed about it by email, which I hadnâ€™t checked that day so I didnâ€™t know about that. If I were the organiser I would rather expect a response. And since they didnâ€™t get it, they should assume that I was not informed and not change the plan. I wasted my day, because it was too late to organise anything elsewhere. I ended up only with 5 dives on the next two days (I decided to book one more to make up for the lost day).
Dives were rather okay, but no one bothered to ask the divers to try e.g. the fins or wetsuits to check if they suit well. On the second day I ended up with different fins which were either too big (no one likes to swim in too big fins which are falling from your feet all the time) or small. We were already on the boat so it was not possible to replace them. On the first day I asked if I can leave my wetsuit with them and if they could bring it on the second day - they said no problem. Obviously that was my mistake because they forgot about it on the second day.
During the dives the dive guide was swimming rather fast so sometimes I felt like I have to hurry after him instead of admiring the reef.
Oh, and by the way no one returned me my wetsuit or even wrote an email after to check if I want it back. Also a surprising thing was that I paid more for an additional dive that my partner.
All in all, people were rather nice but organisation was so poor that I definitely would not recommend this dive centre.

Title: HÃ  Thá»‹ Kiá»u Linh
Description:
Note this has nothing to do with the travel agency, but like father like son...

!!CAUTION SCAM!!

DO NOT BUY YOUR BIKES HERE

I'd give him actually 0 stars. He has a shop in town and a garage slightly outside of Hanoi, so we thought of him as a good man.
Not knowing any better, we bought three bikes off of him, two of said bikes apparently STOLEN or with stolen parts.

We drove from Hanoi to Ho Chi Minh luckily without getting checked by the Police, because they would have taken the bikes from us. Unlucky for us we checked the numbers from the blue card with the numbers on the chassis and number plates.
The engine number however didn't match and we did not recognize that. He sold us the bikes without any further mentioning of that.

So now in Ho chi Minh we have troubles selling our bikes at any reasonable price and every Mechanik keeps telling us they would only buy them for parts.

Yes we did not check the number. We didn't know. But that's honestly a big inhumane mistreatment and the only thing we can do now, is to make sure you are not getting harmed.

You should go to a vendor with a shop and pay a little more to actually get a good and safe bike, if you want to travel for 3000km through Vietnam.

Linh's Motorbike is not one of them.

Thank you for your time and reading this. Stay safe.

Title: Danang Travel
Description: We stopped over in Danang which is a large city with some beautiful sights around. We traveled from Hue to Danang. When we reached Danang it was very difficult to find travel agents to book our tours. We were close to the city but still could not find any agents. We had to finally book our tour to Hoi An and My son and our train tickets to Ho Chi Minh through our hotel which was more expensive and a private taxi.We did not have this problem before as we have been travelling through South east Asia for 5months.

Title: Cu Lao Cham Tour
Description: I traveled this breathtaking island this summer through TN tourism. I used 1-day-tour service. They picked me up at the hotel at 8am. Next, the 24-seat-bus drove about 40' to the port. Then, we took the cano to the island. This boat made me impressive and relaxing although it is shaken by wave. We enjoyed our time on the island. I dove under the sea by using the scuba diving machines. It's no doubt that this is one of the most unforgettable moments in my life.

Title: Pacific Boat Viet Nam
Description:
El guia era muy amable y nos conto muchas anecdotas
La recogida en el hotel fue un lujo
La parte del snorkel muy bien pero a nosotros nos falto un poco mas
Debido a una tormenta tuvimos que acortar nuestro viaje y fue una lastima
La comida la hicimos en tierra pero la verdad que muy bien.
El tour es muy recomendable pero la parte de snorkel no es muy avanzada
Aun asi el material de snorkel era de buena calidad.

Title: Motorbike Rental
Address: 31 PhÃºc TÃ¢n, HÃ  Ná»™i 100000 Viá»‡t Nam
Description:
Tony is probably the worst guy when it comes to motorbikes. We agreed about a price and told him that we will pick up the bikes next morning. He came with three different bikes but they looked fine.
After a couple of hours I realized that there was something wrong with the gas and even worse, with the breaks as well. Sometimes my rear brake didnâ€™t work at all, which is probably the most dangerous issue because the front break was pretty weak as well.
So we fixed other things and decided to sell the bikes after three weeks.
He promised me, that he will buy the bikes for a good price (I showed him a screenshot from his advert on travelswop.com)

Before we arrived in Hanoi I text him a couple of times, but he never replied. So I started to annoy him until he said, he will buy them for 60% back. He also sent me a screenshot where it says that he buys the bikes in Hanoi for 65-70%.

When we arrived in Hanoi he suddenly started to play stupid and wanted to tell me, that he thought we were going to HCM (I showed him all the screenshots). Of course he kept playing stupid. After we finally negotiated a price, he gave us the money in cash but got really nervous because other customers were around.
The worst was probably, that he laughed when I told him about the issue with the breaks. They never checked the motorbikes at all.

Please be careful with this guy.

Title: Asia Mystika Travel
Description: I had the opportunity to visit Halong Bay and it was a great experience. The bay itself is truly beautiful, with towering limestone cliffs emerging from the clear green waters. I would like to give my thanks to Mr. Thang and the Asia Mystika team for welcoming and supporting me the whole trip.

Title: Trekking Travel - Day Tours
Description:
First off... I have no positive!
We opted for the open bus ticket from Sinhtourist to travel 1 month in Vietman as it would give us the best freedom to see all the sights. We choose Hanoi - Hue - Danang - Hoi an - Nha Trang - Dalat - HCMC.
After being picked up from our hotel and taken to the night bus to Hue we learned that it wasnâ€™t this company but trekking travel that had given us the open ticket vouchers. So basically Sinhtourist sell you off to other companies and you donâ€™t even know! Therefore when everything goes wrong.... which it did, no one will take responsibility and you get stranded in a city... with tickets you canâ€™t use! My advice and please take it.... just book the buses or transfers individually through your hotel or hostel. It doesnâ€™t cost much more and youâ€™ll be covered by them!
Quick overview of our approx 2000km...
Hanoi to hue - on time... ok 12 hour sleeper bus... horrid toilet... a local was sick in there all night, and locals sleeping in all the floor spaces. They stop all the time to drop off packages and collect... I just donâ€™t want to know...
Hue to Danang - 45 mins late... short 2 hours, Standard bus
Danang to Hoi An - after waiting 1.5 hours for this bus, which only take 45 mins to Hoi An, the women yelled at us to help unpack all the stuff they drop off, she snatched our bags and my partners hoodie and threw them on the ground and his hoodie in poo pile puddle... we got a grabcar!
Hoi An to Nha Trang - as the flights were only 30â‚¬ each we flew instead of dreading another 12 night bus with random stops and doggie packages being exchanged.
Then in Nha Trang the company didnâ€™t exist! Went to the address in our book... nope. Went to 2 other bus places... no one knew trekking travel. After hours of searching we went back to the original address which is occupied by the Hanh cafe. After like 20 phone calls and another hour the guy gave us our two final journeys through them. He just ripped our book in half and said no good.
Havenâ€™t taken those two buses yet, but wanted to get this review in to warn everyone especially backpackers like myself thatâ€™s itâ€™s a big NO!

Title: Ã”ng
Description:
I recently had a ticket with your airline and needed to change the travel date. Following the instructions on your website, I proceeded to make the necessary changes online, for which I was charged $165.

To my dismay, after just an hour, I received an email from your company stating that my request for a date change had been rejected, citing an exorbitant changing fee of $1300. This sudden change in the fee is not only unreasonable but also completely unacceptable. I trusted the price offered by your website and made the necessary arrangements accordingly.

Furthermore, I have had to engage in multiple conversations through your customer service chat, which has proven to be an incredibly frustrating and time-consuming experience. The representatives I interacted with displayed a lack of professionalism and were consistently rude. This kind of behavior is not what I expect from a reputable company, and it has left me feeling extremely dissatisfied.
